title: A shame
text:
In terms of positives: Good location. Comfy bed. 

In terms of negatives: windows were dirty and poorly painted. Furniture was broken. Multiple electrical sockets were dangerous and broken. No hot water for one evening. I was told the manager would be informed - but no one followed up.

title: The James, place2B in NYC
text: Stayed at the James for a birthday celebration during the magical period of  New Year's Eve. Best New York experience ever. Super located, central but still quiet, cozy-modern-perfectly cleaned-and-spacy bedroom, great italian restaurant and facilities (fitness, rooftop...), free coffee available every morning and above all : amazing classy and personalized service before, during and after the stay, special attention from the staff for our birthday, good tips to visit and enjoy NYC, big up to Haylee for the great support and professionalism. Will definitely be back to the James, what else?

title: Horrible service and rude staff
text: upgrading 1 member of team for no reason. could not find my room. 500 US dollar incidentals ..still open 4 days after no payment. No invoice because they claim the 3rd party. booking.com has it which is incorrect info. last october stayed in another hotel and they friendly printed out my invoice.

title: Excellent
text:
Excellent service, personalized treatment, friendliness, family atmosphere and the employees are empathetic,  a high level of courtesy and respect towards the guests and the organization is incredible.
I am Fascinated

title: Our family had a wonderful stay
text:
We had an amazing trip to NYC. It was the first time our 4 daughters (all middle and high school ages) had been to the city.  The James was a great hotel for us. The suite wasn't huge (not sure that many hotel rooms in NYC are), but it was just fine for us.  We had 2 sleep on the pullout couch and that worked fine for us.  The pullout bed wasn't the best, but my girls made it work.  Having the table and seating area was super helpful as was having 2 bathrooms. My girls really appreciated the lighting in the bathrooms. The room was clean and we really appreciated the daily maid service .

Another great thing about the James was the location. It's not a far walk from Times Square and all the action there if you want to walk, but it's also just a couple blocks from a subway stop which made getting farther up and downtown super easy. There are some great coffee shops close by as well as some really good restaurants away from Times Square and the more touristy areas. It's also across the street from a Whole Foods which was nice for us to get snacks to have in the room. 

The few things that weren't stellar were the morning coffee (it was fine, but we like stronger coffee so for us it was like bean water), the bed in the pullout couch was a little broken (although we made it work), and the queen beds were more firm than we like them (although that's a personal preference and my husband actually enjoyed that).  Overall, The James was great, especially for the price and I would gladly stay here again.

title: Very welcoming and comfortable
text: We arrived to a warm welcome and our room ready.  Very comfortable room.  Great guest area and wine hour is a nice touch.  The hotel felt boutique and the location worked well, with bars and restaurants locally.

title: Great location in the heart of NYC
text:
Lovely service and great spot to explore NYC for my hen do. Service and food at Restaurant Scarpetta was great. 

The James is situated in a lively neighborhood, but it's NYC!... it offered easy access to popular attractions and trendy spots to enjoy our stay.

title: Top Hotel
text:
Every time i go to NYC this is my favorite Hotel.
The Location is top. 
Great service, great Ambiance and the Restaurant Scarpetta and the Seville are 5 stars.
I will keep coming and recommend to all my friends.

title: My New York favorite
text: This hotel hands down is my favorite in NY; staff, room quality, restaurant, and common amenities (lobby, coffee bar and happy hour) provide a welcoming experience that never disappoints.   It is my first choice (quick walk from Moynihan Train Hall, access to subway lines, great location for walking on East Side or getting to West side as well).  Staff is top notch!

title: Be AWARE! Very unwelcome
text: My recent experience at The James Hotel New York was deeply unsatisfactory. I encountered unwelcoming service and was given a room that did not match my reservation, a discrepancy confirmed by Booking.com. When I voiced my concerns, the interaction escalated due to the staff’s unprofessional conduct, culminating in my unjust removal from the property. The ordeal ended with a rude manager who not only failed to address the issues but also contributed to the negative experience, highlighting a severe lapse in hospitality and professionalism

title: Excellent hotel in a nice location
text: We normally stay in another hotel few blocks away. We booked James as the other one was not available and we were pleasantly surprised. Service was good and the room was very clean. Not only that - room was  quite large as well. Location was excellent with nearby restaurants and coffee in Flatiron. Will definitely stay again.

title: Nice location but expensive extras and a very rude receptionist.
text:
We stayed at The James as a family of 4 with two 18year old twins.

The hotel was ok itself. Great location for our trip to NY. 

We had to have 2off rooms to accommodate us. We had originally booked 1off Queen room ( 1 queen bed for wife and daughter) and 1 twin queen ( 2 queen beds for myself and son). We booked this all through TUI. 

Upon arrival I was offered an upgrade which I took. After a confusing conversation with the receptionist  I thought we were upgrading our single queen room to a suite for $125 per night.  This meant my wife and daughter would get a much better room. 

However, when I opened our room I found only 1 queen bed. I headed back down to reception to explain. The receptionist said she could upgrade the 2nd room to a room with two queens for $50 per night. I explained that had I have known I’d not have bothered as now I had to upgrade both rooms! 

Upon entering the new room I instantly saw it was dirty. There was a towel on the bed that appeared to be used, white paper looking debris all over the carpet, a flannel on the bathroom floor that had been wet and had dried and the most surprising a large tablet of some kind on the table. 

I headed back down to reception to let them know I wanted a new room. 

3rd time lucky we were up on the 12th floor in a room that we were happy with.

During the check in fiasco somehow the hotel got 2off card details from me. A debit card and a credit card. They had charged me sizeable fees on both cards. When I challenged this I was informed by a particularly rude lady on reception that  I was going to be charged $50 dollars per room per night “hotel facility fees” and $100 per night per room “incidental fees”. She actually said  it’s nowhere near enough-as if she knew how much we were going to spend.

TUI had not mentioned the addition fees which I will be taking up with them upon our return to the UK. 

The rooms were nice. The bar next to the hotel was nice. We ate there for breakfast 3 times. But it was very expensive. 

Overall our hotel bill for the 2off upgrades, 3off breakfasts  ( for 4 people) and a few items from the room mini bar was over $1900!!! This translates to about £1600. 

Be aware!! Very expensive hotel

title: GREAT STAY !!!
text: Great stay ! Thank you Manager Eric and Evelyn for a fantastic room upgrade with a great view of Madison Avenue ! Great staff and great hotel vibe. Enjoyed the live band in the lobby and the location is amazing. Will be back ! Also a fun night club downstairs !

title: ANOTHER GREAT STAY AT THE JAMES
text:
THE JAMES IS OUR FAVORITE HOTEL IN NYC.
THE SERVICE IS PERFECT.
ROOMS VERY CLEAN
EVERYONE WHO WORKS AT THE HOTEL REALLY CARE TO MAKE SURE EVERYTHING IS PERFECT FOR THE GUEST.
THE COFFEE AND FRESH FRUIT SETUP IN THE LOBBY IS LIKE BEING AT HOME.
IN THE EVENING, THE HAPPY HOUR IS PERFECT.
WE CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK

title: Lovely Spot - great lobby for gathering with friends
text: Great hotel that I would love to stay in again. The location is excellent for reaching just about every corner of Manhattan and its great sites. I love the beaux arts look of the hotel - it feels very special arriving for your stay. The lobby is a great spot for meeting up with friends and resting in between jaunts, without feeling overly hectic, and the happy hour wine and snacks is a nice treat. The room decor is fresh and unique, and everything was very clean and well maintained. My only complaint is their $150 pet charge which I dare say is not "pet friendly". I stayed here without my dog - would love to return with her but not at that cost.

title: Marvellous low-key hotel, stylish large rooms, good amenities
text: Everything about the hotel was lovely, for middle to higher range NYC hotel. The rooms are large and a relative bargain. That's hard to match, as is the location, and the superb restaurant Scarpetto. Attentive service and very clean rooms. BUT NOTE, whilst there's a fabulous well-stocked bar in the room, there is no coffee or tea-making facility which was quite a nuisance for us. The bathroom was adequate, but tended to the shower leaked somewhat into the room. Very large, comfortable bed. We were in a Deluxe Guest Corner King, well appointed, large room with sofa, table, and additional chair.

title: Lovely Hotel in Convenient Location
text: This is a very comfortable hotel with superb staff, it's own superb restauran and great coffee shops, and aWhole Foods Grocery and all kinds of conveniences nearby.  You can walk to the Village or shopping along lower fifth, it's an easy bus, taxi or subway ride to the upper east side museums.

title: A good place to stay in NYC
text:
Well located in mid-Manhattan.
You can easily walk to Broadway.
Subway and bus 3 mn away from the hotel.
Be aware of 40 USD daily charge for extras (morning free coffee and tea and late afternnoon wines).

title: Nice enough, but LOUD
text:
I upgraded to a corner King. It was sizable for a NYC hotel room, but oddly empty. Large open space where maybe there was once a desk? The decor/furnishings left a bit to be desired. Everything looked kind of banged up. The photos on the website make it looks so sleek and chic. It's fine.

I'm originally from NYC, and I now live in a big city right on a busy street and on the airline route, but the noise from the street in our room was LOUD. It was honking taxis for much of the night, and then cars going over a loose manhole or something. We'd already settled in and unpacked by the time we realized this late at night, so we didn't feel like swapping out. I ended up putting in my earphones and listening to white noise, which helped somewhat. Oddly, the windows are not the noise reducing, double-pane type, which I would expect from this level of hotel. In fact, if you sat over by the window, you could feel the wind coming in! I wish I hadn't upgraded.

The staff was nice, especially at the reception desk.

title: Not a four star hotel.
text:
We stayed at the James Hotel from 21st to 27th December. We booked a standard king room but decided to upgrade to a king deluxe as a special occasion -extra $60/night. 

At check in, the person on reception hurried through the process, took my credit card and charged over £1000. I realise that hotels put a charge on a card but it would have been polite to tell me the amount. She mentioned that there was complimentary coffee/tea/fruit offered in the lobby in the morning and wine and treats in the afternoon. She spoke so quickly that my husband and I didn't really take it in.  The first two mornings, apples and oranges were indeed offered in addition to a small selection of teas and coffee. However the next 4 mornings of our stay, no fruit was on offer and only one kind of tea. Other treats were never on offer throughout our stay. This in itself is very poor for a 4 star hotel. At check out, when I asked what the 40 dollar/night facility fee was for I was told that it was for wifi, gym, drinks in the lobby. As said above I was told that drinks were complimentary. I also thought wifi and use of gym was complimentary. 

The room was basic/dated/shabby - most definitely not luxurious or deluxe as advertised - see photo. There was only 1 bathrobe and pair of slippers. There were no drinking glasses/cups (neither cardboard or china). There was no blue tooth speaker as advertised. The bathroom was shabby - see photo attached -ceiling of shower cubicle - and freezing (no heating).  I had wanted a bathtub rather than shower, so I phoned reception and they found a room with a bathtub. We moved to that room which was much smaller and the bath was actually a raised shower tray, about 30cm deep. It was stained. We asked to return to the previous room as it was, at least bigger. I asked the woman at reception whether the second room was also deluxe and she said yes - she said all the rooms have a different layout.

The wardrobe in our room was very small - see photo. There was also nowhere to store our suitcases. I called Reception and asked for another bathrobe and pair of slippers. I asked if we could have a kettle and some cups and teabags and asked where the blue tooth speaker was - the man I spoke to said it might be in the drinks cabinet - it wasn't. I politely asked if I could have a pottery cup and saucer and teaspoon, not too much to ask for in a 4 star hotel. There were no drinking glasses or cups of any type. Eventually I received 1 pottery cup and a tablespoon which was removed the next day when the room was cleaned. I asked for replacements which we were told would be delivered in 5 minutes. An hour or so later, we had to make another phone call to reception and we eventually received 2 cups, one tablespoon and a small jug of milk, two hours after our initial request

 I phoned again about the blue tooth speaker and we were told that someone would bring one. The person who brought it couldn't get it to work and thought it had to be charged but didn't have a charger. He used the lead I had for my mobile phone. It still didn't work. The next day I took it to reception and explained the situation and the woman said she would have it set up. I said to her that the website clearly says that there is a bluetooth speaker. She said people are stealing them. When we returned later to the hotel nothing had been set up. I phoned reception and finally someone came to the room and sorted it out. I think this was 2 days after our arrival. 

Throughout our stay we asked for basic amenities which should be a given in a 4 star hotel. If we had wanted to spend less and stay in a 2/3 star hotel, we would have booked one. My husband and I are utterly disgusted at the service/amenities at the hotel. The only thing that was acceptable was the lobby area. The staff on reception were not particularly friendly or informative and do not deliver on what they promise, which frankly is very disrespectful to their guests, however the people offering to help with luggage/taxis were nice.

Could be a great hotel given its location. 
.

title: Great Hotel and Location in NYC
text:
Just want to let you know how much I enjoyed our recent stay at the Hotel. I also sent a note to your automated system. I would like to mention all the staff and how great they are as Hotel Representatives for we travelers. I appreciate them and their exceptional service. Their welcome home is a nice touch. I would like to mention Camile as well who has been there for me on all my bookings whenever I am in NYC. She makes a difference for a great stay. I hope others recognize her as well. Thanks for everything. I will let you know when planning to be there again in June or July. The other 4 who stayed this time enjoyed the Hotel and its location well. I'm sure they will visit again.

 We have used Danny's Car Service to and from the Hotel many times these past years and appreciate he and all the other drivers who have shuttled us back and forth from the airport. 

Thanks for everything and a shout out to Eric the James Nomad Hotel Manager.

title: Great stay in Nomad
text: We had a great experience at The James! Everyone went above and beyond. The morning coffee and evening wine were such a nice addition to an already great stay!  The location was perfect as it was central to anywhere you'd want to go in Manhattan. It was a short walk to Union Square and Madison Square Park. It was also a quick walk to Bagels and Schmear which is one of the very best places to get bagels in Manhattan...we went every morning!

title: Better other options for better value
text:
It's an OK boutique hotel in NoMad but I've also stayed at the competing Royalton Park Avenue which IMHO has a much better offering.

Pros
* Good restaurant near the lobby
* Ideally located in Manhattan

Cons
* Expensive breakfast (and they even charge extra for room service)
* Small rooms even in NYC standards
* Windows are very dirty!
* If you go in the summer, no pool

title: The best on the city
text: Loved the hotel, it was elegant, clean, and comfortable. The staff were friendly and the overall vibe was relaxing and classy. Its location was perfect, very convenient for what I was looking for. I loved the lobby area, great place to meet and socialize while having coffee or wine. Will definitely recommend this hotel to family/friends. This is where I will stay when visiting New York again!

title: Great hotel but bad service
text: The hotel is perfectly located, far from the crowds but close to several landmarks and great restaurants. The building is beautiful and the room was of good size. However the value added services were well below expectations and were not resolved during our stay. For a hotel of this category it’s unacceptable.

title: Very good, but front desk staff aloofness hold this hotel back from being great
text:
This is a cumulative review. I have stayed at The James NoMad MANY times over the years, both for work and fun. I usually attach on a personal few days to a work trip. Most recently did this in mid-Dec '23.
The Pros: 
-Big rooms by NYC standards. I love the NoMad/Flatiron location as central to get to most things I want to do in NY uptown or downtown. 
-Booking on The James website always yields a good rate/deal which I appreciate
-Most (not all) of the bathrooms are large with a lot of counter space (esp. nice when more than 1 person in the room)
-Door staff and housekeeping have almost always been friendly, which is nice and makes for a good impression
-Wine hour in the lobby is decent and a nice touch in the midst of Manhattan and coffee downstairs too in the morning (but would rather have a Nespresso maker in the room, if I'm honest) -- also it's a great lobby space that gets used for lounging
-Plenty of working elevators
-Bathrobes (and slippers) in room -- sometimes have to call to ask for them, but I love a hotel bathrobe so gets a big plus for me
-Nice old-school feel to this hotel w/o being stuffy and has modern furniture/artwork 
-Peloton bike (2) in gym
The Cons:
-I have stayed here many times over the years, as mentioned ,and the front desk staff never acknowledges my return and are often cold -- a missed opportunity to make a good impression. This one is so simple to get right with a little care by management.
-When I book a double room I email directly to request a room with a closet (some only have armories), the last two stays this hasn't been honored. Before my last stay I received a nice reply that the management was noting it and looked forward to my return, however that room was not what I got. I did get a nice note and bottle of wine we didn't drink (thank you!), but would have appreciated the closet and maybe a greeting by woman that checked me in as well, who has checked me in and out many times.
-Bell staff, while almost always friendly, aren't always at entrance and you have to go up steps to lobby with your luggage.
-Bath towels need replacing -- thin and scratchy and on my last stay had one with a huge hole in it. 
-Gym is not well maintained -- make sure it has towels restocked by each early morning and cleaner for the equipment (!!!)
-Hotel rooms are a little tired...a deeper cleaning of carpets would help
-Not always enough hotel staff at front desk - esp. during checkout/checkin times
-Would be nice if there was an amenity for hotel guests to get a drink at the bar in basement of hotel (Seville) or at least preferential option to book a seat or get spot at bar there or in restaurant
Overall, I recommend and will likely stay again, but I would appreciate a little more graciousness from front desk and care in rooms they book guests into. Like I said, this is such a simple thing to get right and goes a long way w/o a lot of effort or expense by hotel.

title: Not worth the money
text:
We came to the James Nomad in December 2023 as we had stayed at the James in Soho a few times in the past and loved everything about our stays there. The service there was fantastic, the little amenities like fresh cookies and there always being water, coffee and tea throughout the day plus wonderful pastries in the morning not to mention the cocktails and appetizers in the evening. The rooms were large and beautiful with floor to ceiling windows.

We knew this location would be different and looked forward to a different James experience.

We booked through your hotel website, even though I could have gotten the room cheaper on alternate sites. Your website shows the Jimmy suite King as 475 ft. and the Jimmy suite king deluxe as 545 with better furnishings and obviously more space.

We were traveling with our son for his birthday so we booked the deluxe for more space. When we checked into our room it said our room was only 475 square feet so I requested being moved to a room that had a view different than that of an exterior wall of another hotel room and one in our category. We were told this was it and everything was sold out so we couldn’t move.

I witnessed others checking in after us into suite categories as well as others changing their rooms.

I then checked online to see if rooms were available and some were. When I mentioned this I was told repeatedly that we were in the correct room. If that’s the case I’m not sure why the website is factually inaccurate nor how you can call what we had a suite let alone deluxe. I will attach pictures. 

A few small other details, we never had soap in the dispenser, our phone didn’t work the first night. Robes or bedding for the pull out was not in our room and didn’t come the first night when requested.

Our son has never complained about a pullout couch bed and has always enjoyed them but couldn’t sleep on this one. I tried it and it was horrible, springs sticking up and digging into you. He slept on the couch the following two nights but said it wasn’t exactly comfortable that way either.

Lastly my husband and I went to the Seville to have a drink our first night, it was early and empty yet we were treated like interlopers. The hostess was extremely snotty when we didn’t have a reservation. She finally sighed and said I guess we could sit at the bar, there were only two other people in there when we sat down.

The drinks were good though and the bar staff was great. We tried to go back our last night with 2 friends and were told they couldn’t accommodate us. Again the hostess was very rude. This was disappointing as we are staying at the hotel and our friends wanted to experience it.

All in all the James Nomad was not remotely worth the amount we paid. Nothing like our experience in Soho. I honestly feel we should be refunded a significant portion of what we paid for our stay.

title: Friendly place but past its best?
text:
We were unfortunate enough to have a four hour plane delay and told the hotel but check in at 2 am seemed a very caught in the hop affair.

Room good - small like most in NYC by nice big if soft bed. Big mini bar taking up lots of space - no free coffee or tea just the mini bar with $11 for a bottle of water. Some plug sockets didn’t work and the lights have a mind of their own. Hard to get the room cool.
Good location for the city and days out after a shower in the small tight bathroom

No shower gel and has to ask on two separate days to get it refilled. Face cloths appeared and disappeared and room has one chair so no where to sit other than the bed if you are a couple

There are better places at this pricw

title: Not trustable
text:
I had a nightmare in this hotel. First, the picture is fake, this is not the building ( Flat Iron) of the hotel and, also, is far away from the hotel. 
I gave my credit card for guarantee on checkin, as I do in every hotel around the world, and I said to recepcionist, clearly, that I WILL NOT pay the bill with that card. 
The bad situation started few minutes ago, when they CHARGED the whole amount (U$ 3.514,00) . I went to them and it was said to me that was to check and it will be canceled in few hours. Not happened!! They not cancel the payment!!! The hotel refunded only when we pay the bill, at the checkout. So, they charged twice, lied to us all the time. I had so many problems. All the charges of CC and bank  taxes were charged of me. 
Definetly, it is not trustable hotel, never in my life I could imagine so many problems staying there!!!

title: I recommend
text: Charming hotel located spacious room staff generally available unlimited coffee in the morning nice and happy hours in the evening great! One thing to improve is the sofa bedding, you can feel the springs! not comfortable for children/teenagers..

title: Nice cosy hotel
text:
"I recently stayed at the James New York – NoMad hotel and was impressed by the small but efficiently designed rooms. The compact layout maximizes space, offering a cozy yet functional atmosphere. It's ideal for solo travelers or couples looking for a well-designed space in the heart of Manhattan.

The hotel's location is truly convenient, providing easy access to key attractions and vibrant neighborhoods. Whether it's exploring the nearby iconic landmarks or enjoying the local dining scene, the James NoMad puts you in the center of it all.

However, I did notice room for improvement in terms of cleanliness. While the overall tidiness was acceptable, attention to detail could enhance the guest experience. I believe a more thorough approach to cleanliness would elevate the stay and align with the hotel's commitment to providing a premium experience.

Despite this, the James NoMad remains a solid choice for those seeking a smartly designed room in a prime location. With a few adjustments in the cleanliness department, it could easily become a top-tier accommodation option in the bustling city."

title: Good room let down by poor hospitality
text: Room was compact but expected it in NY. Very clean and housekeeping couldn't be faulted. “Breakfast” was a disappointment, good coffee but just a a bowl of apples, no pastries as mentioned. Evening wine the same, lacking above 2 basic wines. Given there is the gut renching “resort fee” which really grates I’d expect more! Went to Scarpetta for a drink, very busy but served quickly. Cocktail making not great and so didn't return. Went to go to The Seville and was greeted with a door person who ignored us whilst clipping shut the velvet rope and for the other door dragon to bark at us we didnt have a reservation and to go away.  We weren’t aware of this policy. I don't support businesses that treat people in that manner. We never returned nor ever would, New York is full of options. Would we return to this hotel? Great location but lot of competition nearby,  The Ace as an example. Room was great but hospitality in the bars was just plain ignorant and rude.

title: Peaceful Stay in the Middle of Everything
text:
I’ve lost track of how many times I’ve stayed at The James. A frequent visitor to NYC for work and pleasure, though, it’s one of my go-tos as it never disappoints.

The hotel, perfectly located in Nomad, somehow manages to be in the middle of everything, yet provides a peaceful respite when the doors close behind you.  Everything is tasteful here  - from the lobby to the rooms to the eateries and common areas. Of equal importance is a staff that makes you feel like guests in their home.

During our first visit of ‘23, we had the pleasure of celebrating a trifecta of two birthdays and a wedding anniversary and you would have thought we were the royal family - a card signed by many of the staff still graces a shelf in our home.

Should business or a getaway take you to NYC, you can’t go wrong with a stay at The James Nomad.

title: Great hotel in a great location and clean
text: This was our first time staying at The James NY. The queen room is tiny but we weren’t spending any time in it other than to sleep. The hotel was located in a great area with close shops and bagel stops nearby. It’s also a quick drive to LGA airport (approx 30 min). We will be staying here more often when we come into the city.

title: Clean, Great Location, Good Amenities
text: I was able to check in early upon arrival which was great as I had a meeting in the afternoon and wanted to get settled.  Amenities are great with free coffee in the AM, Wine Cocktail Hour, Live Music - great location to my office.  My room was very small, especially the bathroom and I had no view but that is kind of NY overall :) - I will stay here again but I will ask for a room with a view.  Overall great experience.

title: A good mid-town choice with some annoyances
text:
Nice lobby and bar. Variable service. Sometimes super slow, sometimes friendly and welcoming. Many good aspects and some annoyances.

The rooms are fair value for NY, a little tired  and can be noisy. Great location for mid-town.

Breakfast is a la carte only and painfully slow and expensive. Go elsewhere.

Wi-Fi needs an email address which they will steal and use for marketing irrespective of whether you have given permission.

Scapetta is a lovely treat. It is popular with non-residents. As a hotel guest you don’t have any priority so you may not be able to get a seat at the bar or restaurant due to the crowds. Be prepared to book or go elsewhere.

title: Lovely quiet hotel
text: We enjoyed our stay at The James. The staff were all very nice and attentive. The hotel is very clean, and felt warm and cozy on our cold December visit. The only drawback for us was a lack of concierge, esp in a city like NY. But everyone tried to help when we had questions. Rooms are small but as expected in NY, but very clean which is appreciated.

title: Good and bad
text:
Location great. Comfortable bed and pillows. Noisy but it is NYC.
We booked a deluxe king and deluxe queen but having arrived home and looked on the website it’s clear we were only given a standard king which was disappointing as we paid for a deluxe.
The hotel did provide a nice birthday treat for the deluxe queen hence the 4 star rating otherwise it would have been 3.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: I would highly recommend staying at the James Nomad. I honestly couldn’t fault it, everything was fab. Reception staff were fab, door staff really helpful and friendly, room was super spacious and always cleaned beautifully! Location of the hotel is amazing, you can walk to pretty much all the main sights and there is a metro stop near by too.

title: Plush room, good find
text:
Stayed here and loved it. Found it by chance talking to friends of friends at a dinner party.
What an interesting building, room was plush and spotless.
Great service, but it was New York. 
Good spot for getting about the city and quiet and calm once inside.
Recommend to everyone.

title: Dave Matthews Band Concert November 17th, 2023
text: Everything about this hotel was perfect for a stay in New York City. It is a quick walk from Penn Station and right near all the excitement of Mid-Town while also offering a quiet retreat when all the action is over for the night after a Broadway show or concert at Madison Square Garden. The rooms are incredibly clean, plush and without a doubt the most comfortable bed and pillow I've ever had in a hotel room. If you are visiting NYC for just one night or an entire week, look no further than the James NoMad on East 29th Street.

title: We would go back
text: The rooms were clean, well appointed and generously sized, especially for New York. The staff were accommodating and very helpful with recommendations for restaurants in the area of the sites we visited. The location was great for us since we saw sites all over Manhattan. Central to shopping, sites, food and theatre.  We would go back.

title: Horrible for Business Travel
text: Billing is a mess with these folks.  Had to follow up multiple times and was still not able to successfully bill this room to a soft corporate card.  Other hotels in the area make this a seamless experience.  Avoid.

title: Beware of noise
text:
While the hotel is clean and comfy the treat noise on Wed nights (garbage) is unbearable. It’s like ongoing construction nonstop from 10p to 2/3a. 

Do not recommend if you actually need to sleep, hotel should advise guest prior to booking

title: Bbugs … Do Not Stay
text:
Bedbugs in our room — I would not recommend staying here. Having experienced the nightmare of bedbugs before, my husband and I both know intimately how to identify them and we know how just a couple bugs can ruin your life if they get into your luggage and are brought home. Yet the hotel continues to deny it and provided faulty investigation reports. I documented this with pictures, videos and we even saved the specimen I killed, yet they keep denying the obvious facts. They may be evading city fines for now but this is only going to get worse for them. Hotel management and potential guests, take this seriously.

Overall sanitation was also lacking. We found a dirty rag left on the bathroom floor, no hand soap was provided, and the room smelled like damp carpet mildew. Tiny room and bathroom too.

Response to our google review: At no point were we ever content, but I don’t have unlimited time to waste so of course I have to go about my day at some point. The first manager said he would comp our laundry “no matter how the report comes back”. The offer was reneged later until someone else agreed that laundry was the bare minimum. The first manager spoke to my husband, not me directly and my husband needed to go to work without time to discuss a better outcome. Of course a 1-night refund (they first said 50% off one night) out of 3 nights spent in the bedbug-infested room is not close to enough compensation, furthermore it is a drop in the bucket compared to the thousands+ they will inevitably need to pay to control the bedbug infestation not to mention lost revenue from all the potential guests they will alienate. We found a bedbug, and the pest control company is either scamming this hotel or they never did a thorough investigation. The public deserves to know this and I don’t appreciate the gaslighting. We know what we saw and everyone else can see it too.

title: A really great hotel
text:
Comfortable beds, fabulous pillows, a really great shower and clean bathroom.  The room was large, as was the bathroom.
The hotel was in a great location too - and not noisy.
The staff were great - so helpful and kind to us.
I loved the wine hour - especially the Hallow-een themed night.

If I ever return to NYC this is where I will stay.

title: Great customer services!
text:
On the night before my departure, I took a quick shower, took my wedding ring off and went to bed after midnight.  With a 4:00 am alarm (and I am based on the West Coast and was still on PST), I did a poor job packing my bag and left my pants with my wedding ring in the pocket!  Being married 21+ years, you can imagine my horror when I was on the plane home and realized what I had done.  

As soon as I landed, I called the main number and went to housekeeping/lost and found.  JenniferClouden  answered.  I told her what I had done and much to my relief, she reported that she had my ring!  Over the last week we have been in constant contact about her securing the ring, sending shipping labels and general status.  Jennifer mailed my pants and ring today.  I cannot wait to receive them tomorrow.

This situation could have turned out to be horrible for me on an emotional level.  Instead, Jennifer was consistently in contact, and I was reassured she would help me fix my mistake.  

I lead a team of over 1000 employees.  Jennifer’s responsiveness, empathy and kindness are not something every employee possesses.  In fact, I wish she was on my team, and I could impart these traits in many of my colleagues.  

I want to thank Jennifer and hope you can recognize her for the customer service she provided.  I make quarterly trips from California to visit our NY office.  I previously stayed at The W.  You can be assured that because of Jennifer, I all stay at The James Nomad for ALL future trips to NY and recommend all of our employees do the same.

title: Great small hotel, a few areas for improvement
text: We booked a suite for a 5 day stay in New York, which was in effect two connecting rooms, a large room with two double beds and a smaller room with a double sofa bed. It is nicely presented, with a smart lobby area and a decent (very busy) restaurant. For New York the accommodation was well sized. It’s in a very central location, 10 minutes from the Empire State Building and easily walkable to many sites. There are plenty of good restaurants close by. All of the staff we met were very friendly and helpful. There are a few things to watch out for though, when we checked in we were told they provide coffee in the lobby in the morning and wine for an hour in the afternoon. What wasn’t explained until we received our bill is that there is a $40 per day facility charge for this. We didn’t touch a drop of the coffee or the wine, and still picked up a $200 bill. We had room service on two occasions and both times tipped in cash, hence not adding tips to the receipts when signing for these items, to then find that they’d added large tips to our bill. When we ordered wine, we found what we asked for had been replaced by a much higher value bottle, not disclosed until the bottle was opened.. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, it’s a great hotel. We feel though that the transactions mentioned are a bit financially predatory so our advice is to be aware.

title: Good hotel with a bit of personality
text: Great location (easy to get downtown, some nice places nearby), comfy beds, nice lounge, more character than a lot of midtown places. Great bar but I didn’t get to go this time. Breakfast selection was okay but not amazing (well cooked and tasty though). Everyone that worked there was nice but seemed a bit run off their feet

title: Fantastic place to stay.
text: Such a great place to stay. The location is perfect for getting anywhere you need to go. The staff is so helpful, especially the Guest Service Director Haylee. We love the space of the rooms and the comfort of the sheets pillows and the bed. Even the front reception area has a vibe to it. Don't miss this hotel. Love!

title: Cold Water, Chilly Reception but Warm Hotel Manager.
text:
This review is to celebrate what a good hotel manager can do when lower level management and staff have disappointed. All credit due to Bradley Concepcion for saving the day and understanding the benefit, courtesy and wisdom of listening to a customer with respect. His intervention changed what would have been a one star review in fury to four in gratitude. 
For two days the bath only had tepid water at sink and shower. This inconvenience, along with a room too small to swing a cat and a broken window, did not make for comfort or purported Nomad luxury. Sadly compounding the frustration were less than responsive front desk clerks and a front officer manager who definitely needed “bedside manner” training.  Considering that maid staff confirmed the boiler was struggling, the disbelief and disinterest on the part of the front office manager were not only unproductive, his response “well obviously nothing I can do will make you happy” hardly scored 100 on the customer service scale. Ride to the rescue the manager who immediately apologised for surly mediocre treatment And researched the problem was genuine.  Presto pronto a new room was assigned, a bottle of wine delivered, and no offensive instruction to leave the water running to warm was deemed necessary. Perhaps he had the training to spot seasoned luxury travellers who had somehow reached maturity knowing how to operate a shower valve! And his efforts proved customer satisfaction was an achievable goal.  
To be honest, many of the rooms available at the James are small and lack views. But the location and staff - with the aforementioned notable exceptions - are trying and working hard to be hospitable. So this is overall a cautionary tale: hotel management can save the day if they have the training to be hospitable which one would assume the hospitality industry requires as the bare minimum. Gracias e Bravo a Sigr. Concepcion.

title: Enjoyable stay!
text:
Stayed here for a long weekend to visit family and do some sightseeing. Easy access to NYC sights. Nice room and stay. Restaurant was enjoyable and food offered were good.
Everyone was friendly and helpful

title: Great times friendly service
text: We had a stay recently and we’re greeted by the amazing staff as soon as we entered! The decor and customer service was stellar! It was easy to navigate the space Definitely recommend and we will be back!

title: Mishandled Bag: a need for customer centric training
text: The staff left my box behind in the lift whilst moving luggage into the  car. I had to pay 95 USD cash to get the box to the airport when I noticed it wasn’t at the airport.The hotel hasn’t  resolved.

title: My best trip to NYC.  The James Nomad was perfect!
text:
Lovely hotel in fantastic location.  The staff were all so friendly, professional and helpful.  Nothing was too much trouble for them.

The lobby is so relaxing and welcoming.  Our room was perfect with a large bathroom, 2 showers and very comfy beds.

I would like to make a shout out to Haylee (guest relations manager) who made our stay so special for us all - We were a group of girlfriends "on tour" and Haylee gave us the best start to our visit to NYC.

Also a shout out to Joseph, you were so lovely, full of smiles and made sure that we didn't miss out on the 5pm wine!  Thank you Joseph.

All 6 of us ladies would definitely stay here on our next trip.

title: Home Away From Home
text:
The James New York -NoMad – has become my” home away from home” when I need to be in NYC for business.  

Great location, comfortable and clean rooms, but the thing that makes this a great place to stay is the staff.  The staff are incredibly helpful, kind, and generous with their time and have the best attitudes.  From the kind bellmen at the front door, the front desk staff, the housekeepers, the room service staff, and all those behind the scenes – always service with a smile.  One cannot ask for a better team.  

I’ve now stayed at the hotel four times and have recommended it to family and friends who have had the same experiences.  The lobby is spacious and always bustling – in the morning there is coffee, tea, and breakfast treats and in the evening wine and more delicious treats.  The rooms are a great size and the beds and pillows so comfortable that you will want to stay tucked in as long as you can.  I’ve treated myself to room service on several occasions and have never been disappointed by the delicious choices for both breakfast and dinner, as well as the “service with a smile” gentleman who delivers it to the room.

After my first visit, I learned that if I had a concern during my stay that I should not hesitate to reach out to a Guest Service Manager.  I need to give a great shoutout to Haylee, although mostly behind the scenes has made each additional stay for myself and my family even better.  She has been eager to answer questions and has taken the extra step to make our experiences at the James New York – NoMad the reason we call it our “home away from home”.  

Thanks for making all of our visits memorable – especially after a long day at the office it is so nice to come “home” at the end of the day.

title: Terrible experience
text: Expensive with no priceless expedient . The manager refused to return our cash guesunty despite overcharging my card  without empathy- he insisted I take a  USD check and cash in my local currency account which is the hotel rule. There was no toiletries in the bathroom and you Ora to ally beg for everything without response. I will not recommend here for my enemy

title: Quick Honeymoon
text: The most comfortable bed! Management sent us some chocolate strawberries for our honeymoon. Everyone was sooo incredibly nice. We were leaving late on a flight to Rome so they let us check out late and stored our bags. We had drinks at Seville and Dinner at scarpetto was delicious & welcoming. Not a single complaint. Even the outside service scheduled a ride to the airport for us. It was seamless. Can’t wait to go back. Great job.

title: Once iconic. Now shameful. Sad. Mismanaged
text: The James was once an iconic place, but it’s far gone now. So Poorly managed to a point possibly beyond reproach, and rooms worn down beyond repair. My room was crumbling apart. Walls and decor stained. Duct taped door frame. Pros: The lobby is lovely. And the front desk staff/ doorman is very attentive. Note: Current housekeeping staff dislikes pets. So NOT actually PET FRIENDLY! Not worth it.

title: Privacy Violations, inhumane treatment of pets. Serious issues at the once fantastic
text:
Staff thoroughly went through my personal belongs while I was away from my room Controlled substance medications, high end jewelery, and  custom leather pieces all but disappeared from my room that day.  I have not seen those items since.  The James took no responsibility. And did not attempt to resolve this major privacy violation, or attempt to even look for the
 missing items that we’re removed from my room. Upon returning to the hotel my pet had been removed from his 
room and put into a tiny carrier without my consent or knowledge. He has asthma and cannot safety be in a  confined space for more that short periods.  Be very very careful with your valuables and your 
pets at this property. As my experience was one which my pet was hurt  and valuable property missing. The James showed me that they would be okay with caging a pet without food water or bathroom for 6/8 hours. The James once represented a very high standard proper 4 star hotel, was once a favorite but something has changed maybe the managment company, and the James is nothing like how it used to be. 2.5 star hotel at the most. I don’t recommend staying here anymore but if you are  watch your pets closely. I saw a housekeeping staff member pretend to stomp on a kitty and laugh. So disappointing.

title: Wonderful accommodations in mid-town Manhattan at an affordable price
text: The James New York was a perfect base for us in exploring mid-town Manhattan for the first time, only a few blocks from the Empire State Building, Summit One Vanderbuilt, and Grand Central Station, it was an ideal location for our walks and subway rides throughout the city. The staff was friendly and helpful, the lobby had excellent coffee available every morning, and the daily 5-6pm wine and pastry happy hour was a big plus. Rooms were clean and generally well-maintained. Our only problem was in getting complete shower supplies (gel, shampoo, conditioner) but they were able to straighten that out. I would enthusiastically recommend the James for any budget-minded visitor in need of first class accommodations.

title: Wedding celebration block of rooms
text:
We had a block of 20 rooms for family and friends coming to the city for a wedding celebration. I cannot express how amazing our stay was. The location, building exterior, lobby and restaurant, all fantastic. The rooms were comfortable and spacious.
What makes this hotel special, is the staff. The front desk staff were accommodating and professional. Housekeeping responsive and thorough.  I cannot say enough about the bell staff. They were always willing to help with anything we needed and made our complicated schedule seamless.
We received upgrades to suites, early checkins, late checkouts, speedy room service,  complimentary wine in the room, the list goes on and on.
Without a doubt some of the best service I have ever experienced in a hotel.
Highly recommend, especially for the very reasonable price point.

title: Would not recommend this hotel.
text:
The wait to checkin was too long. The walls are paper thin and I could hear the maids screaming in the hallway at 7 am. Also, nobody helped me with my bags, the two doormen where watching a video on a cellphone. 
On the plus side, there's live music a few times per week at around 6pm and free wine and nibbles at the lobby. The singer is pretty good!

title: New York
text: Great experience and very comfortable hotel. Area is great with everything within walking distance. Morning coffee at the lobby was nice surprise. All staff were pleasant and helpful. Will definitely stay again.

title: Amazing experience
text: The hotel was perfect, the location is very central and the staff is extreeley friendly. I loved everything about the James and would recommend it for work or a family trip, they even upgraded one of our rooms !

title: quite good
text:
It was quite good; spacious rooms, nice foyer,  and very helpful staff. One thing to note though is that even though they do breakfast, it's quite pricey. This wasn't a big probably though as we just bought breakfast from wholefoods. And (not as important) they didn't have a pool but that's fine as you could just go to a public pool. 
The location is very good; a couple of blocks a way from times square, right next to the empire state, and a 1/2 hour travel from the world trade center.

title: Thank you Evelin 🙏🌹
text:
The hotel has a great position, everything is near including subway, bus station and lots of places to eat. Also inside of the hotel is a great Italian restaurant, Scarpetta very elegant, nice food and excellent services . 
A big minus is in my opinion the fact that there is no concierge to help you when you need it and was my case when I was sick one day and I needed some informations. So my main thanks will go to the manager on duty at that time, Evelin Guerrero who really helped me and she really knew it how to deal with a situation when I was very angry on others behavior.

title: Bel hôtel dans Manhattan
text: Très bel hôtel dans Manhattan. Bien situé. Chambre vaste et au calme. Literie parfaite. Personnel sympathique et compétent. Bon petit déjeuner. En revanche plutôt cher (comme presque partout à New-York) mais surtout il faut débourser en plus des taxes, 43$ pour... rien... Dommage et incompréhensible .

title: Worth a Second Visit
text: Great location, Quiet, clean hotel with efficient staff. King room is a worthwhile upgrade for additional space. Toiletries are limited fo a tiny bar of soap, lotion, and shower and hair products. However, there is daily full maid service, and complimentary morning coffee and afternoon wine in the spacious lobby. Clientele is quite varied, including families.

title: Lovely Hotel in Exclusive NoMad Location
text: This hotel is a wonderful surprise - great location and well appointed rooms.  We tried their Seville restaurant for breakfast - avocado toast + poached egg delish. Very responsive to any request. Excellent gym! Highly recommend try #Koloman restaurant in the Ace Hotel next door.

title: Great Hotel, Great Service
text: Service was great and very hospitable.  The room was clean and the doorman always opened the door. I asked for an amenity for our anniversary and Haylee Kroll was an amazing help!  She asked for preferences to ensure it was special.  Thank you!

title: Best Stay in NYC
text: When you check in, you are greeted with the most kindness and care. The lobby scent is amazing! Rooms are trendy w/ nice bathrooms and showers. Scarpetta is the best and the seville tops the charts across the board!

title: The best way and place to celebrate the birthdays of loved ones and to give thanks for this beautiful world and life!
text: We had the absolute best and most wonderful weekend in New York staying at The James New York - Nomad and celebrating my partner and his brother’s partner’s birthdays!!! Haylee, who is the Guest Service Manager at The James, was an angel and took such thoughtful and sincere care of us during our stay from arrival to departure. Haylee had each of our rooms set up with Prosecco and a beautiful charcuterie board to surprise the birthday man and lady upon arrival along with a hand written note to each of them! It was so sweet to see their surprise and to start the trip off on a note of celebration and thanksgiving for life. In addition, Haylee took the time to share wonderful restaurant recommendation near the James as well as followed up with prompt communication to check in and ask how everything was going - I can say it all was going and went wonderfully. Thank you so much to The James and especially Haylee Kroll for making this trip a core memory and for the spirit of New York that you shared with us. It meant so much - and one last note, our bed at The James was so so comfy and nice to tuck into at night to rest and be ready for our next day’s New York fun and adventure!

title: Location, location
text: Great, great, great location. Friendly & courteous staff throughout the facility.  Morning coffee was delicious and the 5-7 pm during the week wine & snack all hit the perfect spot! The next trip to the Big Apple will include another stay at The James NY-NoMAd

title: Stylish with Friendliest Staff
text: Stayed a couple of days at The James NoMad while on business. Everyone member of the staff, from the front desk to the doormen, to the service staff, was incredibly friendly and helpful. Our king deluxe room was comfortable and stylish, comparable size to other NYC hotel rooms. My husband was with me and it was the right size for 2 people (wouldn't go smaller). The location is nice, across from a Church with a pretty lawn and garden. Having Scarpetta the restaurant downstairs is a huge plus, delicious.  Good hotel and shout out to the staff who made it a warm welcoming experience.  Would go back!

title: Nice hotel; Fabulous staff
text: The James is well located both for local restaurants and sightseeing and bus and subway travel.  Our room was modest but comfortable and the large lobby had many options for seating (small tables for two by windows, large sofas sofas and chairs.  Wine and snacks were served late afternoon in the lobby. The staff was extremely responsive and helpful.

title: A great 4 star hotel.
text: This is our third stay here.  As the location suggests it is mid town and so a great location for Central Park to Soho.  It’s always faultless, easy and inexpensive.  Scarpettas is the restaurant in the building and it’s fabulous. This isn’t 5 star but it doesn’t pretend to be.  It’s a great 4 star hotel in a great location and at a great price for New York.

title: OLD BUILDING AND NOTHING WORKS
text: Dont go there when it is hot bc the AC didnt work and the other room it barely worked. They chnaged our room after maintenance said the unit didnt work at all, and the next room it barely worked. Also, the sink didnt drain but it was to late  when we realized so it never got fixed. To much in disrepair. The staff was nice and accommodating, and the location was good but NEVER again.

title: Comfy beds and Netflix
text: The James Hotel bad very comfortable beds, plush robes and good quality slippers. The room was a decent size in general, but especially for NYC. The TV even had the ability to access your Netflix account and the remote had a sleep timer on it, which is always a huge plus when falling asleep in a hotel. I will defiantly be staying here again on my next trip!

title: Outstanding place to stay while visiting New York.
text: Beautiful boutique hotel with fantastic restaurants!  Great location and comfortable rooms and amenities.  Perfect location for both business and pleasure.  Rooms are a great size compared to other similar hotels.

title: Perfect location, comfortable, and clean!
text:
I stayed with my best friend for a weekend in July and we had a perfect stay! Prior to the trip I arranged with the front desk to accept a package on my behalf and that process was very easy. Upon arrival the staff was very friendly and our room was even better than I had expected! We had a corner room and it had a great view and was clean and comfortable. 

We were able to walk to great spots to get coffee, meals, get our nails done. The Seville being downstairs was a great spot to end our evening and easily return to our room. 

Noon checkout time is really convenient as it gave us the opportunity to go out to brunch before having to gather our bags to leave. 

I will definitely be back and have no plans to even consider staying anywhere else in the city! Stay here if you are looking for an upscale clean and safe hotel in a superb location!

title: Great Stay!
text: I recently stayed at the James Hotel and I was quite impressed by the welcoming environment and chic interior. There is easy access to transit and restaurants but what really stood out was the exceptional service from Haylee Kroll. She was super helpful and went above and beyond to ensure my stay was perfect. I highly recommend the James Hotel especially if you have the opportunity to meet Haylee!

title: Great stay for our girls trip!
text: Love the James nomad! We choose this hotel over and over again and it never disappoints. The location is so central to everything in the city, the rooms are so nice and always clean, also they are always doing fun things in the lobby for their guests. Will continue to stay here again and again!

title: The James Nomad - NYC Gem!
text:
We selected The James based on others' reviews, and they were spot on! We decided not to stay at another property where we have loyalty points given the information we read about The James. 

The hotel is in a great neighborhood, the service is impeccable, and the wine happy hour is such a welcome touch. 

The beds are comfortable, and the rooms (and bathroom!) are spacious for New York. We never had to wait more than a few seconds for an elevator. 

Upon arrival, we needed a luggage rack and extra towels. They arrived at our room in less than 10 minutes so that we could quickly get out to explore. 

We would definitely recommend this hotel. Thank you to the team there for a great stay!

title: Best experience in NYC.
text:
Best time in NYC.  I had different experiences, but this was the best by far.
Restaurant, night live, the courtesy, professional.  Safe and clean.
Everything was at a short distance.
Well management 👏

title: Exquisite Experience.
text:
The staff at The James New York Nomad and the accommodations they had for us were amazing! We hosted family at the property for a weekend as we celebrated our wedding in New York City, the assurance  they provided to us and our guests was magnificent making our life so much easier.  

Thank you very much! We hope to be back soon.

title: Great Stay in Nomad
text: Great stay at a great hotel with great staff. James Club offering the wine and snacks in the afternoon was wonderful. Perfect location to lots of dining, shopping and experiences. Thanks to The James Nomad team for a wonderful stay.

title: Worst ever breakfast at the James hotel
text:
The breakfast experience is one of the worst I have experienced in my travels worldwide
Everyone onviously knows how bad the breakfast is as there was no one there at peak hour breakfast time
One staff member really didn’t care. We had to continually ask for things
See pic of empty breakfast room
One egg each $30!!!

title: BEWARE  with booking their basic Queen Room
text: In the midst of our stay at The James and could not be more disappointed.  Know nyc rooms are small but this one is lucky to be 120 sq feet with a shower that is barely usable ( don't drop your soap you won't get up). No towel bars or holders and no place to put bags or clothing other then small closet. Positives- great staff who are helpful and friendly. ( however didn't appreciate the $150 3 night upsell for a king bed) Also Scarpeta restaurant is wonderful. I think booking room thru Hotwire gave me the worst room in the hotel.  Will know better next time and stay at the Dominick and stay away from this "sad" facility.

title: Great hotel
text: Amazing hotel. Lovely, helpful staff, coffee and tea served free every morning and a wine evening with free pizza. Really comfortable beds and the bathrooms were really high end and good. Also a really, really good location: 2 minute walk from the 28th street subway station.

title: The James NoMad is Modern Elegance
text: My wife and I stayed at the James when we got married and recently returned to celebrate our anniversary. The James offers such beautiful rooms and spaces with fantastic staff and services. The focus on mental and physical health does offer a very calming status. We love the James and will definitely return in the future.

title: Una experiencia inolvidable
text: Excelente!! Definitivamente tuve una de las mejores experiencias en éste hotel, fue muy fácil llegar y los empleados me recibieron de una manera muy amable y hablan español. Las habitaciones son súper confortables  y modernas, sobre todo la hermosa vista a la ciudad desde la habitación. Para quedar mar satisfecho, me sorprendieron con unas fresas con chocolates y un vino en la habitación. Sin lugar a dudas 10/10.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: Best in NY! I stayed here for a work trip and received exceptional service from the hotel staff and management team. My room was so clean with great views. I will definitely be staying here the next time I am in the city!

title: Good Hotel North of Madison
text:
Good Hotel ideal if you are going to be around the area. Check in was very smooth and staff was friendly. 
Rooms are clean and well kept but are some how small, as the hotel was built at the beginning of the XX century. Good money for value relation.

title: Horrible service
text: Countless times throughout my stay I tried to reach the front desk and nobody ever answered. At one point, the smoke alarm in my room went off briefly because I was using a travel-steamer on a pair of linen pants. I moved the location of the steamer and the alarm stopped. I tried contacting the front desk to alert them (nobody answered) and then I assumed someone would come check in on me. Nope. So safety certainly isn't the issue. Upon checkout the next day, I was slapped with a $250 smoking fee for the in-room alarm going off briefly (which proves they were notified; nobody just ever came to investigate). When I tried to explain what happened, I was told only the manager could adjust my folio and so far, the manager has not returned my calls. The hotel is okay but the staff and service is truly missing in action. Would not stay again.

title: Average at best
text: Hotel was very expensive, though likely competitively priced for the busy weekend. Unfortunately, while the exterior of the building is quite grand and beautiful, the inside is dated with extensive stained carpeting. The hotel room also had stains on the furniture. Bathroom was OK, a bit old looking as well. Overall, not really a great vibe, especially for how much money it cost to stay there. Service was so-so, nothing special, probably actually a bit below average.

title: Perfect Place for Exploring NYC!
text:
I was so pleasantly surprised by The James NoMad! The staff was joyful, easy going and generous with upgrades and checkout times. I was there with a large group (27) of experienced travelers. Everyone was impressed and said they had a very comfortable and spacious room.
I’ve stayed in other hotels in NoMad (Kimpton/Ace). Most are overtly trendy and hip but the rooms are expensive and tiny. Not The James! The rooms are a good size, clean, comfortable and a great value. 
The area is central and perfect. We were there for 5 nights. We all felt safe walking around at night. I am looking forward to staying there again and can highly recommend it to anyone traveling in NYC.

title: will be back
text: Thank you The James! We had a wonderful visit to NYC and truly enjoyed our stay at The James. Perfectly located so we could venture to all areas of the city with ease. We loved the afternoon wine and music in the lobby before heading out for an evening of adventure!

title: Petit hôtel sympathique dans NOMAD
text:
Je suis resté au James New York en juin 2023 pour deux nuitées dans une chambre Queen de base. 

La chambre était petite, mais bien équipée. Mention à la douche d'une bonne grandeur et au mini bar très complet et d'un beau design. 

Bon service attentionné
- On a accommodé mon arrivée hâtive en m'attribuant une chambre dès 12h. 
- Le ménage de la chambre était impeccable

NOMAD / Flatiron District est un district agréable et moins achalandé au coeur de Manhattan. L'hôtel est près du Madison Square Park et de deux stations de métro, sur la 28e rue. 

Bref, bon rapport qualité/prix.

title: The James is a special place in the heart of Manhattan!
text: Very comfortable, clean, and spacious accommodations with a talented and friendly staff to match. This is my second extended stay within a year, and the experience has been consistent and pleasant.  I’m coming back ASAP!

title: New York City NIGHTMARE: A Masterpiece of Mismanagement and Discrimination.
text:
Stay clear of The James NoMad. It's a shocking disgrace to NYC. They denied my Alzheimer's-stricken grandma an ADA room, despite promises. They tried to stick me with a ridiculous $2000 upgrade. Disgusting! My boyfriend, added to the reservation, was treated horribly and experienced blatant homophobia from the staff. A total nightmare!

The room we ended up with was nothing short of a disaster - moldy, falsely advertised size, and missing crucial ADA compliance. The management was not just unhelpful, they were rude and dishonest. It's mind-boggling how such people hold positions of power in hospitality. They ignored our pleas and dismissed our concerns, highlighting their shocking lack of empathy and professionalism.

The situation was so dreadful that I had to purchase a shower seat from Walgreens just to ensure my grandma's safety. It's unacceptable that guests are put in such distressing situations, especially when they're already dealing with challenging personal circumstances.

The additional charges on my card were the final nail in the coffin. I was hit with a $160 late checkout fee for an eerily deserted hotel. It's pure greed, plain and simple.

The James NoMad is a complete mockery of what hospitality should be. Discrimination, unkept promises, poor hygiene, appalling management, and a blatant disregard for guests' wellbeing are hallmarks of their operation. Avoid this place like the plague. It's a travesty in every sense of the word.

title: The best hotel in NYC
text:
We had a great experience at The James Hotel Nomad. My husband, my self and two kids went for my husbands 50th- we worked with Haylee on setting everything up. She was awesome to work with- very helpful and had so many great ideas. She also planned things for us to do in the city as we haven’t been for quite some time. Haylee had a surprise of balloons and amazing cake waiting in our room for my husband- he loved it! 
My kids thought it was such a cool hotel. Let me tell you about the beds… WOW! They were the softest beds ever. 
We stayed for 4 nights, the second day we were there I fractured my Knee in Central Park and when we finally got back to the hotel that day the doormen were some of the nicest doormen I ever encountered. They were so helpful and accommodating. They gave us a wheelchair to use throughout the rest of the trip, they helped us in every way possible. They were extremely friendly. I believe their names are Manny and Roman. I would hands down totally recommend this hotel, to be honest I didn’t expect this kind of experience with a hotel in NYC- but it was literally the best from the minute we walked in to the minute we left!

title: A Perfect Stay in NoMad
text: A great place to stay in NoMad. The neighborhood is quiet, but you are so close to many good restaurants and things to see and do in walking distance. We were celebrating an anniversary and Haylee was so welcoming and helped make our room special for our visit. We would absolutely stay again. The rooms are comfortable and the hallways quiet.

title: The James, why try anywhere else when perfection is perfectly priced?!
text:
From the moment you walk in until your last goodbye, everything was as good as it gets!  The rooms were perfectly furnished, bedding exquisite, and just the roght amount of attentiveness from the staff.
So lovely to find such a centrally located gem--see you again in a month!

title: What a fab week in New York with the family
text:
Great location, first class service, friendly, welcoming and good value for money.

We used the hotel as a base to explore New York other than the complementary coffee and evening wine we didn't eat or drink in the hotel, for no other reason as we had some many things to see and do. As a base to explore the hotel is fantastically located and the staff are super friendly and helpful.

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text: The James is in the perfect location. Our corner Deluxe king was roomy and great. Some noise from the streets, but that's NYC! Room service was a bit too pricey - especially with added taxes and fees, plus they forgot details - like salt and pepper - but the staff were amazing and we would def stay there again.

title: May 2023 NYC experience
text:
I recently visited the hotel which was amazing. The service was incredible. They couldn’t have done more in particularly I spoke with Haylee Kroll and honestly went above my expectations with upgrading our room, as well as providing celebration treats for my partner birthday as it was a surprised trip and beautifully decorated the room with some complimentary chocolate strawberries and Prosecco would recommend this hotel to anybody. It was an amazing location was walking distance to all the great spots we was able to walk to Times Square in 20 mins and empire state which was 10 min walk and had amazing food spots near by! the front desk was very helpful and the hotel was very clean and everyone was so friendly. 

Thank you for such an amazing experience, will be visiting again :)

title: Fabulous Service
text: We were taken care of so well by Aohs! He helped us with our bags when we arrived and made sure we were all set throughout our stay. Cannot say enough nice words. Thank you so much, we had a fabulous stay!

title: Night out with my Sister
text: My sister picked this hotel and it was the best decision. Everyone was kind and hospitable. The location was 15 minutes away from Penn station so also very convenient. Rooms were clean and included robes as well as  full size toiletries in the bathroom. Oh and the room service - food was HOT. We definitely enjoyed our stay and will be back for future events in NYC.

title: HAYLEE KROLL, THE JAMES NY BEST GUEST SERV MANAGER 💕
text:
The James New York Nomad Hotel definitely exceeded our expectations with its downright classic ambiance. We were immediately impressed with the gorgeous building, an exceptional staff, who was inviting, treated us with the utmost respect and hospitality from the moment we walked in. 
There was one person who clearly stood out and made us feel welcome before we even arrived at the hotel. Her name is Haylee Kroll and our family was pleasantly astonished at how from the very moment we informed her we were celebrating my husband’s 60th birthday, she made sure to look after everything from receiving the balloons to going out of her way to beautifully and seamlessly decorate the room for my husband’s birthday surprise. Furthermore, her attention to detail to ensure that our arrival was smooth and hassle-free as possible was one in a million. We have done our share of travel and we can truly say that we received a high level of courtesy and care, and recommend this hotel for anyone visiting NYC. Thank you so much, Haylee!

title: My new location in NYC
text: We had a very good stay at The James NYC, the staff was great and the arrival quick and easy. When our plane has been canceled, they booked us 2 nights without any problem. The location is perfect, Nomad is really nice. We will come back

title: First-Rate Stay in NYC
text: The James is my go-to spot to stay in Manhattan. I'm here frequently for work and love the fact that I don't even need to consider any other place. Clean. Kind. Classy. Ideal location. Exceptional bar. Great staff. Shout-out to Jose for providing first-rate service! Hard pressed to find better...

title: I love visiting NYC, The James was a perfect place to stay
text: Clean rooms, comfortable bedding, welcoming staff.  The James met my expectations.  I visit NYC frequently to visit my son.  It is difficult to find a quality hotel at a reasonable price.  The James is a perfect fit for me and my needs.  I will be staying at The James again soon.

title: Pretentious place, poor staff service.
text: Unless you are one of their seemingly conventional bourgeois guests, staff treat you very poorly. Among the unfriendliest service I've experienced anywhere. They are all more concerned about what happens in the lobby than the actual stay experience. Beautiful building, very poorly managed.

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text: We truly enjoyed our stay at The James. Great little hotel, geat location and staff were awesome. Happy hour wine with live music was a wonderful surprise. Along with a free Danish and some fruit was something you don't get in many places.

title: Great hotel near in the Flat Iron area
text: We recently stayed at The James NY NoMad and loved it.  The location worked well for us as we had events on both the East Side and West Side. The staff was very pleasant.  The room was a nice size and very well equipped.  The king sized bed was quite comfortable.  There was a well equipped bar in the room.  The bathroom had good lighting with a magnifying mirror for putting on make up as well as a nice sized walk in shower and many fluffy towels. Everything was exceptionally clean and the room was quiet.  We couldn’t hear outside noise at all.  There were also good blackout shades so we were able to sleep late. We were in town for a family function so we didn’t get the chance to try the restaurant, but it looked great. Additionally, the hotel has valet parking, but it was easy to find street parking nearby.  I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: The James - NoMad: an NYC top choice!
text:
This is my second stay at The James NoMad in NYC and it is now one of my “go-to” stops moving forward. This hotel excels in class, vibe, customer service, and overall experience. 

Haylee and the rest of the staff were incredibly helpful in making this trip a very fun and memorable 17th birthday trip for our son and he’ll remember it forever. 

Thanks, Haylee, and the rest of the excellent The James - NoMad team. You all were wonderful!

title: Lovely hotel ideally situated on the corner of Maddison Avenue
text:
We recently had a lovely stay at The James Nomad.

I had spoken to Haylee from the hotel before we arrived, she responded to my queries promptly and we arrived to some goodies in our room. Such a lovely gesture.

We sailed through security on arrival to JFK and arrived at the hotel before check in time, but our rooms were ready and we were able to freshen up, drop our bags ready to explore.

The rooms were spacious and cleaned daily.

Tea and Coffee were available in the lounge each morning, and wine and pastries in the evening.

The hotel is ideally situated on the corner of Maddison Ave , just a short walk to the subway on 28th St. a ten minute walk from the Empire State Building and Macey's.

We had a lovely stay and would definitely return

title: James NoMad is Wonderful!
text: This is a great location, walking distance to Times SQ and subway is only a block away. Rooms are large with queen size beds. Hard to find in the city. Hotel and rooms were very clean and comfortable.

title: Perfect location and accommodations.
text: The James Hotel Nomad is a wonderful place to stay for any NYC adventure whether business or play. The rooms are comfy and clean. The staff is professional and helpful. The location is very convenient to any transportation needs and options.

title: Very comfortable stay
text: I very much enjoyed my first visit to the St James. The extremely friendly staff always had a pleasant greeting and smile. I was fortunate to have my room available when I arrived at 11:00am which gave me a great head start on visiting family. I chose not to use housekeeping but I was asked each day when I encountered them in the hall if I needed anything. My room was very quiet with good light. The location was great too since I bounced around from uptown to downtown. Close to the train and when calling for a car it was always there within five minutes. I get to New York 3-4 times a year and will definitely be returning.

title: Save your money
text:
We wanted to be in the mid-town area and this looked good on the website. Definitely not a four star hotel as advertised (on our Chase card travel website). We stayed five nights.

The GOOD: Good location if you like mid-town, easy to get to subway etc. in the Flatiron district.

We had a suite and the rooms were quite large for NY. Bathroom was decently sized too, with a bathtub and a shower. Comfortable bed. 

Nice lobby with coffee in the morning and wine and sandwich type things in the afternoon. No one could figure out how to use the hot water machine. They need a little sign.

Friendly helpful doorman. 

THE BAD:
The rooms look like a college student decorated their dorm from garage sales and Z gallery. And, believe me when I say the couch and chairs in the living room are ridiculously hard (cheap furniture).  My husband couldn't even work in there they were so uncomfortable. 

The place didn't feel clean. Not like housekeeping clean (which was very good) but just tired and kinda... grubby? 

While the bed may be comfortable, the sheets are cotton/poly and the pillows are foamy. We then requested down pillows which were inexplicably hard. 

We had free continental breakfast. They gave us 10 little cards (the size of business cards) as vouchers to use in the restaurant (Scarpetta) with our name, room number and dates of stay hand written on them. Which felt kind of old timey. At Scarpetta one morning the espresso machine was broken so no lattes etc. On two mornings they only had one server and (on one of them) the place was full and the server was completely overwhelmed.
