It took so long to get coffee I walked out into the lobby and got some myself. I even had time to go back and re-fill my cup before our food arrived. When my latte did arrive, it was cold.  

The front desk:  If you call and request something, it will fall into a black hole. I asked for water, they said they'd send up "filtered" water. Not sure what that meant but it never arrived. Asked for down pillows (never arrived). Called housekeeping and they brought them.  There was no bar soap either for the sink so I called the front desk... well, you get it.

Finally, the manager at the desk seems not particularly friendly. Kind of just... disinterested. And bored.

Won't stay there again.

title: Lovely hotel, perfect location
text: My family and I spent a week in NYC and had the best experience at The James.  We found the location to be excellent for all of our week's activities.  Quick walk to the subway & tons of dining options in the area.  We enjoyed the free coffee/tea/water in the lobby in the mornings and the free wine happy hour in the evenings on our way to dinner.   Most of all, we absolutely loved our room.  We had a James Suite with a spacious sitting area, a 2-queen bedroom, and two (yes, 2) bathrooms.  For a family with 2 teen daughters, the 2nd bathroom was invaluable.   I can't leave out our amazing view of the Empire State Building from our windows.  Everything was wonderful and we would absolutely return.

title: Great Location & Spacious Room
text: Our family of four stayed at the James NoMad for Spring Break and would definitely stay again. The location was perfect for walking everywhere - Fifth Ave, Rockefeller Plaza, Central Park, subway access - and was close to Whole Foods, Milk Bar and lots of great restaurants. The staff was friendly and our room was very spacious and clean. The morning coffee bar and evening happy hours were a nice addition.

title: Perfect location - relaxing & hip
text: We loved our large rooms, beautiful bathroom and hallways. Perfect lobby vibe for meeting and relaxing. Staff was superb. Can not beat the location. We had 7 rooms and we all had a fabulous experience.

title: Luxury hotel in NOMAD
text: Jayda was incredibly helpful and got me checked in early. Plenty of coffee in the lobby and places to work with the WiFi. Room was comfortable and quiet. Bed was comfortable and shower had amazing water pressure and temperature. The bathrobe and slippers were a wonderful touch.

title: Excellent Hotel!
text: The James is a lovely hotel and I would recommend to anyone. The location is great, building beautiful and the staff amazing! We had a family room and was double the size of other NYC rooms we have stayed in with a beautiful double bath and shower bathroom!

title: Perfect location, beautiful hotel and amazing service and staff!
text: Spent a weekend here with family and can't say enough about how great the staff was! Friendly and accommodating from the second we arrived. The location of the hotel is perfect and made it easy to tour NYC.  The hotel is beautiful and while the rooms are small  - as many New York  hotels - they were very comfortable and well decorated.  The friendly staff is really what makes this hotel stand out! We will be back!

title: clean, beutiful and freindly staff
text: its a wonderful hotel,, downtown NYC so I was not sure what to expect, from the late night walksto the hotel staff, we enjoyed it so much.  We are southern people and accustomed to southern kindness, we were not sure what to expect as news is negative,   We had a fabulous time and the staff were amazingly kind and welcoming.    Well Done!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
Visited New York for my wifes birthday. Chose The James due to it's great location and good reviews. It certainly delivered as it was just around the corner from the Empire State Building, close to several subway stations and also lots of restaurants, cafes and coffee shops close by. An ideal base for our visit.
The hotel was very clean and the room was a good size with a great shower and comfy bed.
The staff were very helpful and friendly and a real credit to the hotel.
Would recommend staying at The James.

title: Convenient location to tour Manhattan
text: The room is not very large, I missed a desk, but the bed is comfortable, which is what counts most. Good shower, strong WiFi. The room has a window, but no view. The location is excellent to tour Manhattan.

title: Amazing Time
text:
My wife and I wanted to get away for the weekend so we decided on the James Nomad in NYC. From the minute we walked in the staff was polite and extremely helpful.  Being centrally located, we were able to walk around the city and hit our favorite spots like Times Square, MSG, Hudson Yards and the High Line. 

Rooms, food and atmosphere were amazing!! 

We will be heading back soon enough.

title: Great location
text:
Great location

The James Hotel was a great hotel in the perfect location for us. We stayed for 4 nights and had a room on the 14th floor - we booked a king deluxe and I’m glad we did! The positives of this hotel are location and the bed was enormous and comfortable and the bathroom had a brilliant shower and sink although it was small. The room was quiet and the lobby area was quite cool. Reception was friendly and efficient.  We didn’t eat in the restaurant or the bars at the hotel because we were out so much. 

My only criticism of this hotel is that they should have coffee / tea in the rooms. It was a real pain to go to the lobby early in the morning then back to the room with a coffee. Lying in bed in the morning with a coffee is a luxury and one that this hotel should have provided I think.

title: Great building + location but lacking in certain aspects.
text:
Pros: The building is beautiful and has a lot of history to it. I loved the lobby and the scarpetta restaurant + seville lounge are lovely. Rooms are very big but funny how small the bathroom is in proportion the room [at least for the double queen rooms]. Hard to change the bones of an old building so understandable.

Cons:The rooms are lacking. Ours felt very dingy and drab. Bathroom tub was rusted out on bottom where water pools at the bottom, caulking needs replacing. Curtains are a weird, cheap material. It's needs a classy overhaul from decor standpoint. Windows are thin, doors thin - you can hear street noise + noise in hallways. 

Fine to pay 200-250 a night but I would not pay to stay here in peak season. The downstairs lobby, restaurant, bar is where they've invested and the rooms are where they've cut cost and it's very apparent.

title: GOOD TO WORK
text: Very nice, staffs so friendly and helpful. Good location to travel. Wifi is enought to work. The location of this hotel is ideal if you love food. Plenty of good and famous restaurant nearby,. THe hotel is clean but don’t have good view. in fact some room have no view at all. they look into air well. We stayed in 2 type of room, one with balcony which has street view and one with totally no view.

title: Such a great birthday!!
text: For my birthday I decided to stay in NYC for one night with family and I was so lucky to get such special treatment. The front desk and bell men were so helpful and attentive (Especially coming back so late at night & letting us in). When i went to my room there even was water, a bottle of wine and Milk Bar cookies!! Normally I'm not a huge fan of sleeping in hotels but I felt so comfortable and at home. I had such a great view and cant wait to visit again. The James NoMad is definitely going to be my new birthday tradition!!

title: Delightful Hotel!
text: We recently stayed at The James NoMad during our first trip to NYC. It's great that the building has been preserved, and it is located in a spot so we could easily walk to places we wanted to see and experience. Our room was clean and comfortable. We were delighted with everything, and hope to visit again soon.

title: Above and beyond
text: Checked in at 11pm after a long journey from Asia - seamless check in and the suite was great. Woke up at 330am and desperately needed coffee. Called the front desk and to my surprise after explaining that I was on Asia time zone a hot pot of black coffee was promptly delivered to my room

title: Amazing Hotel - Chic and Comfortable!
text: I stayed at The James for three nights and felt at home and at peace. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful, and the ambiance was something special. Great location and overall outstanding service!

title: Just ok
text: I stayed at the James for few nights over Christmas, I love the neighborhood, the room was pretty large but the bathroom was ridiculously small, you could not have 2 peoples at the same time in the bathroom. Lobby was sad, dark  and small and need refreshing. Service was ok but really not really friendly. It is suppose to be a 4 stars or 4.5 stars depending on the website but it is more like a 3.5 stars at best. Price was reasonable but not sure I will stay there again.

title: Nice and quiet
text: This small hotel is a jewel. The room was extremely comfortable. Bedding was luxurious. We were on the fourth floor for two nights.  The morning was very quiet with little if any street noise. The staff was professional and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Perfect family hotel!
text: Our family of 5 stayed in the queen suite and it was perfect. Unbelievably spacious for a NYC hotel room! The extra seating area (in addition to pull-out) with table made a huge difference. The staff was great, the lobby ambience was one of my favorite parts, I could've hung out there all day.. modern yet old-fashioned. Since it was my milestone birthday, I was greeted upon check-in to our room with a bottle of champagne! However the maid cleared it away the next morning even though there was hardly any drank yet (late arrival.. on ice I would drink it all weekend!). That was a major bummer. Overall a win-win for this family of 5!The free continental breakfast was part of a sit-down in the attached restaurant. As a family, we would have greatly preferred more of a buffet type to eat and go. Instead we had to wait for service and then of course tip. The breakfast was delicious just not the appropriate setting for our tween kids (although we did enjoy a fabulous dinner there the night before!). Because of that we only used the breakfast coupons once. As above, super annoyed the maid took/cleared my opened yet almost full bottle of champagne.

title: Fair
text:
Generally speaking the hotel is providing the service and quality expected.
A nice lobby with a 5 o’clock complementary wine and pastry. 
The room is fair (some carpet stains and in the bathroom some wallpaper was peeled of) .

The most questionable experience was when we left the hotel. We asked for a taxi from the hotel to the train station (which was not far away - 16 USD by UBER later) The answer of the bellboy was that for such a distance he can’t call a cab. WHAT????
We where 3 persons with 4 luggages. What this guy had in mind? Should I take a walk???
I ordered an UBER which worked out but the attitude of this guy was questionable./-

title: The James is The Best!
text: My first stay at The James was a winner! Cozy, comfortable room on a quiet floor. What’s not to like? Guadalupe and the front desk staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. Plenty of amenities made my three nights an absolute delight. Can’t wait to come back!

title: Convenience, class and amazing service
text: My family stays here every year over the holidays. It’s convenient, impeccably clean, modern and has great restaurants and amenities. Although there are many hotels in NYC that offer this, the staff at The James sets this hotel apart. I’d particularly like to call out Jose Martinez, who went above and beyond this trip. Jose is a delight and provides a small luxury hotel approach in a city that may feel to some as cold and impersonal. If you are looking for luxury NYC accommodation that doesn’t break the bank, this is the place.

title: Great Staycation
text: Stayed at the James for a birthday celebration this weekend and it was perfect. The staff went above and beyond to make it extra special sending chocolate covered strawberries with a personalized note! The rooms were super clean and we had everything we needed. Would highly recommend you check out the Seville in the evening if you enjoy live music we had a blast!

title: Great stay Great staff
text: Georgette is the most kind and meticulous housekeeper I have met in a long time!  She’s kind always has a smile on her face and always says good morning. Great location great staff! Love the coffee in the mornings too!

title: An excellent 4 night stay.
text:
Warm welcome from everyone at the hotel, from the front door onwards. The room was clean, spacious and well maintained.

Free tea and coffee every morning, in the relaxing lounge by reception, with complimentary wine offered in the evening. 

The free WiFi was good in our room on the 6th floor and the public areas of the hotel. 

Location was great for us and we’d definitely return.

title: Not worth the price, and too much noise
text:
I came during a busy time and I was paying around $500 a night for the basic room. The thing that bother me the most is how noisy the room was. My room was close to the Madison Ave and on a Saturday night it was very noisy. I could hear car drives by, people talking and laughing, truck noise and many noises during the midnight. I barely had a good sleep. I would expect the price to give me at least a quiet sleep... Then the AC system in the room is old too, it is not very responsive and it became either too hot or not heating up at all. The light switches are also old and hard to adjust; it took me many tries to get it working. 

If you prefer a quiet place to take a rest after a busy day, I would not recommend this hotel. Both the window and door are so thin you could literally hear everything

title: NoMad....Yes quite mad....unprofessional and disrespectful management
text:
If you expect to valet your car, deal with the valet and NOT the front desk staff-i still have my automobile recovery claim check and had to pay $80. to park and $115. to nyc for a parking ticket
If you expect to enjoy wifi, good luck.
If you expect robes and slippers you may have 1 out of 4
if you expect shampoo-bring your own...the bottle was empty
if you expect customer service go somewhere else, nyc has far happier places to stay

This is the claim which is essential for automobile recovery....unfortunately this situation did not go well. Furthermore the manager did not have the grace to deal with any of these issues. That is not the right way to do business.

title: Will be back!
text: The James Nomad was the perfect hotel for our NYC visit. Prior to our visit I had messaged with Kaylee the guest service manager. She was responsive, informative, and so sweet. She even took the time to meet us upon our arrival. All of the staff was attentive and helpful. The hotel room was large the beds so comfortable. The coffee and wine in the lobby is a great touch also. The location was awesome for walking everywhere. The hotel has so much to offer that I didn’t take advantage of, the fitness room, the speakeasy, the restaurant. Our trip was a quick couple days of exploring the city we just didn’t have time. We will be back and will definitely stay at the James Nomad again.

title: Extraordinary Experience
text: Our entire family of 28 members, aged from 10 to 82 enjoyed the Thanksgiving week in NYC while staying at the James Nomad.  We were, to a person, thrilled with this hotel.  The staff went beyond helpful and friendly when dealing with both adults and teens.  We were most impressed with the respect and friendship the staff showed to each other.  When you have a group of people who obviously enjoy working together, it leads to  an atmosphere of kindness and openness that was unexpected in New York City.  The lobby served as a great meeting place as well as a quiet refuge from the bustle of the city.  Our visit to NYC was wonderful, thanks to this outstanding hotel.  Cleanliness, service, and hospitality unmatched in any hotel we have ever visited.  Thank you, James Nomad

title: Fantastic!
text: We really enjoyed our stay at The James New York. The hotel is beautifully done, the location is great, the rooms are very nice and the staff was excellent. I would have no issue recommending this hotel.

title: First time at the James Hotel
text: My boyfriend and I had the pleasure of experiencing a night’s stay at the wonderful James Hotel! Pradley provided us with amazing customer service and the quick and easy check in/check out made our stay that much better. 10/10 would recommend if you’re looking for a great hotel experience in NYC.

title: The James Penthouse suite + The James suite
text:
4.5 stars for the Penthouse Suite. We splurged one night in the Penthouse suite (there are two) and then downgraded to the James suite for the next night. Family of four who have stayed at The James Nomad multiple times, enjoyed our stay leading up to Thanksgiving. We enjoy staying at The James because the suites are spacious and we usually stay in the James suite (bigger but only one bathroom) or the Jimmy suite (two separate spaces with a bedroom and a living room with pullout couch separated by a teeny hall area but TWO bathrooms). The Penthouse suite is beyond spacious and luxurious. The only reason why it's not a full 5 stars is because there is no pull out couch. With all that space, there should be additional sleeping options. One kid slept on the couch and we got a rollaway for the other kid. 
We downgraded to the James suite for the next night due to the hefty price tag. There were no bars of soap but we actually brought our bars down from the Penthouse because we didn’t want to waste. 
We REALLY wish the James Nomad would get rid of the expensive resort fee or give the option of not partaking in the happy hour. Hotel resort fees are the biggest turn off. I'd rather drink my own wine or go to the many bars the city has to offer. If you're not going to get rid of the resort fee, bring back those delicious breakfast croissants!
Staff are super nice and friendly. We really like the James Nomad.

title: Felt high end for reasonable prices
text:
Overall a good stay. Lobby was very pleasant and had daily morning coffee and evening wine and snacks (all snacks gone by about 6pm but wine replenished throughout). Hallways and common areas were very nice. Everything felt pretty high end. 

Rooms were small but well laid out. The bathroom was tiny but mostly functional, the shower curtain was too short so more water got on the floor than I would have liked. Bed very comfy. A medium amount of street noise but no hallway noise nor could I hear anyone else through the walls. No coffee maker in the room. Yes fridge. Very nice Arpelles bath products. Good furnishings and fixtures. 

Overall good value for the price, especially if you’ll utilize the wine hour. I was most impressed with the quietness of the halls. The heather was nice and quiet too. 

Neighborhood was great with lots of good coffee.

title: Another Wonderful trip to NYC
text: This Hotel is amazing.  The rooms are spotless and well stocked.  The bathrooms were meticulous and no detail left out.  The lobby is amazing- great place to hang out and socialize.  The coffee in the morning is wonderful as well as happy hour.  The staff helped with any request we had and all door man/valets were so helpful and a good sense of humor with 5 18 year olds and their stuff.  This is the only place I will stay in NYC.  Eric Foley runs an amazing Hotel.

title: Comfortable room, Well located for moving uptown and downtown, great lounge, wonderful staff,
text: I travel a few hours to work as a consultant  in a New York  City Museum at least twice a month, and have stayed at the James hotel more times than I can count.  It is always my favorite hotel.  I can easily visit all the Museums on the Upper East side  by hoping on a subuway nearby, and I can walk to the Village and many great places downtown to see art or friends.  The beds and rooms are all comfortable .  The lobby is a great place for coffee or to meet friends in the evening.  The staff is superb.

title: President
text: The James Hotel is a true special place in NYC.  A throwback boutique feel with modern amenities and a great central location.  The staff is friendly and welcoming.  The teas and coffee in the am and the wine reception in the early evening are great additions.  Plus the price is right!

title: Mixed
text: We had a suite and although the rooms were of a good size the furniture and decorations are tired and a lot of of the paint is chipped. There is nowhere to hang damp towels . The windows were filthy so the well posted views of the Empire State building was diminished and pretty much the only way to get a good view was by lying on the floor!It’s the first American hotel I have ever stayed in that had no tea or coffee making facilities. The gym was small,inadequately  serviced with some broken equipment.Although we were guests at the hotel we were not able  to be seated in the bar in the evening.

title: Fantastic Experience
text: First off I just want to say thank you, to everybody involved with running this fantastic hotel. I say this with the most sincerity that the service here was top notch. Immediately upon our arrival we were greeted by James who worked at the door and always greeted each guest with a smile and a positive attitude. His positive attitude and good spirits always made my entrance to the hotel something nice and pleasant. The cleaning staff did a tremendous job with the room and the lobby being as clean as possible at all times. Aside from all of that the front desk and all staff were extremely helpful, but I wanted to give a special shout-out to Diane, who was extremely helpful to us all throughout this entire trip. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is visiting for whatever purpose, it serves all needs and is top notch.

title: Perfect midtown hotel for family trip to NYC
text: Great hotel. Staff were super helpful, nothing was too much trouble. Room facilities are fairly basic which is reflected in the price (NYC is super expensive!) but very clean and functional and reception were always happy to respond to requests. Lovely welcome gifts for our boys and SUPER comfortable beds which is so important after a long day OU sing the sidewalk. I would recommend.

title: NYC Business Trip
text: I just recently stayed at the James Hotel NoMad in NYC a about a week ago and absolutely loved it. Great location, extremely friendly staff and a well kept hotel. My room was perfect! Even had a nice gift and card waiting for me when I arrived. All the amenities were on point. They even had a little complimentary happy hour in lobby which was perfect timing because I had to wait for my Uber right. I can’t wait to go back soon. I definitely recommend staying at The James when visiting NYC.

title: As bad as it gets
text: I can’t believe how awful this hotel experience has been. From booking hassle, to check in nightmare, to snobby attitude, to my room looking directly into someone else’s room. This place is hands down the worst hotel experience I’ve had in 25 years of global travel.

title: Worst hotel experience ever
text: Stayed there for my son's wedding weekend.  Awful experience.  Given a room with electrical issues, likely a short behind the bed, no ceiling light in bathroom, poorly serviced (no drinking glasses, washcloths, someone's toothbrush on bathroom floor under the sink).  Asked for quiet room and loud people in adjacent room.  Hotel moved us.  Second room was smaller (but still the same price).  Better but there was a missing lightbulb in one bedside lamp.  Hotel is dated and shows it.  The worst part was HORRENDOUS issues with parking that caused us to be late to the wedding brunch.  Waited more than 45 minutes in the lobby for our car only to learn the garage had brought the wrong car and the valet hadn't realized it.  Hotel said they would remove parking charges from the bill but haven't done it yet.  Very hard to reach a live person to discuss issues on the phone.  Long waits to get front desk, room service and housekeeping to pick up the phone.  Finally just went to front desk with complaints.  While staff were very nice, there was no real resolution to any of the problems.  Absolutely not worth the price they charge.  Many nicer places in NYC at this price point.

title: Lobby is amazing. Rooms have much to be desired.
text:
Cons: Got stuck in the elevator. No microwave or fridge. My particular room also did not have a working heater. 

Pros: Doormen are very accommodating. Lobby and restaurants are fantastic. 

Overall, I don’t think I can recommend unless you plan on staying no longer than a day or two.

title: Very nice hotel
text:
The rooms are very comfortable. Nice location. But specially, the service is amazing, great people helping you in any and all matters related to your stay. Special mention to @Rossanna Marquez, the best recommendations.

Will come back in my next trip to NYC

title: Hector was a great help
text: Staff member Hector at the front desk solved a thorny problem for me with swiftness and grace.  I have occasionally had issues of prepayment when having to change the duration of a stay at other hotels and came up against a stone wall.  Hector worked with me and contacted the managers to resolve my problem equitably.

title: 👍🏼
text:
The stay was incredible, rooms super big for nyc standards, bathrooms kinda small.
The happy hour with live music at the lobby was incredible ( given you can’t go to the bar because you need reservation ) free white and red wine and super singers.
Ricardo the manager was AWSOME !! 
Kid friendly 👍🏼👍🏼

title: High quality from start to finish. Neighbourhood a little suspect...
text:
This is a really very good hotel. Great check in, well before the official time. The room was large, clean and well equipped with a fully stocked fridge, plenty of hot water. I had room 620 which didn't have much of a view.

One downside was a lack of kettle/coffee/tea making facilities. The bed was very comfortable and room quiet. All the staff I met were fantastic and I loved the text customer service channel as I had a couple of issues and they were sorted out.

As someone coming from the UK, the area feels little "dodgy", especially at night but the Bourke St bakery around the corner does great coffee and baguettes. The hotel restaurant has limited hours and limited menu but the breakfast we had was very high quality.

title: Courteous management
text: The Nomad was very accommodating when my plans changed and I had to cancel the last night of my three-night stay. They let me cancel free of charge late in the afternoon of the third night. Very much appreciated!!

title: Decent hotel nice location
text: Chose this hotel bc the bed size and room fit a family of 4 nicely. Only stayed one night and everything was good. Room was a bit dingy- stain on the carpet and kind of an odd odor on our floor. I still feel it was a nice stay- gym was great and enjoyed the morning coffee and helpful staff

title: Definitely stay here again!
text:
We came to New York for the US Open. James NoMad was our home away from home. The staff were super friendly and customer service was outstanding. 

The hotel building itself is elegant and our room is very comfortable. The breakfast was delicious and there are plenty great restaurants within walking distance. 

Definitely come back again! 

Karen F.

title: Beautiful hotel, great location
text: Highly recommend! I would definitely go back in the future. Room service was fast and friendly. So many great restaurants and shops within close walking distance. Checking in was a breeze. Perfect especially for a short stay.

title: Perfect if you’re looking for a friendly and a comfortable stay.
text:
Visited NYC with my 18 year old daughter. The hotel was a great location for us, the area was tidy and easy access to everything without being too busy. The room was small (as everywhere in NY) but perfectly set out for the two of us. The bed was super comfortable. The lobby was quite luxurious and maintained a friendly atmosphere. The morning coffee and apples was a nice touch, as was the evening glass of wine. 
What made the hotel especially good was the helpfulness of the staff… all were lovely but Jayda was so kind to us.  Her lesson on how to navigate the subway and then the bus station held us in good stead (and I can get lost in a paper bag!).

title: Run away / fuyez
text:
Hotel bien situé mais au service mediocre. 

0 service dans l'hotel,  personnel assez désagréable, propreté sommaire et il faut faire couler 15' l'eau pour avoir de l'eau chaude :((( 

A éviter, pour ce prix là vous pouvez sans doute avoir mieux.

title: Great location
text:
Easy to reach other areas from here. Room was quite pokey but excellent servicing from the cheeriest maid ever.Just avoid a corner room. Special shout out for the door staff especially Joe . Helpful and cheery.
Only issue we had was in the cocktail bar which was unfriendly and we were ignored for some time by the staff. Needless to say we went elsewhere.

title: Acceptable, but you can do better for the money
text:
First the good: We got a double queen room, and the room was very spacious by New York standards

Now the bad:
-lighting in the room was very poor, if you want anything other than dim lighting, forget it
-the bathroom wasn't adequately stocked; no second roll of toilet paper, and one soap dispenser to move back and forth from shower to sink
-we got a bit of attitude from the front desk when arriving for not giving our car keys to the valet, when the valet wasn't even present
-the hotel restaurant for breakfast was a joke and is absurdly expensive for a lousy meal (they upcharged me for a second egg with my meal without me realizing, and they arrived raw and cold)

No deal breakers, but lots and lots of little flaws. You can do much better at this price point.

title: Overall great experience
text: A quiet very well situated hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Clean, well conserved, New York style property with súper confortable bed, pillows and linen. Block and a half from subway station.  I would definitely return

title: Solo traveler -- wonderful stay
text: The James Hotel is a wonderful place to stay in NYC. The service was top notch and the room was very comfortable. I loved the wine and music happy hour in the lobby every day. It was so nice to sit and rest while looking at the Empire State Building and the old church across the street after a busy day. The location can't be beat. A subway station is a block away.  The neighborhood is somewhat quiet. I couldn't hear a lot of sirens and honking from my room on the 11th floor.  I would have loved a coffee maker in the room and more channels on the tv but those are small details. I will be back.

title: Amazing
text:
Great location
Easy check-in process
Nice staff
Lovely rooms
Spacious bathroom (separate tub/shower)
Fabulous snack and liquor bar
Vintage feel
Fresh toiletries 
Clean
Extra large towels
Happy hour (Friday)
Photo booth
Concierge 
Parking/Valet Parking

title: Charmant hôtel New yorkais
text:
Hôtel avec une très bonne localisation entre Madison et la 5eme Avenue. À proximité de pas mal de monuments dont l’empire state building. 
Les chambres sont spacieuses et propres. La salle de bain est impeccable. 
Seul bémol : un peu trop de bruit mais lié à la vie New Yorkaise et une offre de petit-déjeuner trop onéreuse. 
Mais une adresse à retenir

title: Great Property
text:
The hotel is lovely, the Jimmy Suite was comfortable.  It was a good location for us and was very quiet. Only two things to note:  

The website says "in-room dining" but this is only for breakfast.  We arrived at 8pm assuming we could order room service and could not.

The magnifying mirror in the bathroom is a weird, foggy circle set into the main mirror. It is useless.

Overall, we really enjoyed the hotel.

title: Birthday Trip to NYC
text: Guadalupe of the front desk was really wonderful during my stay. She knew that one of the days I was with the hotel was my birthday, and saw to placing a bottle of wine and cookie treats in my room to celebrate after a day of excursions. And she also treated me to a room upgrade. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the hotel staff recognizes me from previous stays, which always makes me feel "at home" when I arrive at The James Nomad. And the restaurant, Scarpetta, is exceptional, with fresh and beautifully prepared dishes, and a professional, fun staff. Thank You!

title: Amazing location and great size rooms!
text:
We chose The James New York NoMad for 2 very important reason.  Location and the size of the rooms.
We travelled NYC underground and walked so much because everything is accessiable and conveint!  The room we had was Deluxe Queen Room with Two Queen Beds for me and my husband with our teen son.   It was a great size, lots of space for luggage and hanging what needed to be hung.  Even had a small sitting area with a bar fridge.
The bathroom was amazing with both a tub n shower and a seperate shower.  
We had an issue with the AirConditioner leaking and our housekeeping staff advise us she reported this and advised us to ask to change the room.  They gave a us a slightly small room and bathroom but still spacious.  The bathroom was an accessable bathroom for people in need of handle in the shower/tub.  
Will be happy to come back to NYC and stay at The James!

title: Uma estadia perfeita.
text: Fomos alocados no The James em virtude de um problema em nossa reserva previamente realizada em outro Hotel. Desde a recepção na chegada até o saída tudo foi perfeito. O cuidado e atenção em cada detalhe. Equipe muito bem preparada e principalmente atenciosa. Em especial nosso agradecimento ao senhor que nos recepcionou no checkin, infelizmente não me recordo o nome. Mesmo sendo já de madrugada foi muito atencioso e nos tranquilizou para deixar nossa estadia perfeita. Fizemos alguma solicitações e dúvidas para a equipe e fomos muito bem atendidos. A localização e as instalações são perfeitas. Já no checkout nosso agradecimento especial vai para a Sra Guadalupe. Muito educada e atenciosa nos deixando a par de todo o processo e fazendo que nossa saída fosse muito rápida e sem burocracia. Um exemplo de profissional. Bom, agradecemos a toda equipe do The James. E sem dúvida, será sempre nossa indicação em Nova York.

title: Enjoyed our weekend!
text: Great hotel, lots of natural light, nice vibe in lounge on main floor. Very helpful hotel staff, particularly Jayda at the Front Desk who not only accommodated us without an advance reservation (after we moved from another hotel) but also upgraded us.

title: Short break
text: Great location about 15 minute walk from the Empire State Building.  All the staff from the doormen to the receptionists were friendly.  We had a king bedded room on the 8th floor overlooking a seating area on 28th Street.  The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom with shower a good size.  The coffee in the morning and wine with savouries in the evening served in the lounge were welcome..

title: Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Value
text: Getting a hotel in New York can be challenging because you don't know what you are going to get. There are negative reviews for every place regardless of cost. And unless you've been to a specific neighborhood recently, you can't really predict the noise, ease of transportation access, or things specific to the hotel like room size. While this hotel is not the cheapest, we felt that we got what we paid for, which is by itself saying something in NY. The location is phenomenal, the staff were super nice, the room was great, and it was very quite. By far the quietest place I've stayed in the city, including Brooklyn. I have already recommended this hotel to several people.

title: Nice Location and Building
text: The hotel is at a great location. Clean. Friendly staff. Comfortable beds. Staff was unresponsive when multiple requests for towels were made even after an hour.  Also a moisture issue in the room (perhaps the AC) which made paperwork and clothes damp. Nice bar and restaurant on the premise. Not a bad place, but for about $400 a night, there are better options.

title: Great service
text: The absolute best event team and hotel staff Ever. My team coordinated a two day learning community for a client and this was the hotel. When I tell you that Adis was amazing. He was so personable and helpful. He helped us to get out r packages and so much more.

title: Best service ever!
text: The absolute best event team and hotel staff Ever. I coordinated a two day learning community for a client and this was the hotel. When I tell you that Adis was amazing. He was so personable and helpful.

title: Excellent Service
text: Great atmosphere! Nightly reception with wine, savory pastries, and enjoyable music. Comfortable beds, good use of space in each room, and clean. Very friendly and welcoming staff especially Jayda and Guada!

title: We can't wait to go back next week!
text: What a wonderful experience we had staying at the James Nomad in April. We were looking for the perfect place for our family and we found it! Perfect location and ambiance! Special thanks to  the valet/doormen who welcomed us with smiles, to Jada at the front desk for going out of her way to take family photos for us, to the delicious breakfast at Scarpetta restaurant and amazing service, and even to the bellman who had to carry our luggage through a street carnival when we were leaving. Everyone made it so special and we are grateful! Looking forward to our next stay on the 31st!

title: Perfect location
text: What a location! Perfect for us to base ourselves in city and quick walk any direction to subway. Staff were lovely. Rooms really good by nyc standard and quiet. Wine hour in the lobby with views of Empire State is a fab touch. 100% stay here on return.

title: Business Trip
text: From the moment I checked in, the staff consisting of Miguel, jayda Danny and Guadalupe were extremely helpful.  They provided the best customer service and I was very impressed. I will definitely be back.

title: Great Staff with the Bellman
text: Thanks to Miguel and Danny for their outstanding customer service skills.  They have been very helpful in providing transportation for us.  They have made our stay very enjoyable,  Thanks  Please let them know how much we appreciate their hospitality.

title: Excellent stay at the James Nomad Hotel
text:
We had a great experience at the James Nomad Hotel during our recent trip to NYC. The hotel location was very central, and a walking distance to many places in the heart of the city. 

The hotel was very cozy and our room was spacious considering that we were in NYC. The staff at this hotel were very good and we had positive experiences with all the bell men (Ashraf, Daniel and others). Everyone had a smile and they were very professional. 

We would definitely stay at the James Hotel on future trips to the city.

title: Hotel moderne
text: Un hôtel moderne avec un certain charme. Très agréable. La chambre était un peu bruyante, mais plutôt confortable. L'emplacement est très bien, pas loin de l'Empire State Building et proche de nombreux restaurants.

title: Extremely nice stay & Good location in  Manhattan &
text:
Nearby 5th avenue& metro of 28th East .
 nice hotel & happy hour between 5-7 pm with wine & snacks. And free coffee in the morning. 
 good beds and possible to be with 4 adults in one room with 2 large beds

title: Amazing!
text: This hotel is absolutely incredible! They take hospitality to the next level! The amenities and door to door service are unmatched. I’ve traveled to many cities and countries and have never met such wonderful people!! I will definitely stay here again!

title: Great place to stay in NYC
text: My husband and I were in NYC for the 2022 NBA draft. We had a wonderful time at The James. It was clean, relaxing, excellent service, and a perfect location to walk to the theater, restaurants and sights. We would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Not what was advertised on their website!
text:
We just came from a wedding in New Jersey and wanted a nice spoiled last 3 days before our trip back to LA. On way to hotel we upgraded to a James suite and was told that the website guarantees the best rate avail. Well… they ended up charging us more than the website posted rate, which is not the best guaranteed rate! 

Once we got to the hotel and checked into the room, we found out that they didn’t have room service for lunch or dinner which is so disappointing because we upgraded our room so that we could enjoy drinks in our room with the view. The room had a bar with no ice, no coffee machine, no wine glasses.  So all this luxury and. Making our stay great online was not true! 

We have our 3 year old with us and was going to give him the pull out couch. No extra blankets or pillows in the nice closet! 

The feel of the hotel is very trendy and cute but I have to admit that my first day has been extremely disappointing. 

I called their reservations/booking once I realized the amount they charged on my credit card and they didn’t know what was going on, spoke to the manager at the hotel and she was no help with telling me she can only give me 10% off.

I know we will spend way more than this stupid situation but it’s the principle of what the hotel is marketing and publishing on their website.  The Benjamin and the Nomad in LA are some of our favorites but we will stay our 3 nights here, pay the crazy rates and make sure we tell all our friends to beware of this place. I would also say that the manager Lauren was not helpful and frankly …doesn’t really care
.

title: Excellent stay
text: I recently stayed in the James Hotel Nomad with my three children.  The room had a beautiful bathroom, a sitting area, and a separate bedroom. A spacious room made our stay most enjoyable. The staff is professional, friendly, and helpful. The neighborhood is walkable, near both parks and dining. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Amazing Hotel and the Staff, WOW!!!
text: There are SO MANY great things to say about this hotel; check in is at 3pm, we got in early and Hector gave us a early check in at 9am, that's not even the best part, he upgraded us free; from a queen room to a king!  Very friendly and helpful staff throughout the hotel as well. The nightly social gathering in the lobby for complementary wine and snacks was a added delight to our vacation. Lobby is beautiful and chic, relaxing atmosphere.  This was our first time at this hotel, and we felt like Queens! Definitely will be back again and again.  Thank you for the incredible stay at your hotel, and thank you Hector!

title: Fabulous stay at The James
text: We have just returned from a nearly 2 week stay at The James. We had two rooms (one for my family of four including 1 and 3 year olds, and one for my father). The hotel was wonderful - spacious, modern, very clean, and super friendly and helpful staff. It was also very accessible for us, as we were using a double side by side stroller, and had no issues at all.  The location was brilliant - close enough to everything to allow us to walk all over Manhattan (big walking days of course but definitely achievable), but also very close to the subway if we chose to use it. The hotel was quiet and peaceful, and only a couple of blocks north of Madison Square Park and the Flatiron Building. Excellent amenities nearby including the usuals like Starbucks and Wholefoods. We loved the buzz in the morning where we enjoyed complimentary tea, coffee and fruit in the lobby (with its big street facing windows, some with views of the Empire State Building, and airy space) and also the end of day wind-down at the 5pm happy hour, also in the lobby.  We ate at Scarpetta on our last night and had a wonderful meal to finish off our stay at The James.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York City, be it for business or pleasure.

title: Top notch customer service.
text:
I’ve stayed at the James monthly this year for work and above all else why I keep coming back is the people. The front desk staff are kind, helpful and make it a 10/10 experience. Anything I’ve needed help with or concerns are swiftly handled. Shout out to Phil who is funny and kind, I always hope he’s on the desk when I’m checking in. 

Also Scarpetta, their in-house restaurant has arguably the best cacio peppe ravioli in the city.

title: The staff were everything
text:
well located, solid on-site restaurant bar, nice overall vibe. Room was comfortable...

But it was the service that made the experience. Jayda and the duty manager were incredibly accomodating when last minute changes and requests were made. Thank you :)

title: Great accommodations
text: Enjoyed my stay here. Room was very clean, the toiletries provided were amazing. All the staff I interacted with were friendly and very helpful. I am looking forward to staying here during my next trip to NYC.

title: Great location/great room/great staff
text:
Lovely hotel, great location, great service! We had a corner room on a high floor, being on a high floor definitely cut down on street noise.
The view was lovely, the room was sizeable for NY. The bath products were top notch.  The music and wine happy hour has great entertainment (the wine was ok). The Seville was super fun - not a cheap experience but great food and people watching - definitely make a reservation.  Service at the hotel was great, special shout out to housekeeping staff Marie Saint Amour who went above and beyond in her helpfulness and kindness! No in-room coffee but there is free coffee in the lobby in the mornings.

title: Amazing staff, Great service...
text: I can't say enough about this Hotel. My room was spacious and squeaky clean. The Staff was Attentive and Professional, Friendly and Accommodating. I really enjoyed my stay at the James Nomad in Manhattan. Big Thank you to Marie, Adis, Ben and Pradley and all the others for making my vacation Amazing.

title: Awful service and rooms.
text: I stayed at The James in May 2022 and it was an absolutely awful experience. The room was dirty and had multiple things broken. The telephone has a frayed cord and was not connected to the hub unit. The blow drier was broken and did not turn on. The robe had a hole in it. The room smelled like cabbage my whole stay for some reason. The other issue is I am nursing and was traveling for business. The front dest staff was not equipped to deal with helping me freeze my milk and at some point lost some of the milk. There is a formula shortage and it was unacceptable. Overall I would not recommend.

title: The STAFF and their services were PHENOMENAL!
text: The hard working staff was very attentive and accommodating. Starting with the receptionist who set the tone was friendly and helpfut. The maid service kept our room immaculate during the duration of our stay. The management was very attentive and made sure that our stay was enjoyable. Thank You- Addis, Ben, Mary Saint Amour and Pradley...You all made our stay memorable. I highly recommend The James NoMad Hotel in New York City !!

title: I really appreciate the Hames NoMad!
text:
The Hames NoMad has been the first choice of my business accommodations for over six years going. For my purposes, you can’t beat the location. Most recently, I needed to extend checkout and Jayda saved the day, providing a few extra hours in-room for a video call. The privacy and comfort made the difference. 

Morning coffee, happy-hour wine and citrus-infused water are nice touches to the beginning/end of my days in Manhattan. Of course,

title: Fantastic service sets this hotel apart
text: What a wonderful place to stay.  At first I was given a room that was a bit too small for me to comfortably work.  JOSE TO THE RESCUE!  He immediately changed my room and checked in to make sure I was comfortable.  That matters more than the amenities.  Also, DANNY, a bellman helped me check out so I didn't have to wait in line and watched my bag so I could run around the corner to pick up a snack before my trip home.  I will definitely stay here again.  I've stayed in more luxurious accommodations but every department at this hotel was responsive and helpful.  Especially housekeeping and building engineer when I needed help.  Highly recommend staying here because the PEOPLE make it wonderful.  Also great that Scarpetta is in the hotel...wonderful food.

title: False Online Photos
text: Overall our stay The James ended up being fine, but not before we switched rooms. We booked a Deluxe King room and when we arrived the room looked nothing like the pictures. The bathroom was completely different and the room was TINY. It is totally my fault for not realizing the square footage, but the pictures were not the same as the room. We ended up upgrading our room to one of the suites which was lovely, however, when we went to the suite I realized the pictures they used for the Deluxe King were actually pictures of the suite we were now in.  Not cool.

title: Anniversary weekend
text: Had a wonderful time at the James Hotel. Service and accommodations were amazing. The location is central to great restaurants and coffee shops. Thank you Jayda at the front desk for making our stay extra special

title: Avoid if possible
text:
Rooms are ok, but the shower is terrible. I complained about it and the hotel moved me to a room with the same issue but in front of the elevator. Essentially, they have made the problem worse instead of fixing it.

Further, I was expecting a package at a certain date and asked the hotel (at least five times in 24h) whether it had arrived, as I would leave in just 1-2 days. The reception always said that no package had arrived for any hotel guests, such that I had to waste a full day running around to figure out what had happened. Turns out the package had been there since the first time I asked, but nobody bothered to look.

For over 400 dollars a night, I’d avoid this place as much as possible.

title: caring staff
text: It is a nice hotel.  My room on the 7th floor was clean and the bed quite comfortable. The thing that made my stay special, though, was the staff.  I wanted to especially thank the doormen who helped me find an umbrella when it was raining, directed me to a nice cafe, and helped me when I was having trouble getting a ride.  Very nice attentive people.

title: Honeymoon
text:
It’s a wonderful and peaceful place in the middle of everything, very close to the Empire State also  the staff was amazing. 
The continental breakfast at the restaurant was really good.
Thank you! 
I recommend this hotel 100%

title: LOVE IT
text:
Truly a centering place, clean cozy, staff always available 
easily accessible, i loved the interior design of the hotel, clean cozy room and well organized. loved the face mask 
I will definitely return to this hotel

title: A hidden Gem
text:
This was my first time staying @ The James Nomad, and I must I was quite impressed. Simplistic in Design, while embracing all the finer touches to perfection. Our corner room overlooked Madison Ave which gained me extra points as it was my partners first time in NYC. I honestly wish we had another evening to enjoy all the comforts! The James is a clear representation of still being provided the best both worlds in the ever-expanding NYC - a preserved historic building encompassing a luxury modern interior.  

Thank you to all the staff we appreciated every moment from start to finish!

title: Location, Location, Location
text: Is this the fanciest hotel in New York? Not by a long shot. Is it luxurious? No. But it is comfortable, well run (super friendly folks at the front!), and the location was perfect for a girls weekend in New York. Easy walking distance to subways, Grand Central, the New York Public Library, the High Line, etc. We happened to be there on a beautiful weekend and Madison Square Park is a great place to hang out and people watch. Our room was perfect for two of us, comfortable pillows, good mattresses, good bathroom.  And the price, relatively speaking, was reasonable. Didn't try the restaurant or bar but it was nice to know they were there.  Only suggestion: it would be nice to have coffee in the room for super early risers.

title: Proposed in Suite!
text: I proposed to my now fiancé in one of the Jimmy Suite Deluxe rooms. The hotel was extremely accommodating and helped me to make this special day go according to plan. Camile in reservations was pivotal in helping all of my plans go perfectly! The room turned out amazing. The whole experience was great from the lobby to the suite. The suite was great and very spacious. Big living room area with a big comfy couch. There are also a ton of great bars and restaurants nearby.  Cannot wait to celebrate future anniversaries at the James Hotel. Highly recommend!

title: Daughters’ Spring Break
text: Great stay. Early check in saved us from our red m-eye hang over. Moved us to a quieter room because street construction was loud. Great service! Great location! Comfortable rooms. We will return in the summer and stay there again. Doesn’t hurt that Scarpetta is downstairs either.

title: Friends Meetup in NYC
text: Met friends for weekend in NYC (2 adults and 2 teens).  Stayed at The James for the location and was recommended to me by my nephew who lives nearby.  Location was fabulous, central and walking distance to just about everything.  Really great local coffee shops, delis, restaurants and the flagship Milk Bar!  The hotel lobby was comfortable, funky and chic.  Great coffee in the morning in the lobby.  Staff are fabulous, friendly and helpful.  Did not eat at the hotel but th restaurant looked sultry and lovely.  The room we had fit all 4 of us comfortably. The beds were nice, pillows fluffy and soft. The furniture was old and appeared to be a mishmash of things but I did not mind much.  Bathroom was large with nice walk in shower and a separate tub. Generally nice place to stay at a good price.

title: Terrible experience
text:
The first room we checked into was so small we could barely walk around the bed. No where to unpack or even put the suitcase on the floor. Not even a chair in the room. Very small even for New York. We complained and were moved to a larger room. Still very limited drawers. The sink was so small that there was no room to set any toiletries. The faucet in the shower barely trickled out. And one day brown water came out before it cleared up. 

The staff was very nice but I would not stay in this hotel ever again.

title: Super accessible and clean with fantastic rooms
text:
The James took service to another level, and was always willing to help with any inquiries / requests. 
The rooms were immaculate and the entire stay was awesome from start to finish. 
If you are looking to get a spacious room, in a great location I wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel

title: Great location, great experience
text: Stayed here two nights. Well-located, great amenities, and my room was clean, comfortable, and quieter than a lot of NY hotels. Most notably, the staff is absolutely lovely! Everyone I met went above and beyond to ensure my stay was wonderful.

title: Designer
text: It is my first time staying here and the location of the hotel is amazing, and the beds are super comfortable. The hospitality thanks to Hector (front desk), was really unmatched. Hector was absolutely fantastic in taking care of any of my wants and needs. He really helped made it feel like home !!! Thank you! I also appreciate that they are responsive by text at all times and really make an effort ! CAROLINA

title: Great stay & great staff!
text: I stayed at The James Hotel for two nights & had a great experience. The hotel was clean and the amenities were nice as well. The staff at The James was amazing. Jayda at the front desk was extremely friendly and incredibly helpful throughout my stay. The hotel was also pet friendly and they provided services for pets as well. Highly recommend the James hotel for anyone traveling to NYC

title: The best
text: I have stayed here 3 times and I love it every single time. The location of the hotel is centralized, and the beds are very comfortable. The hospitality received from Jayda is unmatched, she was absolutely fantastic in taking care of any of our wants and needs during our stay. I also appreciate that they have complimentary coffee in the morning and daily entertainment in the lobby. Scarpetta the restaurant attached is also absolutely fabulous.

title: Great place to stay
text: Accommodating staff and fresh clean environment! Perfect quality time with family and friends. :) Also recommended visiting 230-Fifth Rooftop Bar; and indeed! It was a very amazing unforgettable experience!

title: Perfect stay
text: The hotel was luxuriously comfortable, with large rooms for NYC, comfortable beds, quiet throughout, clean and well cared for common spaces, and kind staff. We were treated so well during our stay with our children, and every time we needed something, from getting a sweatshirt cleaned to borrowing a screwdriver for a toy, they were so gracious and helpful. The location is perfect, easy to get anywhere in the city and close to several subway stations. The bar is excellent and the Bourke Street Bakery is a must! Have a sausage roll and a flat white for breakfast. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Great value, great hotel
text: Very lovely hotel for the price and location. Happy hour is included and a quality bakery is available, as well. Jayda at the front desk was incredibly helpful and accommodating. I would definitely recommend.

title: Great hotel
text: Great price / quality ratio! Very well located. Friendly &  helpful staff. Big room. Good vibe. Lobby is cool.  Adjacent restaurant is very good, too.    Bar seems to be nice too.                  Liked hotel decor.                                                                    Thanks!

title: Excellent
text: Hector was super friendly and helped us a lot. The hotel also smells really nice. I really enjoyed our stay. It is super central and close to loads of restaurants and bars. Was really easy to check in and they let us check in early.

title: The most wonderful staff
text: I recently stayed at The James with my sister for a quick girls weekend.  Our room was large by NY standards and the location was great.  I usually stay downtown but wanted to try something new - I'm glad I did.  The bathroom sink was large (plenty of space for all our stuff) and the shower drained quickly.  The beds were comfy and the room had all the basics plus some extras.  They serve wine in the lobby and have live entertainment in the evenings which is nice, but really, the stand out at this hotel for us were the staff.  The front desk, the doormen, housekeeping, everyone...everyone was friendly, gracious, and responsive and really, after a hard couple years, it was lovely to be out and about, experiencing true hospitality again.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Check-In was super pleasant and smooth.  Hotel and Tram had great energy.  Room was flipped and cleaned quickly and early each day.  Great facilities and wonderful employees.

Located in the perfect area, as well.  1/2/3 and 4/5/6 trains are just steps and away and you are walking distance from so much.  

Awesome area for either business or pleasure trip.

Highly, highly, recommend.

title: Terrific staff
text: I have always enjoyed staying at the James NoMad in NYC.   Terrific staff, great location.  I usually do not write reviews, but I wanted to share a great experience from my most recent stay.  The evening I left the hotel and was traveling back home, I realized that I had left my Apple AirPods Pro in my room.  I called the hotel -- housekeeping had already located them and, after a couple of email exchanges, they FedEx-ed them to me at no charge.  Many thanks to the entire staff for their heads up and speedy resolution to my mistake!

title: OK hotel with seriou deficits
text: The hotel is quite nice, with the rooms clean and comfortable. However the internet service is very bad - i could not work from my room. I find that a hotel that charges between 3 and 4 hundred bucks for a single room MUST provide these days a good internet service. Another serious problem is the lack of breakfast service - I found myself going out in terrible weather to find a decent breakfast (which is relatively easily found in the neighborhood). I will not return to this hotel.

title: Fantastic hotel and staff
text: Best hotel experience I’ve had in a very long time. Fantastic establishment. Aziza and Anthony couldn’t have been more hospitable. Very clean, comfortable and HUGE suite!!!  Scarpetta right off lobby. Fun and chic club downstairs. Thanks Sawyer. Highly Highly recommend if you’re  in NYC.

title: Great find in a great location
text: We have now stayed here 3 times for the last few years and there is a reason for our repeat visits . The lobby is spacious and beautiful and the  daily free coffee and hot teas in the morning and wine and little treat for happy hour are a nice perk  The staff is very courteous and very attentive to anything you may need. The rooms are clean and very nicely decorated . If you can request the room with 2 queens as the space is quite large for a NYC hotel room. Will come again as this is our favorite place to stay. Location is great too as it is convenient to a lot of restaurants and shopping .

title: Great location and super friendly!
text: Check in was the easiest process…front desk staff were all very helpful and knowledgeable.  Rooms are much bigger than anticipated.  Excellent amenities, including soap, restaurants and detachable shower head.

title: A total gem
text: Everything about this hotel was fantastic. Spectacular location, superb restaurant and incredibly comfortable beds. The bathrooms are spacious for NYC. Very nice marble tile shower. The staff were warm and inviting. I will definitely be back for another stay

title: Hector did a fabulous job!
text: We had the pleasure of staying at the James Hotel over Valentine’s Day weekend! lovely modern room looking out over the Empire State Building covered in snow!!   Thanks Hector for taking care of our stay!

title: Great size rooms. Comfy beds. Central location. Friendly staff
text:
Hotel is súper central. We were 2 friends traveling together so really wanted a hotel with big rooms and 2 beds (which we found in the James).
Hector checked us in and was great, really helpful.. and throughout our stay (4 nights) really great.
The attached bar and restaurant were fantastic.
I personally would have loved more storage in the room.. but this is easily solved with hooks and maybe another table or cupboard.
(2 girls have a lot of stuff 😄)
Would defo stay again!

title: Great Hotel
text: Hector greeted us. He took great care and gave us a wonderful room with an incredible bath. Lobby is chic. Location is great. Exterior is a treasure. Details line a magnifying mirror in the bath meet all needs.

title: Amazing!
text: Wonderful experience! The room was immaculate, and the lobby looked pristine. Our interactions with the staff at the front desk were great. Aziza sent a lovely welcome message via text. Prime location. Highly recommend.

title: A High End, Mid- Priced, Midtown Gem
text:
We visit NYC often. Usually for a day or two to go to a museum, shop, have dinner and/or visit our daughter. Most ‘reasonably’ priced hotels these days have shoe box rooms and minimal service. The James Nomad is a refreshingly expansive, updated property with comfortable, roomy rooms, attentive, friendly and professional staff, and up-to-the minute technology. 

Our standard king bed room had a stylish, upholstered chair, love seat and table. Well-designed, modern bedside lights offer plenty of charging sockets and provide ample pleasant ambient light. 

The bathroom is similarly spacious with more than enough  room for two people’s accessories. The shower is a renovated, glass-enclosed step in.

The James has a bar, meeting spaces, an excellent Italian restaurant and a sprawling first floor lounge where residents can enjoy their morning coffee or just sit around.

We can't say enough good things about the entire staff. They were personable, attentive and went above and beyond throughout.

title: Empire View
text: Our family stayed at the James suite, and it was spacious, with a great view of the Empire State Building! The mattress and pillows were very comfortable, and the pullout couch for our two kids was large enough for them to sleep comfortably. We had a great time, and the staff were so kind, welcoming and attentive.

title: Great service!
text: Jayda was awesome, so helpful and accommodating! Could have been left out in the snow but was nice to be upgraded to a nicer room with an early check in on spot notice. Love this place and recommend it to all my friends.

title: Midtown Manhattan
text: Had a girls weekend at the James Nomad. Hotel was spotless. Staff was very attentive. Location was perfect centrally located close to transportation walking distance to many bars and restaurants. Especially helpful were Billy and Ali in engineering. Ali was attentive and fixed the issue in the bathroom

title: Wonderful Experience at the beautiful hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel with 2 of my friends for a weekend and it was the most wonderful experience ever. The rooms were beautiful and clean. As well as the staff was very attentive and made sure our stay was perfect. Billy and Joe were very helpful during my weekend getaway and made sure I had a great time and answered any and all questions we may have had. I definitely recommend staying at the James Nomad Hotel, as you will not be disappointed and it’s in the most perfect location in the city. So public transportation is accessible if you need to catch a train or bus. Additionally, there are multiple restaurants, cafes, and activities to do that are walking distance.

title: Perfect place for a girls night out
text: Stayed at the james nomad in New York City I had an amazing experience. Staff was very helpful starting from the front desk check in to check it out. Place was very clean and I felt safe. Especially helpful work Billy and Joe. The place was centrally located we walked to A bar and a restaurant that we had reservations for

title: Great staff!  Pradley was fun and friendly.  Our family enjoyed the evening wine!  Lovely property as well! Locate great
text: Enjoyed six nights at The James!  The staff was lovely.  Great location!  Our family enjoyed the evening wine in the cozy lobby.  Our room was spacious and well maintained.  Pradley was fun and friendly.  Would highly recommend this property! Location ideal to walk about Manhattan.

title: Superb service and clean hotel
text: Where should I start? Well, the service upon entering the hotel was amazing! I was greeted by the doorman who helped us with our bags and passed us to the bellhop and fabulous front desk! Jada at the front desk is so detailed and knowledgeable of the area. The rooms are really clean and spacious, especially for being in NYC. Wine in the late afternoon and  lobby music was great. We had a hard time getting a reservation for the restaurant but the manager Bradley was able to assist and squeez us in. We will definitely return.

title: Jose and Manny are the best!
text: After a long day of flying it was great to meet Manny and the door!  He helped me in with my luggage and introduced me to Jose!  Jose was fantastic, telling me all about the morning coffee and evening snacks!  What a rockstar!  He made our night.  We also had a delightful meal of different fish items on the scarpetta restaurant!  Worth it.  Thank you Jose for making our arrival so memorable. Everyone should ask for Jose!!

title: Big room, but that's about it.
text:
The Jimmy Suite King was a good sized room, especially for NYC, which we appreciated.  But I would have preferred a slightly larger bathroom and a slightly smaller bedroom - the bathroom is tiny!  

The room felt kind of sad. It was dark, and felt pretty sparse.  It could definitely use some refreshing to feel a bit more luxurious.

The staff were fine, though the bellman was a little concerning after he told us he could get the key to the gym for us if we didn't have vaccination cards to show.  Otherwise, he was very helpful, bringing us water, extra glasses, and bedding to make up the sofa bed.

The cleaning of the room was not thorough.  Dirty glasses were left behind and not replaced with clean ones.  Empty water bottles were left behind and not replaced.  Some used washcloths were left in the bathroom while other towels were taken and replaced.  It all felt haphazard.

We had to call the front desk a few times because the things we requested came very piecemeal.  We called for clean glasses, and because the light switches were not working.  The glasses came, but no one came for the lights.  Finally, after calling again, someone came and looked at the lights, and apparently the lamps  needed to be plugged into some device in order to use the switch.  The man who came said he would go look for one, and when we asked how we were to turn off the light if he couldn't fine one, we were told, "Unplug it."  Really, for $1k/night, we have to unplug and plug in the lamp!!  Come on!

On the bright side, the restaurant, Scarpetta, was fantastic.

title: Highly Recommend.
text: Stayed for 6 nights with my daughter and her friend to do some shopping.The staff were extremely hospitable and were very courteous and willing to tend to any of our needs. The James suite was very spacious for a New York Hotel.Lovely view of Empire State Building.Great Location and Fabulous Restaurant.

title: Six Star!
text:
What great staff!

We had a major booking issue, not the Hotels fault. The staff went the extra mile to ensure it did not affect our holiday. Thank you 

Pretty hotel, with good facilities. Complementary coffee in the morning and wine in the evening, in the lobby was a nice touch and created a good atmosphere. 

Rooms are lovely, beds very comfortable, being English it would be nice to have tea making facilities in the room for the morning. 

The area is in a quieter area of Manhattan but an easy walk to the attractions, plus some nice restaurants and bars very near the hotel. 

Thank you all for making our stay special.

title: The James NoMad great compliment to a successful business trip
text: Beautiful hotel, with an authentic mid-century modern vibe.  Hotel staff were knowledgeable, courteous and helpful in every way.  Room was clean, spacious enough, and quiet. Highly recommend for an enjoyable stay in NoMad.

title: Great 1 night stay
text: My husband and I stayed in a Jimmy Suite King and were very happy with the roomy accommodations. It had a sitting room and a separate bedroom. Very clean and the bed was quite comfortable. A very small separate shower, as well as a shower within the tub. Empire State Building right outside our window. Everyone was friendly and professional. Terrific jazz/blues singer, Najah, in the lobby on Thursday night between 5&7pm, when complimentary wine and hot chocolate with Bailey’s were served. We saw a show at MSG and the walk was only 15 minute from the hotel. I highly recommend The James. Only 4 stars because shower so tight, no room service, and no bar near by after the show for a nightcap. Restaurant bar closed at 10pm. It was a Wednesday night though.

title: Not worth it
text:
The definition of Boutique Hotel should be we can charge you a lot more for a whole lot of nothing. 

Positive-the beds are extremely comfortable

Negatives-everything else. We got two rooms for a family’s wedding. One of the rooms had no closet and extremely small armoire that didn’t fit the dresses. The bathroom is extremely cramped with no counter space to get ready. The shower heads are miserable that are so low and the water pressure is nonexistent. The rooms are old and dated. For the price you’re paying it’s not worth it.  Lastly, with the crazy rise of covid cases in the city many staff members were massless and not enforcing the new indoor mask mandate for the costumers, as well. Very disappointing to see.

title: Gets better every time...
text:
It was a brief family getaway to New York but as always, it continues to meet our expectations.

The James is a fantastic hotel. The staff is excellent (at all levels) and Scarpetta is simply amazing. The hotel is in a great location with easy access to subways, dining, parks, etc. Highly recommend.

title: Fantastic location for relaxing NYC trip!
text: We enjoyed our stay at The James. The bed was very comfy and the hotel is centrally located, but not in the middle of the chaos. It was an easy walk to Times Square and also to Rockefeller Center. Our room was very quiet. Our window faced the inside (not the street).  The room was spotless. It is a typical NYC small hotel room and the only complaint I have is that the bathroom is particularly small and it is difficult to wash your face in the sink due to a shelf that is attached to the mirror.

title: Like a home away from home.
text: What a great place to stay.  The location is perfect as from here we went north to museums and central park and we also went sound to restaurants, a food tour, and the Hi-Line.  The hotel itself provided a very comfy room, always present water in the lobby, and a large area of cushy chairs to gather with friends.  We were traveling with a group and it made it easy for us to meet and gather.  Highly recommend.

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: The James is a lovely spot, centrally located, close to subway and shopping and the service is top notch. Really love how they connect with you by text and you can ask for anything at all, just with a quick text. Response is super speedy and gracious. Rooms have high ceilings which makes them feel spacious and they are actually a good size for NYC. Lovely big showers with both rain shower head and hand held. Hip mid-century decor. Particularly love the mini bar. Looks like it's right out of mad men.  Great bath products too.

title: 2nd stay EVEN BETTER!!!!
text: The James made some amazing changes since my stay over the summer. They added an evening wine and pastries reception with live entertainment. I was lucky enough to check in on a Friday night in which they even had a local bartender serving cocktails. It's such a great vibe especially before dinner. The huge standout as always is the manager Brandon. He is such a rockstar!!!! Constantly entertaining and helpful. Brandon is a huge reason why I returned to the property, and will continue to do so. The staff here is excellent. I absolutely adore this hotel!

title: Great service
text: I stayed one night with my girlfriend and Brandon went the extra mile. He got us a Reservation at Scarpetta which was delicious. When staying at the James ask for Brandon. He’s such a great part of the James team!

title: AMAZING EXPERIENCE AND MEMORABLE!
text: This was my first time in NYC and I cannot stress how satisfied I am with my experience. Young man named Brandon made this just perfect. I love just how welcoming and genuine he been the whole time there.

title: The James NY NoMad has it All: Beautiful Hotel - Immaculate - Wonderful Staff - Fantastic Stay!!
text:
If you're looking to stay in NYC, The James New York NoMad is the place for you!!

As you walk through the door, Miguel (so kind) will greet and help you with your luggage. Hector, Rosanna, Phillip and Jeydis will warmly welcome you and make you feel like your the only person in the hotel! 

The James NoMad rooms are immaculate and luxurious - housekeeping is exceptional. 

Scarpetta restaurant is located in the hotel and is amazing. (Be sure to reserve early.) Prior to dinner, stop in the lounge of the James from 5-7pm for their complimentary wine (every evening) and live entertainment Wednesday-Saturday. 

As you check in, be sure to ask for the Manager, Brandon Rivera, who is truly the best! Brandon can help with everything from questions about the hotel to what are the best places to visit during your stay. Brandon, if you are reading this, thanks again for your wonderful assistance!

Last but not least, The James NY NoMad is located in a very nice and very safe part of the city.

title: Great Experience
text:
Nothing better than walking into The James for the first time, and being greeted warmly by Jayda. From check in to check out Jayda was so friendly and charming.  With hospitality as good as this, I will definitely be returning. 

Sean P.

title: Amazing stay with AMAZING stafff
text: Stayed here for a week-long work trip. The dates for my stay were incorrectly booked and it was not realized until I was checking in. Hector from the front desk, was so accomodating and helpful at getting the dates adjusted and putting me in an incredible room. The staff was so kind and helpful around the clock. The room was very spacious and the location was prime. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone and will definitely be staying here again. Thank you for everything James Hotel and Hector - you are all amazing!

title: Great stay at the James
text: I stayed here on a weekend for a local getaway with my wife and had a fabulous time. The front desk team gave a warm hello. Housekeeping was generous with extra towels and provided service daily. The real standout was the Operations Manager Brandon Rivera. Warm and attentive and recommended a lovely restaurant in the area. He also was able to get us into the speakeasy in the hotel which was fully booked. Brandon thank you for making a local New Yorker feel like royalty! My wife and I will be back!

title: Perfect stay
text: We had the  best time staying at The James. Perfect stay for our family so we could enjoy one night in NYC. Spacious room friendly staff a lovely wine and appetizer happy hour and they were able to offer us an early check in. Location was great. We walked downtown and to the theater. Nothing was far. We will most definitely be back soon!! Thank you

title: Great service
text: I normally don’t write reviews but I had to for this hotel! What a great location in NYC, busy but definitely not too crazy and excellent service with beautiful clean rooms! I especially loved the cocktail hour with live music at night time, I did not expect that! I also must mention that Brandon the manager is very attentive, super accommodating, and overall a very personable employee. His passion for his work is very apparent. If you’re in NYC I don’t think there’s a better option!

title: Awesome staff at the James Nomad!
text: Quick trip — one night in and out during Fashion Week.  Hotel was incredibly busy, but staff handled everything exceptionally.  I left a garment in my guest room and the staff went to the ‘ends of the earth’ to make sure it found its way home.  Major thanks to the Operations team (Pradley — you are the BEST) and the James’ General Manger, Eric (hope I got your name right), who went to extraordinary lengths to assist.  Highly recommend this hotel for a brief stay or extended trip to NYC.

title: Crap experience, worse (non) resolution
