text: I stayed here end of June.   NYC was going through one of its bad summer heat waves.  During the last two nights of the stay the AC broke down.  The entire hotel was SWELTERING.  Staff were telling us it is not the hotel but the utility which is reducing electricity supplies.  For my final night I moved to another hotel a few blocks away which somehow, miraculously was spared by the utility - they had good aircon.  When I checked out Robinson told me I was going to get a refund.  Obviously nothing came.  When I called they passed me to someone called Erika who never picked up and had a full voice mail box so couldn't leave message. I then asked the card company to do a chargeback which the hotel refused to honor.  I asked for $270 which was just one night.  This hotel has zero sense of doing the right thing.  Stay somewhere else.

title: NYC
text: I stayed at the James with my wife and we enjoyed it very much. The rooms were big, comfortable and clean. The set up was very appealing and the overall hotel aesthetic was great. The lobby had coffee and a happy hour, which was a nice surprise. The James being on Madison Avenue wasn’t too noisy and centrally located enough to visit many different nyc hot spots. (If it’s your thing, the museum of sex is right around the corner .. and if it’s not your thing, you’ll never notice it, don’t worry.) There’s an Italian restaurant attached to the hotel with great food and also a fantastic steakhouse down the block. The diverse staff were all friendly and knowledgeable. I’d definitely recommend a stay here.

title: Home away from home
text: My family and I were recently displaced due to a fire in our nyc apartment. My husband and I brought my two children to the James Nomad to stay while the apartment was being repaired. The James was truly a blessing. My son and I began to call it our “home-tel”. The rooms are lovely and spacious. The beds are very comfortable and the bathrooms are beautiful. The staff was very friendly and welcoming and the lobby was inviting and warm. Every morning they offer coffee and in the evenings they have drinks and music. The location is fantastic being only blocks from Madison square park, which always has a wonderfully creative art installation, a playground, Shake Shack and is almost always guaranteed to have musicians. Also there is Eataly and the Lego store, amongst other shops. Bryant park is not far going uptown and Union square is just a bit further going downtown. On Madison Avenue there is a great view of the new One Vanderbilt skyscraper and on 29th street, just steps from the James entrance, there is a phenomenal view of the Empire State Building. There is plenty of shopping nearby on 5th avenue and is also just blocks from Herald square and Macy’s. After we left, my son asked many times to “go back to our home-tel”. It was truly a home away from home in our time of need. Big thanks to the James nomad!

title: Ms
text: Recently we stayed at the James Nomad… we found  the staff and service to be friendly and above to make our stay more comfortable… from the gentlemen who greeted us at the door to the front desk!!!  The rooms are spacious and bathrooms beautiful… we like the amenities so much we ordered them on line! We loved the complimentary tea and coffee in the morning and the complimentary wine and bites in the evening… they had live music which is always nice.. it’s a perfect location to places like Hudson yards, the Highline, and Little island… directly attached to the hotel is a delicious Italian restaurant … I highly recommend The James Nomad..

title: The Staff made the stay a 5 star experience
text: The rooms were clean and the location was perfect for my business meetings.  The staff was quick to help with anything I needed and made sure accommodate any request.  I will definitely make this my hotel of choice for all future trips to the city.

title: Couples NYC getaway
text:
Love this boutique hotel. Is centrally located and walking distance to many attractions. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff are friendly, helpful, clean rooms, comfortable beds and excellent dining at Scarpetta’s. In house lounge called The Seville includes live music and cozy trendy atmosphere. 
Funny story:  In June Jamey found an add calling all James to New York City. 40% off room rate if booked before June 30th. 
We have absolutely enjoyed our stay and love the culture and people of New York City.

title: Phenomenal location
text: I had the pleasure of staying at this location due to a business trip. Brandon Rivera made my experience a remarkable one. He was super professional, very welcoming and I couldn’t ask for a better experience. I highly recommend staying at this location. I will most definitely be back in the near future!

title: Our stay The James NY
text: Everything was great at this hotel….the staff was amazing .Brandon Rivera helped us with places to see and eat and was very helpful.Overall we had a great experience and looking forward to seeing you guys again soon…..

title: Excellent Service!! Home away from home
text: I travel often throughout the year to New York City and have for several years now.  I have stayed at many hotels over the years and after this past year when one of the hotels that I use to stay at for the past 11 years closed down, I had to find another to replace it.  I came across the James NoMad.  Upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised with the level of service. The service from beginning to end was excellent! In particular , the attention and professionalism provided by Mr. Brandon Rivera, the hotels Operations Manager was what made my stay that was just over a month long incredible.  Mr. Rivera’s hospitality and attention to all my needs and requests goes above and beyond !  This gentleman is an asset to any business and clearly takes pride in his role at the hotel. I will be staying at the James NoMad as my home away from home going forward.  This decision was easy given the great experience with my initial stay and to all the staff that made be feel welcome, especially Mr. Rivera.

title: Pictures deceiving
text:
Be warned that the hotel looks nothing like the pictures.  Room is extremely small, bathroom is the size of a closet.  There was no place to put my toiletries.  Hotel is old and dark.  Don’t be fooled by the pictures like I was.

If you’re cloister phobic, stay elsewhere.

title: Start spreading the news!!
text: What a phenomenal stay at The James New York. The service from start to finish was impeccable. Complimentary coffee in the morning available in the lobby daily, but complimentary wine and pastries every night was even better! The Live entertainment on Thursday was absolutely great. The Managers in the Front Office really set the bar for the stay. Brandon and Aziza went the extra mile and arranged a beautiful Prosecco in my room. Two hospitality professionals who help because they enjoy it not because they have too. The bell boy Atis was very pleasant and helpful with directions. This property is beautiful and the service is even better. I cannot wait to RETURN!!

title: Mr
text: We stayed at the hotel for 7 nights. Everything was fine,big room,comfortable beds.Coffee in the lobby durig morning & wine at the afternoon. The manager Brandon was the best,take a care ,very helpful  with a smile all the time.Bravo!

title: Excellent stay in NYC
text: Stayed at James Nomad for three days for a mother-daughter trip. The location was perfect - very walkable to all the NY sites we wanted to go. The rooms were so spacious - we had a room with 2 double beds and it was very roomy. Unexpected in a NY hotel room. The bathroom as well was super spacious with a nice big shower and lots of counter space. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. Would definitely stay here again and will recommend to anyone visiting NYC!

title: Great location, friendly, helpful staff
text:
What a hidden gem. Great location, large contemporary rooms, and best of all - friendly, helpful staff!

Aziza went the extra mile to arrange an amazing room service delivery to mark a special occasion. Thank you!

title: Pradley Concepcion, Director of Operations, is EXCEPTIONAL
text: I recently stayed at the James Nomad for 8 nights on a business trip. The hotel is great & Scarpetta is wonderful but by far the standout of the entire stay was the service provided by Pradley Concepcion, the Director of Operations. He was wonderfully attentive & helpful with shipping packages & any detail I needed during my stay. Thank you, Pradley! I’ll be back on my next NYC visit.

title: Director, National Sales
text: There’s simply no words to explain this gem of a property that sits on Madison Avenue off of 5th.  The atmosphere is fabulous, staff is friendly, accommodating and offers the best in customer service experience.   Michael Vellos, staff member, is outstanding in his role at The James.  He is the center of why this property is amazing.  You may not remember what people say but you always remember how they make you feel.  Staying at The James makes me feel great.  Its simply my home away from home while on business travel.

title: Simple, easy, one stop shop!
text: I held a team meeting at the james in July and I cannot express how little I was looking forward to managing the logistics of meeting space, catering, guest rooms etc. My experience with this in the past has seemed so unnecessarily labor intensive, but the team at the james nomad made it so easy that it was a breeze. Michael, Brittany, and Tricia quickly coordinated with me on guests and needs, offered me suggestions for space, setup, and menu, and the whole thing came together with a few email exchanges in one day. They thought of everything, even offering to set us up with transportation to and from the hotel. The meeting space was chic and sophisticated, the menu was exceptional (guests from out of town were blown away by the authentic Italian dishes from Scarpetta), and I’m fairly certain our entire room block was upgraded to premium rooms. The entire team came to check on us twice and made us feel as if we were the only guests staying with them that week. I have held meetings like this at many properties throughout the US, and particularly in NYC, and this was by far the best experience I have had to date. So much so that we returned a few weeks later for another meeting and they seemingly found a way to make it an even more special experience. The team at the James has gotten it right, highly recommend!

title: Service, Location, 5 Stars! ⭐️
text: Thank you so much for making my business trip feel more like a vacation! Aziza and Brandon and the whole front office team display exemplary hospitality! Also greatly appreciate the relaxing yet trendy lobby + made the perfect office without all the hustle and bustle.

title: Bugs in the bathroom
text:
I stayed for one night @ the James Hotel Nomad.  I was treating my nieces to a night in the city and was hoping the hotel would be pretty nice to make them feel pretty special and luxurious!  

The first room: someone was smoking in their room, since we have asthma we had to switch rooms (smoking is prohibited in the hotel).

The 2nd room:  We walked in and our room smelled disgusting…like punch you in the face disgusting. After a while we started getting used to the smell so figured we would stick it out since we didn’t want to move rooms again.  However, when my niece went to take a shower their were bugs in the tub!!

3rd Room: Smelled like a normal room…however, when I woke up in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom there were bugs slithering around near the toilet (gag).  I didn’t even tell the hotel at that point because I realized it’s just a crappy hotel.

After leaving the 2nd room the manager called and was extremely apologetic and sounded genuinely sorry for my inconvenience and offered a significant discount for the room.  I appreciated the call, but the hotel is far from what I expected. 

Scarpetta was amazing though, my nieces really enjoyed that part…but they were too scared to sleep in the bed so the slept on the comforter!! LOL

title: Excellent hotel, 5 star service, great location, rooms and amenities,
text: This was the perfect location for my wife’s 40th bday.  Scarlett and The Seville are excellent on site as well!  5 stars, don’t miss this hotel.   The Rooms are large and the service all over the hotel is top notch.

title: Fall visit in NY
text:
We had heard good reports on the James from friends. Booked here for our first NY visit in three years and first extended travel since COVID. Well appointed King room, quiet even facing 29th Street, excellent housekeeping. The staff are very helpful and friendly. We also enjoyed the morning coffee in the spacious lobby, bringing in delicious items from the Bourke Bakery around the corner  in the hotel building but separate operation. Evening wine hour also enjoyable.
 
Roman with the front door staff was particularly helpful with some extra needs and airport transfers.
 
Would easily stay here again.

title: Great location and friendly staff at the James
text:
Love this boutique hotel in NoMad, great location if you are taking the train in or headed downtown to Village or Soho.  Nice quiet neighborhood but still lots of great eating and drinking options too.  Nearby is Madison Square Park and Union Square.  

Rooms are spacious (for NYC) especially if you get a Queen Queen or even a King, rooms/bathrooms renovated pretty recently.  Nice experience overall with front desk, housekeeping, valets, etc.  Highly recommended!

title: Hospitality & Accommodations
text:
I am impressed I am with the amazing staff and especially the front desk. I frequent this hotel monthly and one person in particular who helps me with extreme professionalism is “Hector.”

Rakiem Walker

title: Great staycation
text: My fiancee and I came for the weekend and we were bot disappointed. Hector helped us make our stay extra special and we will definitely come back. Very comfortable bad and nice eco friendly shower amenities

title: Great hotel
text: Brandon is definitely a great person to talk to for anything AT ALL, he WILL make it happen . The hotel staff goes out of their way at any giving time to take care of your needs. Definitely come here when in NYC

title: CEO
text:
Staff  are very kind.
Specially   manager Brandon treat us like family. 
Very good memories like home.
Every morning  breakfast and coffee  also were
good.
Location is very convenient-  near Madison Square Park.   so many restaurants. 
Korea town.  Empire state building

title: Misses the mark, but has potential
text:
Booked the Jimmy Suite for a weekend in NYC.  Location was good, pretty easy to get all over the city, even walk if you're up for it.  The room was very large, by all standards, not just New York, and comfortable for a family. The bed was comfortable and the sheets felt & looked clean.

The good ends here.

The bad:
First room- Shower drain brown, condensation rings on bedside tables, AC unit pulling away from the wall, overall in need of some TLC.
Second room- Spacious, however was told the suite I booked had 2 bathrooms, this only had one.  Not a big deal. Asked twice for sofa bed to be made up.  Still was not done upon our return to the hotel, so we did it ourselves because our kid was in need of a bed.  Opened it up to find a black evening dress/nightie still in the bed.

To be fair, $200 was taken off of our room for that night.  The manager was apologetic in the moment.
There was NO follow up the next day-- not a phone call, note to our room, fruit platter, etc.
I received an automated text "checking on our stay" and I received an unautomated response that someone would check on the issues, again no follow up.
Lastly, the front desk staff was very pleasant and courteous, however, each time we were in the lobby or the desk it was as if we had never seen each other before.  It was strange. No effort to ask how are you, check on or improve the stay/experience.

title: Amazing
text: I took my girlfriend here for the night. We were going to an event at MSG and figured we would spend the night. The room was very clean and we had access to everything! Staff was helpful with directions when we were leaving for drinks at night. Scarpella is attached and definitely amazing. Very safe environment and easy to get Uber Eats delivery’s to for late night cravings. The bed was very comfortable, bathroom was very clean, and everyone was very friendly! Would definitely recommend and we can’t wait til our next visit!

title: Cute hotel in great area
text: The hotel lobby and restaurant are great.  The management and staff extremely welcoming and helpful.  We experienced some slight issues with the room but the management and staff did everything perfectly to resolve the issues.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.  One note, many guests were staying with their dogs.  We never heard any dog barking while in our room, but walking down the hall, so hopefully that is not an issue. Overall lovely  stay.

title: surprising find in great neighborhood
text: Moved my daughter to NYC and needed a place near her apartment. Had her brother and his friend  to help move, and Jose, at check-in, graciously gave us a fantastic upgrade at a reasonable rate. Room was spacious and clean. The horrible person who had the room previous had actually stolen one of the cable boxes and Jose had someone up there pronto to replace it. Bed was soooo comfortable and we had a dinner at Scarpetta which was fantastic.  If I had to single out anything negative, the tables and desks are slightly scratched and worn but insignificant. Location is walking distance to Madison Square Park, Union Square, and the Village. Will definitely return. Thanks Jose!

title: Bad room
text: TV didn't work. AC broken. Shower was poor. Bar half stocked. Would not recommend. At least provide a room that is fully equipped for your customers. If I am going to pay for a boutique hotel in the city the very to least I can expect is for the basics to be taken care of

title: A trip to remember
text: Staying at the James was everything I wanted out of this staycation! The hotel is absolutely gorgeous inside & out, the cleanliness of the room was up to par, and the front desk went above and beyond to make sure everything about our stay was smooth and to our satisfaction. The manager Brandon was truly a treat for my husband and I because he had the BEST recommendations for us for places to go around the area and he remembered our names and little details we told him each time we saw him. He made my workaholic of a husband want to return before the years over to experience this again and try some places we didn’t get to this time! I would recommend this hotel to any and everyone, the service all around is exceptional.

title: A Marvelous Stay
text:
I just completed a stay at the James Hotel in NoMad and it was terrific. 

The location is close enough to walk to a great array of facilities including transportation, dining, and recreation. It's one of the nicest neighborhoods in Manhattan, I think.

My room was very well appointed and maintained with modern fixtures, ample towels and comfortable linens. I had a great night's sleep. 

The staff was genuinely helpful, courteous, and efficient. Rossanna at the front desk assisted me in locating a FedEx package that I had delivered earlier in the week, and everyone was cheerful and conveyed a positive energy. The right attitude makes all the difference, doesn't it?

When I visit the city, I like to explore different places to stay, but The James in NoMad might make me change that. It's a solid choice that won't disappoint you, and it was a good value for my money. 

Pro tip: you can swing by and check your luggage with them before check in time with zero hassle which is nice.

title: Amazing service at an amazing hotel
text: My husband, 10 month old daughter and I recently stayed at The James and had a wonderful experience. It was the first time traveling with our little girl and from the moment we walked in Hector took the best care of us. He made sure we had a crib and friege for her food delivered to the room immediatly. He checked on us all the time while we were there. The rest of the staff was also great. They helped us with her stroller everytime we came and went. The room was a great size for us, especially considering we had a crib and were in NYC. It was very clean and comfortable. We could not have dreamt of having such a good experience and stay. THAMK YOU!!

title: So far a bit bummed
text: We checked in today to the front desk personnel not wearing masks, which I want to try and understand but with covid, feels a little weird. The room is very small but fine and 2 people have already had to come. 1, because the safe wouldn't work (and I had to ask the gentleman to put his mask on before coming into our room) and now because the air conditioning isn't functioning properly and it's 90+ degrees out. We walked around for hours and came back to a pretty sweltering room. It's also very hard to get through to the front desk to report issues. I want to enjoy our hotel stay as we haven't traveled much since covid but this hotel is falling below expectations right now.

title: WONDERFUL STAY at the James
text: I was originally invited to stay at the James for a work trip. After some slight confusion using my company's link to book the room for an extended stay, the James staff, namely Brittany Favorito, went above and beyond to ensure I was correctly booked. Once I arrived, their effort and attention to my experience did not slow. The entire staff was dedicated to making this the best trip to NY ever. (Much needed after not traveling during the pandemic) The room was beautiful and well kept and the location was amazing. I intend to return the next time I am back in NY. Thank you Brittany and the rest of the James team!

title: I will never stay anywhere else
text: This is my second time staying at this hotel… And it will always be my first choice. I’ve stayed at so many NYC hotels and this one is so well located, the staff is excellent, the rooms are super comfortable and very clean and cool looking, and I love the boutique feel. I especially appreciate Brandon’s attention to our every need. I never write reviews and would highly recommend this hotel. I for sure will be returning.

title: My stay at James Nomad
text: The James Nomad is a great place to stay. I was there for 2 weeks, and the room was always kept clean. After long days, I always came back to a made bed and clean towels. At the front desk people are also very helpful in assisting with any questions you may have. There are so many people to help you get your bags to your room, and there are always people waiting to hold the door open for you. Great experience overall.

title: Guest
text: I had the true New York experience being trapped in an elevator at The James Nomad. Most would panic and although I didn't show it deep down inside my heart was racing. Jermall from security was speaking to me on the intercom the entire time I was stuck in the elevator. 9 minutes felt like 9 hours. Once freed the manager on Duty Brandon apologized for the issue and asked if I was okay. He was amazing and sent a bottle of wine with a note apologizing once again. The hotel deserves 5 stars but only receives 4 because well I was stuck in an elevator! Service was great and I will be back!!

title: Another great stay at the James Nomad
text: I had a great stay at the James Nomad. I love how the hotel provides coffee and fresh pastries in the morning to its guests. The lobby area is spacious and nicely decorated. Best of all, it’s in a very convenient location and always clean. I always stay here when I’m in NYC and recommend this place to anyone visiting the city!

title: Great stay
text: I had a great stay.  Nice hotel in good location in easy walking distance to Madison square park. Enjoyed the morning pastries and coffee in lobby. Eately is a go to Italian place down the street. And East and west village, the best places to go out at night, are close by. Ashraf went above and beyond as a bell hop.

title: Clean, Friendly Staff, Central Location
text: Stayed here for 5 days, 4 nights. The staff was friendly and very accomodating the whole time. They were respectful of COVID protocols, kept a clean environment, and had consistent communication. They were always helpful and readily available whenever I had questions. Overall, would recommend this place.

title: Not a good location for handicapped customers
text:
Like most hotels in New York, The James NOMAD is expensive, but when I made my reservations, I was excited because the website makes the hotel look very nice. The pictures on the website are deceiving, whatever renovations were made to upgrade the look of the rooms were very poorly done and the room was more of a disappointment. 
The James NOMAD is NOT good for Handicap customers
1)	Small elevators: There is a small elevator at the street level that is not easily accessible and is hard to fit a small folding wheelchair and the person pushing the chair and one of the three elevators that takes guest from the lobby to the rooms is also too small and is difficult for someone pushing a wheelchair to use. 
2)	Staff laughed at us as we were trying to get into the elevator: When we first arrived, we were stuck using the small elevator from the lobby to the floor that our room was on. Not only did our children have to ride the elevator separate from us, but we also had an extremely difficult time getting into the elevator with the wheelchair and our small carry-on sized bags. While we struggled, the staff snickered instead of helping us. Overall, it was extremely embarrassing for me, and especially embarrassing for my wife that is handicapped because of brain cancer.
3)	We had to send our children up on a separate elevator because we could not all fit into the elevator: On both elevators, from the street to the lobby and from the lobby to our room, we had to have our young children ride separate from us because they could not fit in the same elevator as us.

The main Light kept turning on and off the entire stay: I informed them of this, and they did not fix this issue. There is a light that runs behind the headboard of the 2 queen sized beds in the room that provides most of the light, this light would randomly turn on and off, since we stayed for a full week, this became increasingly annoying. 

The website says they have room service, we did not find out until the night we arrived that they shut down room service when COVID started and never opened it back up, even though the restaurant operates during normal dinner hours with a large crowd every night, and a lounge with none of the patrons wearing masks. If you want to dine in your room, you will have to order through one of the online delivery services, which meant that most of the time I had to meet the delivery person in the lobby.

The Television shuts down after around 2 hours with no way of preventing the shutdown. A notification would come up on the TV saying to press “Ok” to continue watching, but none of the buttons on the remote would prevent the TV from shutting down. So, if you are watching a movie, expect that you will have the TV shut off during the movie and then must go back through the James Hotel TV menu to get back to your movie.

They added an extra charge of $97.52 initially and then changed the charge to $53.49 claiming that we used the min bar, WE DID NOT USE ANYTHING FROM THE MINI BAR, we either went to Walgreens or ordered everything from Doordash. When I tried to call about the charge, they could not tell me what the charge was for, just said it was from the mini bar.

Their customer service is very poor.
1)	The hotel does not offer help with catching a taxi or any assistance in the morning. I attempted to have a ride set up at 9am to the ferry for the Statue of Liberty and the Hotel staff said they do not offer help with rides at that time.
2)	The gentleman at the front desk when we checked in was extremely rude. While he was checking us in, he barely said anything to us, seemed to be irritable when I asked questions about my accommodations, and did not even look up at me the entire time he was checking me in.
3)	The hotel staff at the front desk and the front door watched and laughed as we struggled to get into the tiny elevator with our small folding wheelchair rather than offering to help.
4)	If you attempt to call billing, you will be sent to a recording that suggest you send an email, I spoke with the front desk about the issue with them adding charges and they transferred me to a manager, but the manager did not answer. When I called the front desk, she put me on hold, hold time so far 36 min. It has been over a week since I spoke with the hotel staff about the fraudulent mini bar bill and the list of other issues, and even though I left messages with my name and my call back number they have not returned my call.

I would not recommend staying at The James NOMAD

title: Wonderful Experience
text: What started out as an issue with our room was saved by the Manager Brandon. Our room type was sold out and he provided us with an additional room for my children. We experienced issue after issue in NY from long lines at the airport to a taxi with no air conditioning. What we needed was our check in to go smoothly. Brandon made sure of it!

title: July 2021
text: Hector (at front desk) is awesome! Just stopped by to drop off our bags, but were able to get an early check in. Everything was very clean. Everyone (staff and guests) wore masks. We had a great night sleep. We will definitely be back.

title: What an amazing experience
text: I came to the James hotel nomad for the location and what a location it was .. the hotel itself is great and the staff is absolutely awesome.. specially Mr Pradley Concepcion .. he was extremely nice and helpful with an issue I was having with my travel agent .. he sorted it out ASAP .. also the restaurant and the bar downstairs is amazing too .. I can’t recommend this hotel enough and I am for sure coming back again .

title: Business / exec retreat in Manhattan
text: I was recommended to the James by a friend and can’t recommend it enough — despite being weird and challenging times. The James has delivered 110% for my party. The team is super on top of it; the rooms are larger than most Manhattan hotel rooms, and all of the equipment is upgraded. They even brought me my own fridge to the room which was awesome. This team and establishment deserve 6 stars! Recommend them +1

title: NYC IS BACK!!!
text: The service at this property is outstanding! The front desk staff is spot on. The door team is super friendly and housekeeping provided me with all my travel essentials. Brandon was so kind and knowledgeable. He recommended his favorite restaurants in the area and provided me with  a bottle of wine upon arrival. NY is booming and the team at The James is OUTSTANDING!!

title: Another Amazing Stay At The James Hotel
text: The team at the James Hotel are amazing!  I had another awesome stay there last week.  Rosanna and Nebi who are at the front desk are the best in the business!  They are always looking for ways to ensure that all hotel guests are happy and have what they need.  A huge thank you to Pradley, who runs a great hotel and genuinely cares about the customers.  The James is the place to stay!!

title: AMAZING Customer Service
text: I booked my stay to celebrate my 48th Birthday. The staff at the Front Desk was pleasant and always greeted me with a smile. Housekeeping not only did an amazing job with the cleanliness in the room but always made sure I had extra towels and ice. A special shout out to GM Eric Foley, Pradley Dir of Rooms and the Front Desk Agent Joe for helping me create a memorable experience for my special day. Joe went above and beyond and sent an amenity to my room and personally called my room to ensure I was enjoying my stay. TOP NOTCH SERVICE!!! I highly recommend this hotel not only for a special occasion but for great service.

title: Great location, outstanding service
text: I booked my stay at this hotel a bit skeptical due to how covid has changed everything.  I couldn’t have been more impressed with the service and comfort.  The staff was amicable and always ready to serve and help.  A few times the staff went out their way to make sure that my two kids were having a good time. The room were in great shape and the beds were comfortable. I travel a lot and in NYC I don’t think there’s a better option.   I’ll definitely be back.  Thanks!

title: The ONLY place I will stay in NYC!
text: The James Hotel is the king of CONSISTENCY.  The customer service, the room cleanliness, and experience delivers EVERY time.  Scarpetta restaurant and The Seville bar/lounge are incredible, offering an extremely well rounded experience in the best neighborhood (Eataly/Mad Sq Park) a stones throw away.  It's easy to get up town or downtown.  Look no further.

title: Beautiful; watch the hidden fee
text:
Room was nice. The staff was very polite. The room we had was Small and comfortable. Great if you just need a bed and plan on exploring the city.  If you will be in the room for a long period of time, you may feel like you are in a small space.
Hotel is beautiful. Lobby is beautiful. Be sure you are aware of all charges when using a third party booker; and be sure that there will be a large hold for Incidentals. We stayed for 10 hours (12 am - 10am) as an emergency.

title: Great value, service in good location
text: My wife and I stayed here in July for a few days whilst visiting friends in NYC. Very friendly accommodating service - extra touch with providing early check-in so my partner could work remotely from our room. Clean rooms, good amenities. Perfect Nomad location, ideal for visiting the Flatiron, Eataly, Empire State Building and more. Rooms are generous for NYC standards and provide a desk and chairs for two people to work remotely. WiFi was strong as well. The beds are also extremely comfortable. Overall a very well valued hotel in great location.

title: Great hotel and excellent service!
text: Big rooms (for New York) with two queen beds rather than full beds - very important when travelling with two teenagers!  Great location if you are looking to be around midtown.  Brandon - one of the managers - was one of the most knowledgeable and helpful people we've ever encountered in a hotel.  His suggestions helped make the trip!  Continental breakfast was coffee and excellent individually packaged pastries (muffins and croissants) from a local bakery.  Lots of great restaurants nearby.

title: Pesimo servicio, no se puede usar el bar del hotel
text:
el aire acondicionado no funciona y el cuarto tiene mucho calor.
Su gerente atiende muy mal y es prepotente.
El bar del hotel no piuede sr usado por los huespedes y es muy caro para lo que ofrece
Nada recomendable

title: Excellent Service
text: There were some issues with rooming that were unresolved by the time of my stay. I was able to get in touch with one of the managers, Pradley. He was able to sort everything out efficiently and made sure that I was taken care of and had a comfortable stay. Thanks for your help Pradley!

title: The excellent staff recovered my jewelry
text: The reason I'm writing this review is because the James staff recovered valuable jewelry several hours after I left them in an open safe in my hotel room. Just a few minutes before my plane was taking off, I realized I hadn't packed the pieces I had just worn for my son's wedding. I figured they were gone forever. But the James staff swung into action and recovered them even after the room had been occupied with a new guest. I am forever grateful. Yes, the rooms are nice but it's the people who work there that distinguish The James. Helpful and dedicated to serving their guests.

title: NYC on the summer after pandemic
text: Nice decoration and clean room with space. Nebi were warmly welcome us at the time we checked in and great hospitalized us during our long stay in Manhattan. We’re not feeling well after vaccinated on the day we check out, Nebi really concerned and assisted us a lot. We’re so appreciated. We definitely stay here again!

title: Home away from home
text: Discovering The St James hotel in nomad is a treasure; is a home away from home. The staff is truly amazing and Rosanne is the best. The rooms are modern with a retro twist with provide a coziness and warm interiors. The restaurant the scarpetta is provides great ambiance with superb food. Will come back again and again.

title: Honestly, just not worth it.
text:
Stayed here 7/1 & 7/2 2021. We have stayed in NYC one or two times a year and like to try different hotels, locations, etc. The location is fine, convenient, relatively quite, all good. The Hotel itself, is not nearly as impressive as the website makes it look, so don't be deceived.  Staff are all friendly and helpful. Room was a good size, especially for NYC, it also had an impressive bar set up. Outrageously priced but very impressive. We had a drink in the restaurant and that was fine, the restaurant looked to be very popular and busy. Unfortunately you can not get a 
 drink or any food at all until the restaurant opens at 5:00 PM. The negatives are that the Hotel is not very clean, carpets in the room and in the halls are dirty and stained. Rooms themselves are poorly decorated, I think they are trying to be retro, but missed the mark by a lot.  Very drab, dark, and generally uncomfortable. In summary,   the Staff are fine, the location is good, the problem is the Hotel itself. Not at all as represented on the website. Also, the +/-$200.00 per night room charge ends up approaching $350.00 per night once all the fees are added on.

title: Love this place!!!!!
text: Great location, tons of near by restaurants you’ll want to go back too. The hotel is beautiful, the room was Huge!!! Immaculately clean and modern. The wet bar was stacked with tons of options and bell service was super fast. Staff were all so professional and polite. Can’t wait to return. Wish I could rate this place higher!!!

title: Five ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ Hotel and service
text: My Wife and I were extremely happy with our stay here. Room exceeded our expectations was modern and  exceptionally clean, staff were quick and polite. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Also located in a great area with many restaurants that are a must to try.

title: Excellent facilities, friendly service, central location
text:
I have simple tastes when it comes to hotels and traveling, but this trip was with my partner, who had not had a good vacation in a while. I decided on the James Hotel due to its central location and I couldn’t have been happier with my choice.

Upon arriving, Jayda at the front desk was kind enough to offer me a small offer as it was my first time at the hotel. The room was clean and well furnished, with a very comfortable bed, accessible wifi, and lovely bathroom. I find you can tell a lot about a hotel from their choice of bathroom products and the James does not disappoint. With our packed itinerary, the room was a perfect for decompressing, cleaning up, and resting in between activities.

When we checked out, Ashraf offered great service with looking after our bags and even booking us a car to the airport at competitive rates (lower than Lyft at the time).

I would recommend the James to anyone looking for a more refined, but subtle, perspective of NY hospitality.

title: Loved this hotel!
text: Extremely nice hotel and staff. My boyfriend and I checked in late after a night out on 4th of July. The staff was super attentive and helped us check in with a breeze at the wee hours we checked in. The room was so clean and modern. Would totally recommend staying here!

title: Very good!
text: Ashraf was a lot of help!! He was very nice in helping us with our luggage and putting the luggage in the car. The hotel is very nice and clean. The rolls are spacious and clean.The service was very good and helpful! I definitely would stay again!!

title: Cheerful experience with strategic location
text: We had the privilege of staying at the hotel, among local atmospheres and the best energy you could find in the personnel. Astounding kindness at the front desk, and a genuine service vocation of the committed workers. Glad to meet all these guys, and hope to come back!

title: Deteriorated since Highgate
text: Don’t ever stay at this hotel. I have been staying here for over 4 years. The hotel has deteriorated since it became a highgate property. I just paid $1900 to stay in a room with no a/c. The hotel’s leadership solution was to bring a fan at midnight.

title: Great stay!
text: My family and I had a great time at the James hotel. Staff was great and very personable and the room was very clean and beautiful. Definitely will choose to stay at the James when we visit NYC again!

title: Great stay at the James nomad
text:
We just stayed at the James Hotel Nomad and all was great.  We had a deluxe corner king room and the room was very spacious for NYC.  The location was great and we could walk to everywhere we wanted to go.  The restaurant was only open for dinner at this time so they had complimentary coffee and danish in the lobby every morning which was a nice touch.  

I am in the luxury travel business and will definitely be sending clients to the James Hotel Nomad in the future. 

One other thing...hats off to the door man when we were leaving.  The big NYC pride parade was just starting so he walked out into the street and hailed us a cab to the airport going the right direction to avoid the crowds....I thought that was above and beyond and we will be back.

title: Ambiant hotel
text: Came for a few days on buisness. As soon as I stepped in it felt like i was entering a spa. Very relaxing feel. After being out in meetings all day, I didnt want to leave the hotel so the fact that they have a great restaurant and bar to unwind at was a huge convenience.

title: Great stay and service at The James
text:
Our stay at The James exceeded our expectations. We had a king deluxe room (1118), very spacious for nyc with a good sized bathroom — shower and separate tub. The bed was incredibly comfortable, nice bedding and larger-than-usual towels. The room was well appointed with a stylish mini bar and functional armoire with lighting. 

We were slightly worried it would be loud, given some other reviews, but we didn’t have any noise at all. We loved having Scarpetta right downstairs — and the location couldn’t be beat for our itinerary, and less than a 10 minute ride to Moynihan Train Station. 

Lastly, we got great service. Jayda at the front desk was incredibly helpful in making our plans, and everyone we encountered was warm and welcoming. 

We travel to the city at least once a month, and we will definitely be staying again!

title: New home away from home
text: Traveled from ashburn VA to NYC to see family. Me and my wife are originally from upper Manhattan and the bx. We’ve stayed at other “luxury” hotels around the city but never got the family feel. This hotel was amazing from the moment I pulled up in front of the hotel and had jayda I believe was his name greet me and take my bags up to the very end when Danny checked us out. Besides the hotel being beautiful and the attentiveness to our needs what really made the experience special was the customer service from the employees and the location. This is definitely going to be the only hotel I stay at when I visit NY. Highly recommend it to anyone that values customer service.

title: The Best Hotel in Flatiron
text: At check in, Hector was extremely helpful and accommodating. The staff is very hospitable, and they provide the best breakfast croissants in the lobby every morning, catered from Bourke Street Bakery!

title: Amazing hotel in perfect location
text: We stayed at the James for a girls weekend and had a blast! The penthouse is one of the nicests I’ve seen and the decor and space was so beautiful. The hotel is very clean and very well managed. The staff was super friendly too and they helped us making reservations and plan our time there. Plus Scarpetta and the Savoy are right downstairs so it just adds to the whole vibe of the hotel.  Highly recommend for a stay in the city!

title: Incredible service!
text: My travel plans changed last minute (mind you my first trip in 15 months due to COVID) and I received the best service checking in and accommodating me by Jayda at reception. My stay is off to a great start.

title: Great stay!
text: The hotel  staff could not have been nicer! The room was perfect.  Clean and very comfortable. Definitely a great place to stay! The location is perfect! A perfect Boutique hotel to stay in NYC for a weekend or a week!

title: Amazing stay at the James hotel
text: From the start Jayda helped us out with an early check-in! Greeting us with coffee, she was extremely nice and helpful. The service was amazing! The rooms were clean and are excited about the complementary coffee and pastries each morning.

title: An Awesome stay at The James New York-Nomad
text:
Recently returned from a week long biz trip and stay at The James New York -NoMad. All and all had a great experience. And as someone who used to live in NYC, it felt like being back home. For the most part friendly staff and courteous friendly doormen and good value for your $. Stayed in a corner room, clean, minimalistic, well appointed, super comfortable bed and definitely spacious by hotel standards with plenty of room to stretch out and work. There were a few minor issues with housekeeping/room upkeep but they were quickly rectified as well as an adjustment to my final bill upon check-out which was a nice surprise. Located in a great location with nearby Madison Square Park along with bars, coffee shops and restaurants aplenty as well as subways, PENN and GC within walking distance. And "scarpetta," the well known Italian restaurant sits adjacent to the hotel, with both inside and outside dinning. Food is very good though also a tad expensive. There is also a bar downstairs with either live music or a dj depending the night. A great part of town to stay and and the James made it all the more nicer. Will definitely be on the top of my list of hotels to stay when I return as well as to recommend.

Note to Mgmt: Realize not always easy, but consistency amongst ALL staff is the key to great customer experience.

title: Great for Dog Parents
text:
I stayed at the James during COVID and once NYC opened up. In both times my stay was very nice and the rooms felt safe and clean. Hector and Payten were super helpful and made me feel like I had a personal concierge and upgraded me for a better experience. 
Great hotel if you are traveling with a dog. They even give you a dog bed for your fur friend.

title: Friendly, helpful staff make the difference
text: The James is comfortable and stylish, but the people make the difference.  After our visit, we realized our daughter had left behind a toy that meant a lot to her.  Robinson Sanchez made every effort to locate and ship the toy to our house, and he was a great help through the whole process.  Thank you!

title: Clean, accommodating, pleasant
text: I stayed in a Deluxe room for 2 nights and only have great things to say. From the moment I checked in, the team at The James went out of their way to ensure my stay was pleasant. The room and bathroom are very spacious, clean and well-appointed for NYC standards. Great value for your money and would 100% recommend others check it out!

title: Amazing Staff
text: Great place to stay. The staff is incredibly helpful, especially Hassan. Looking forward to stay for another fun weekend:) the bar Seville and scarpetta are one the favorites in NYC and a must go . Rooms are clean and updated and Chic!

title: Elegant rooms for a good rate
text: I was previously staying at a tiny hotel in lower east side and changed for space and I love it! I’ll be staying here again. I forgot his name, but this guy here in the corner was very helpful and hospitable during my stay.

title: Great stay!
text: This hotel is a gem in lower Manhattan! It’s well located with quiet, well-appointed rooms and a small, solid gym. The attached restaurant is excellent! The hotel manager Pradley upgraded us to one of the penthouse suites which was large and luxurious. It had a gorgeous soaking tub and so many windows overlooking the Manhattan skyline. Thank you for making our stay memorable, Pradley! We can’t wait to return.

title: First Visit Back to NYC
text:
The past year has been tough on our travel plans. However, we could not wait to get back to NYC and visit some of our favorite places and introduce our 5 kids to NYC. Safety has now become a high priority for traveling, especially when traveling with kids to NYC. We were pleasantly surprised that The James Nomad was available for our stay with adjoining rooms to fit our group. 

I have to say that driving to NYC was a little nerve racking; but upon arrival, the James's staff made everything easy (even the process of unpacking and parking our car). Immediately, I was met by "Manny" who took charged of my family, luggage, and directions on the street so I could safely park the car. Everything was under control, and our arrival set the tone for our amazing stay. 

The rooms were clean, swanky-cool, and comfortable. One of my kids commented "This is the greatest bed ever..." and she is a tough critic (apparently we are buying that king bed). Everyone had space, and the amenities in the room are NY-unique. This centralized location made every trip easily within walking distance or near a safe mode of travel. All staff members are completely hospitable, constantly cleaning, and fun to chat up. Safety and cleanliness are tip-top here. 

My daughters want me to make sure that I mention "the coffee and pastries from the morning." Packed in a sack to go, each one was an artisan delight... We tried everything as we raced out the door to meet: NYU, Madison Park, Shopping, and yes lots and lots of pizza... Best first trip back with everything we could ask for in a NYC hotel. The only tears were the ones in the Lincoln tunnel as we officially left NYC behind. 

Thanks James Nomad... You are a keeper.

title: Harassing housekeeping staff. Not relaxing at all
text: It would have been a 5 star stay, as the accommodations and room were very nice and comfortable, and the very nice front desk staff upgraded me upon check in. However the housekeeping staff is TERRIBLE!!! Even with the do not disturb sign on my door , and continually telling them to go away, they were continually banging on my door every five minutes , waking me up at 9am and continuing throughout the day. Truly aweful housekeeping staff.

title: Great service at the front desk!
text: We booked two rooms at the hotels this past weekend and Jayda at the front desk provided a really pleasant check-in process. She was also quick to provide recommendations for places to check out in the neighborhood! We had a wonderful stay!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Love, love, love this location , the beds are very comfortable and the location is close to the Empire State Building, union square and Times Square. Jayda was phenomenal, she had the best suggestions for good eats in the area. And amazing ideas on what to do with the kids. This place is a hidden Gem, we will be back for sure!

title: Good location and clean
text: Nice stay and the hotel is centrally located to lots of shopping and restaurants. Jada at the front desk was helpful at checkin. Quiet rooms and very clean. Beds were also very comfortable. Will be back!

title: The best place to stay in the city
text: Great rooms, great service. Super friendly from the moment you walk in the lobby through check-in (Jada is awesome!) and then very quiet, comfortable, modern rooms in a great location. I used to live in the city, and this is where I stay when come back!

title: FANTASTIC - LOVE LOVE LOVE
text: From location to staff, lobby to hotel room - everything was amazing! Stay here often for work and they remember me by first name which is incredible. Makes it feel like home. Keep everything clean and really make sure i am taking care of.

title: First trip in a long time
text: We just arrived at the James Hotel and we’re greeted by Hector and Pradley who were kind and helpful. We feel the safety of the clean room and are excited to explore the city. We are happy to return to this awesome hotel in a great location.

title: Great stay!
text: Beautiful hotel, amazing service. Came for a night with my girlfriend before flying out of the city. Jada was amazing! Very helpful and pleasant.  I will definitely be returning to this hotel in the future.

title: Great place to stay!
text: Great stay at James Hotel!! Perfect location, very accommodating to young children and amazing service at both their restaurant and bar. The drinks were delicious!!! Shout out to Pradley for sending me my shirts I forgot too!! Will be back

title: Nancy
text: Nancy and the entire team, specifically housekeeping made coming back NY an amazing experience. The pastries and the attention to customer service is what stood out. In a market where one can find a hotel in every corner I’d seek to come back to the James.

title: Incredibly grateful for kind accommodating staff
text:
I arrived very early in the morning and as I waited in the lobby for check in with the delicious complimentary coffee and pastry, Pradley and Hassan noticed how tired I looked and went out of their way to upgrade my room to one that was already ready so I could check in early and rest. 
The bed is very comfortable, the room was sanitized and smells clean, and is beautifully furnished with modern decor, a beautiful marble sink, and gorgeous golden bar. I am incredibly grateful to Pradley and Hassan for their kindness and hospitality.

title: Great Hotel and Customer Service
text: The hotel is avant-guard - nice, spacious rooms and very modern vibe. Right in the heart of NYC. The customer service was also great, despite the fact that Scarpetta was closed for breakfast and lunch, both the front-desk and the manager (Pradley Concepcion resolved an outstanding issue even post-checkout, which was great!) took great care of us. I recommend it.

title: Beautiful Property & Incredible Staff
text: Nancy V at the front desk and Hasan with concierge went above and beyond  to accommodate me during my wonderful stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC. Great rooms, prime location with plenty of things to do nearby and a truly helpful and incredible staff.

title: Terrific service. Excellent quality. Very safe.
text:
I was a frequent business traveler pre-Covid and this is my first trip in over a year. Needless to say, I was a little nervous about what to expect. But I couldn’t be more impressed with The James - NoMad. From the moment I stepped through the door, I was impressed by the friendly and courteous staff, attention to cleanliness and their diligence in observing safety protocols. The room is great with every amenity I could want.

I will definitely stay here again. Highly recommended!

title: Work Trip Review
text: So nice, excellent service was able to check in early! They even upgraded me free of charge. I came on a work trip and really loved this place. I will definitely be coming back at some point. Highly recommend!

title: Super location, friendly staff!
text: Really great location - right in the middle of midtown-East, convenient to just about anywhere in the city.   And a really friendly staff -- in particular, Pradley at the Front desk is the man.  Affordable yet quality.

title: Awesome hotel —- Speak to Pradley for anything!
text: I live in NYC and needed a large room to have a small meeting with friends ... so we took the penthouse. The room was spacious/clean and in prime location. Hotel has one of the best lounges in nyc and restaurants in the lobby. If you have any issues I recommend asking for Pradley who can help fix any issues or make stay better. I look forward to staying again.

title: AWESOME!
text: Great Hotel and fantastic customer service by Manager Pradley! Do ask for a corner room. Thank you Jayda and Hassan for helping us get settled. Good location too! Yoga mat and meditation pillow in the closet. 👍

title: Fantastic Hotel- A Must Try!
text:
I have had the luxury of staying at The James Hotel Nomad twice over the last two months and find the ambiance, staff, and rooms all excellent. The hotel appears to be recently renovated and you won’t find anything out of order, torn or scuffed. 

The front desk staff all strive to make you feel welcome and your stay the best. A special shout-out to Pradley for going above and beyond the call of duty to resolve a problem I had.

I found the best rates offered on the hotel’s website and it’s always best to book directly so the hotel has more flexibility in room assignments.  I suggest paying extra for the larger and more comfortable superior king room. 

Morning coffee with croissants and muffins is offered free in the stylishly designed lobby. There are plenty of window seating and chairs and sofas to enjoy your start to the day.

The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Manhattan and is great for walking to 5th Avenue shopping, Madison Avenue furniture shopping, Times Square theater district and  a quick subway or cab ride to Meatpacking and SoHo.

Scarpetta’s fine Italian restaurant is located on the ground floor of the hotel. The food and ambiance are so great that I found myself eating there 3 out of 5 nights! You must try their signature spaghetti. Outside, curbside dinning is also offered and they have done a great job to make this a great option. 

I look forward to my next visit to The James Nomad and the comforts this hotel has to offer.

title: Long time traveler/ New Favorite NYC Hotel
text: So solid, not cookie cutter. This is my second stay in the last 2 months and The James will be my go-to NYC hotel. Great location. Charming lobby. Old school details throughout the building. Special shout out to my new friend at the front desk, Pradley, who helped me out. I particularly appreciate hotels with windows that open. Thanks James-NoMad.

title: Fantastic service, Great location, lovely rooms
text: My wife stayed in NYC for several days for some medical procedures.  We had to extend our stay for several nights because of medical appointments and the staff could not have been better and more accommodating.  we've been upgraded to a beautiful deluxe room and love the amenities.  It's a beautiful hotel and the location is great.  The beds are amazing.

title: Nice hotel but overall stay could have been nicer
text: None of the rooms have coffee.  All of the rooms/floors smell very strongly of marijuana now that it's legal recreationally in NY.  The hotel has a no-smoking policy but doesn't seem to enforce it.  Reminds me of hotels years ago always smelling like cigarette smoke.

title: Mixed (positive and negative) points
text: Location is great, lobby is very nice and comfortable, wonderful morning coffee and pastries, pleasant staff. A big problem was the access from the outside - many stairs and heavy doors which was especially hard when carrying luggage. A doorman to help with suitcases and open the door would have been nice. Unless you upgrade your room, they are very small, but nice and very clean.

title: Great staff
text: I am enjoying my stay at the James. The hotel is pet and service animal friendly. The location is perfect with everything in lower Manhattan walking distance. The fabulous Scarpetta restaurant is located in the hotel and other great spots are nearby. Starbucks is a block away as well as cvs, Walgreens, and local grocery spots. Pradley at the front desk is phenomenal and made my stay wonderful.

title: Great experience
text: The James at Nomad is one of the best hotels in Manhattan.. not easy to find room with such space. Also very clean in the room and shared areas. And I have coming to NYC for 15 years .. and not always easy to find great experiences

title: Great check in process!
text: Fantastic location, near Madison Square Park and convenient to many NYC landmarks.  The check in process was smooth and simple. I managed to check in early since I got to NYC earlier than expected.  The common areas and room are sanitized well.

title: Business Trip
text: This is one of the best hotels in New York. And I really enjoyed it and would highly recommend to others to stay. It’s very cozy and the view is magnificent. The staff treated me like I was family and that was great

title: Great and friendly service
text: I loved the service here! Everyone was a great help as well. The rooms are pretty clean and fancy. I am impressed with how quick it was to get into the hotel and the view from my hotel was nice. I wouldn’t mind coming back to this hotel again for my next stay.

title: Best Hotel Ever!
text: Easily one of the best hotels I’ve ever been at! The Rooms are comfortable with a great view. The service is amazing. Check in was a simple and quick process, took no longer than 5 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

title: Customer Service home ryn
text: We were welcomed to our room almost 3 hours before check in. What a wonderful experience. The front desk was very accommodating. Our room is lovely and we were upgraded just because they could. The lobby is lovely, and its so quiet during the day you can work there if you like. Overall, and amazing choice for both business and pleasure trips. We're thrilled to have chosen the James.

title: Highly recommend!
text: Beautiful hotel, great location! Super comfortable and luxe, very helpful staff, thank you Pradley! Free coffee and croissants in the morning for early birds! Body wash and lotion smell amazing! Very secure and great gym amenities! Very convenient location!

title: Perfect Stay
text: My boyfriend & I live in New Jersey and came for a weekend getaway and we couldn't have picked a more perfect hotel. The location is right in the middle of everything so we could easily walk anywhere without it taking forever. The staff was always ready to help whenever we needed and always greeted us with a smile whenever we were in the lobby. The room was spacious and so clean... SUPER comfy beds. Every time we come back to the city we know where we will be staying!

title: Awesome Location, Great Staff
text:
I have stayed in many hotels in NYC - My recent stay at the James Nomad was one of the most pleasant I have had! 

To start - they have incredible freshly baked pastries each morning and complimentary coffee. 

Their Gym is top tier, with multiple Peleton machines and great selection. The customer service was also an amazing experience. Wanted to give a huge shoutout to Pradley at the front desk, as he was extremely helpful and accomodating.

title: Great Stay
text: Clean, minimalist, stylish rooms in a super cool building with a great location for business and leisure. Impressed by the covid protocols in both the hotel and Serafina restaurant which is a great amenity. Highly recommend.

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: Every visit back and forth to NYC we stay at The James -Nomad. Great rooms and they have awesome stand up showers in the bathroom!!! When you visit ask for Hector; he is always so helpful. The restaurant attached has great food and drinks !

title: Fabulous Experience. Excellent Service. Perfect Location.
text: We always enjoy our time at The James! We feel at home from the moment we arrive.  Truly, our home away from home while we're in the city.  The team at the front desk is best in class.  Excellent service, Dedicated staff. Safe and clean rooms and room service. You will be so pleased and happy with your decision to book The James! Congratulations to the team for going above and beyond.  Bravo!

title: Beautiful hotel
text: Beautiful property and such a comfortable stay! Loved everything about this hotel. The bed was perfect. I loved the ambiance of the restaurant and lobby. Such a perfect location in the city. Was here visiting family and can’t wait to return.

title: Great service
text: We just got back from a week in NYC - partly for business, partly for leisure. First of all, the covid precautions were all up to standard and we felt perfectly safe. Other than that, the service was perfect. Especially Hector was so kind and thoughtful - he upgraded us to a suite to give us more space as a family, and made sure we had a tub in the room for our 1.5yr old daughter. We'll definitely come back here next time.

title: Amazing Stay
text:
Beautiful place very happy with the services I received. Like to come to the city every so often and stay in this luxury boutique. 

Cleanliness was top notch. The staff are very friendly and helpful to any inquiries.

title: Amazing Stay
text:
Every so often I like to spend a night or two in NYC. After looking around for a while I chose to stay at the James Nomad based on reviews about the hotel, the staff and the restaurant. I was not disappointed at all! if anything the reviews fell short to the reality. from the moment I checked in with Nancy's assistance my experience was phenomenal, The rooms are beautiful, super clean and comfortable. the staff provides and magnificent job to make your stay just wonderful. From the front desk to the house keeper to the room services everyone is invested in making your stay memorable. 

Thank you all for such an amazing time and see you soon.

title: Poor service
text: We had a similar experience to other guests who said they couldn’t get any hot water for tea. There was no water provided in the room and no cups to even get water out of the sink to take medications. No room service at all. I requested water and it took over an hour for them to get it to my room. The front desk person was completely unhelpful about this obvious oversight. There was a small fridge in the room with some mixers for the alcohol on top, but no plain water and oddly not even paper cups! Covid or not, humans need fluids. And glassware. And some of us drink tea. Also the front desk people need to speak up. Between the masks and the plexiglass it is impossible to understand them.

title: Incredibly Helpful Staff
text: We stayed at the James Nomad for 4 nights. The location is great and walkable to tons of restaurants. One night a very sentimental stuffed animal was accidentally taken from our room with the linens during a housekeeping check. The staff was very involved in helping us find our stuffed animal and stayed in constant contact with their cleaning plant days after we had checked out. Eventually we were able to be reunited thanks to the Nomad staff. Appreciate the help, especially from Pradley and Nancy at the front desk!!!!!!!!

title: Happy to be back !
text: Visited NYC in March and stayed at the James Nomad. I had stayed at The James Pre Covid and was so happy to be back. The staff is wonderful and the hotel is as clean as can be. They took care of the smallest details that really make a difference when traveling. Stayed here for a week and felt comfortable, safe and relaxed. A top favorite in my book!

title: Amazing service !
text: I’ve been spending a lot of time over the last year in New York staying at the James hotel. Hector at the front desk and all of the staff are amazing. Every experience has felt safe given the current restrictions, clean, and enjoyable ! I’ve loved making the James my second home and highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city!

title: Almost perfect
text: Was able to early check in, hotel was clean and well maintained.  Big room and bathroom.   Great location.   Had an encounter with staff that showed a lack of creative thinking   Tried to just get a cup of hot water for tea I brought myself.  They couldn’t help since food service was removed during the pandemic.  I reached out to the restaurant in the building and resolves it myself.  Thought they could have been more helpful.  Maybe they were newer to the hospitality industry.   Otherwise great place to stay

title: Fabulous Front Desk.  Pradley is the best
text: Pradley at front desk was amazing.  The hotel is lovely and clean. Rooms are good. I have an amazing shower.   Love this part of the city...lots of restaurants near.  Will definitely recommend to all my friends and family when they come to Manhattan

title: My Stay at The James- Nomad
text: I've stayed here many times, but this is the first time post Covid.  I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  The staff is always incredible and the rooms are warm and stylish.  Today I checked in with my kids and Pradley was kind enough to help us out.  He was amazing, as he physically walked to the suite we reserved and confirmed there were two queen beds. Great guy.  Great service.  Great hotel.  I highly recommend.

title: Birthday Celebration
text: Rooms are large and comfortable though a little bit dated and could use a bit of a facelift. However the staff is incredible and very accommodating. They went out of their way to make our stay a memorable one. Would definitely book here again. Perfect location in the city.

title: Terrible service
text: Modestly clean hotel but otherwise terrible service.  On check-in, staff was very friendly, but beyond then, it was downhill.  Breakfast was mediocre at best.  Morning staff with nasty attitude, the answer to everything was negative

title: Best Hotel ever!!!
text:
We stayed here and was very happy with the quality of care that was displayed. The general manager Pradley took care of ever need we had. The hospitality the employees displayed was above my expectations. Always polite, held the door and always greeted you.
Rooms was clean and the restaurant inside the hotel food was excellent. Will definitely go back, right in the middle of attractions so everything was easy to get to.

title: Really great experience!
text: We are currently staying at The James hotel in Nomad. Our room is beautiful, clean well-lit (the natural light is amazing!). However so far we are most impressed with the exceptional service we have received since we walked in. The staff has been extremely quick to help with any requests and overall they have just been so kind, attentive, and thoughtful. They made the birthday

title: A luxury hotel nestled in NoMad
text: From arrival to departure, my time at the The James NoMad was a delightful stay! They made sure my safety and health were top priority from the moment I checked in. The hotel has such a beautiful décor- its truly a luxury hotel with exceptional service.  It was perfect for my birthday weekend and I can't wait to go back soon!!

title: Jimmy Suite stay
text:
This was our fourth stay at The James Nomad. We stayed in the Jimmy suite this time around. Previously, we've stayed in the James suite. Our stay in August was not so great but we decided to give them another chance since our previous stays were very good and we love the location and the size of the suites. The service this time was fantastic. The front desk staff were very attentive and accommodating. They went over and beyond when they mailed my husband's headphones back to us after he had left them in the room. 

Loved that they added pastries and coffee for breakfast, after all, something should be included when paying the resort fee. The croissants they serve in the morning are flaky and quite delicious! Looking forward to when Covid goes away and they bring back happy hour with wine and cheese.

Would definitely return!

title: Don’t expect any service!
text: James Nomad does not care about service...It seems like a higher end hotel but you can’t even get through the phone to reach anyone. Room was nice but some attention to detail was missing. Some aspects of the room were poorly advertised, like valet parking when there was none available.

title: A disappointing visit
text: Run-down hotel room and room furniture; dark brown water in the sinks and shower;  television that didn't work.  We had made special arrangements when we made the reservations.   The person we spoke to at that time went out of her way to assure us they would be honored.   At check-in we were told there was no record of such arrangements.

title: Ok but not quiet!
text: Corner King room is cute for like a brief stay but not luxe. I would have preferred a larger bathroom but take your expectations and lower them a little. In the photo of the room I viewed online had double sinks and seemed more spacious. I was placed in a conjoined room with arguing neighbors (Door slamming and expletives included). In addition to the lack of luxe the tv stopped working for several hours on Saturday evening requiring an “engineer” to come to our room. We appreciated the attention to service where the amenities failed us. I didn’t feel comfortable moving rooms during covid but selecting my room online was very much what I expected vs what I got. Hope your trip is much better. Nice hotel lobby and fairly upgraded features. I know outside of covid this hotel is probably rarely priced fairly.

title: Don't miss this one (even if you think twice about midtown)
text: So. You might feel weird about 29th St. What do you do if you're a tourist and so far south of the park and so far north of Washington Sq and everrything good that's south of it. What you do is stay at The James. Absolutely incredible, thoughtful and kind service. A stunning lobby with gorgeous soft furnishings and art. Wine and cheese hour! Well appointed rooms with thoughtful brass finishes. And you're bloody close to Penn Station/MSG. Dont forget to stop for a glass at Scarpetta.

title: Great hotel at affordable rates
text: The hotel is located at a convenient location and equipped with good amenities. A decent suite at about 270 dollars per night was such a great deal you'd never want to miss. It was quiet in the spacious bedroom and living space, which allowed me to work or rest with comfort. We'd also like to highlight the staff members who were so helpful and responsive at any time of a day

title: Great stay
text: Clean room, helpful staff, easy check in, decent view. Shower products smelt great.... Also enjoyed the morning pastries and free coffee ready in the morning. Would recommend for a relaxing experience.

title: NYC Hospitality is alive and well at The James NoMad!
text:
My husband and I recently stayed at The James NoMad prior to flying to Hawaii the following day.  We had an exceptional stay and experience at this cozy, safe and secure boutique hotel in the Nomad area of NYC.  The location was ideal as the hotel is close to all major public transportation hubs including many subway lines, making all parts of the city easily accessible, not to mention the ease at which the doorman happily hailed a taxi to the airport for us the next morning.  Contrary to what we’ve heard about the current state of NYC, the Nomad area was bustling with locals enjoying outside dining and everything felt very safe, even during our evening walk home from dinner.  

We arrived in the early afternoon to open arms and many smiling faces wholeheartedly welcoming us to the hotel.  We have never experienced such a warm and genuine appreciation for choosing a hotel as we did at The James NoMad and it really set the tone for an amazing stay!  

Upon check-in we were advised of the health and safety protocols which throughout our stay made us feel very safe and secure at all times.  During check-in there was no transfer of a credit card which was nice.  There were hand sanitizer stations at all elevator banks and scattered throughout the hotels public space which was a great measure.  The protocol that gave us the most confidence was that each guest room door is completely sealed after being inspected and sanitized by housekeeping staff.  We literally had to peel the seal off to access our room and it felt good knowing that no person had entered the room after it was sanitized.  All in all, we had a great stay and want to encourage fellow travelers to stay at The James NoMad and visit the ever-energetic NYC!

title: Comfortable Stay
text: My husband and I had a great two night stay! The rooms were very clean and had complimentary wipes and sanitizers. The hotel staff was always available, helpful and kind. We enjoyed the complimentary coffee and baked goods from a neighborhood bakery in the mornings. Overall, enjoyable stay and would highly recommend for great hospitality and comfort.

title: WONDERFUL
text: I have had several stays at The James NoMad.   the staff is amazing , helpful  and its a beautiful hotel!!! I highly recommend it!!!  the booking process easy, everyone so kind , attentive, and helpful.   some places look better in photos, this hotel is even better!! the rooms are such a nice lofty size .. and the beds are so comfortable!

title: Not bad overall
text:
My husband was staying here for work for a week so I decided to join him for the last few days of his stay. 

Pros:
1. Free coffee in the morning - it's not very good but at least it's an option 
2. The lobby is nice and has a lot of seating. No one was sitting there (probably because of COVID) but I can see it being a nice spot to have your breakfast in the morning during non-COVID times
3. The loveseat is pretty comfy. Perfect if you need to work at the table
4. There's a mini fridge but it is filled with minibar items. However, there is a little but of extra room in there so it can fit some leftovers, if you really need to
5. They provide a couple of face masks at check in

Cons:
1. The bathroom is pretty small. There is just enough room for the door to open without hitting the toilet, so if you are closing the door, you have to stand off to the side in order to do so. Overall, the bathroom could use an upgrade
2. The TV is to the side of the bed, which was a bit weird - but at least it swivels
3. There aren't a lot of surfaces to put things but you can use the heater and all of the window ledges

title: Meh
text: Overall, was a nice stay but was disappointed by the lack of marketed "things" that come with or in the room. Was able to check in early, which was nice but online suggested an easy 11am arrival and 2pm check out. Bathroom was an okay clean.. felt safe but wish it was a nicer 4 star stay. I guess my expectations might have been too high for the price, EXTRA charges ("complimentary wifi" that I have to pay for and $10 wet bar fee that I know I would have been charged for anyway, doesn't make much sense to me) This seemed like a great deal, but the amount charged on the backend was upsetting. Hoping I

title: Excellent stay, highly recommend!
text: I ended up staying at the James Nomad for 10 nights and it was an excellent stay overall. The room was lux and calming, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the location can't be beat. They also had robust Covid precautions: a mask was required in the main areas and they had top notch room cleaning. The bakery behind the hotel and the restaurant in front were were also delicious. Solid & fair price too, quite affordable for a 4*+ hotel. Highly recommend!

title: Perfect stay
text: We travelled to NYC for a (not optional) family event during the pandemic, causing more than usual stress about travelling.  Every aspect of our stay went smoothly and I felt completely safe and at no extra risk virus exposure.
