The staff was efficient and pleasant, the room was spotless and comfortable, and the location is central.  I would stay here again if I travel to NYC.

title: Deeply disappointing stay during COVID-19
text:
I have to say: I was expecting a lot out of this experience given we splurged on a suite at what I thought was a fancy hotel for a friend's re-scheduled, sized down bachelorette party. We booked a suite but were unable to choose the beds at our time of booking, so I specifically called the hotel two days before arrival to confirm we could get the two queen bed suite (as there were 4 of us.) I spoke to Hector who assured me this would be no problem (and I figured that since it was COVID, this would be true given low occupancy.) 

When we arrived, of course, the story was different. The person at the front desk told me this was impossible as the rooms were booked (how could Hector not have known this two days before?!) So now we were unprepared. He promised me he would waive the resort fees to make up for it (this did not, but we made peace given it was out of his hands.) We pre-paid the hotel so assumed there would be no other charges (spoiler alert: my credit card has not one but two charges on it from The James and I never saw an invoice or approved said charges. Had to contact customer service to even find out what they are.)

We then got to our room and noticed that the bedroom was cool but the living room was sweltering hot. We had to go out to pick up supplies, so informed the hotel on our way out and they said they'd send up someone to look at it while we were out (COVID.) We returned back almost 2 hours later and assumed someone had looked at the AC (though there was no note or confirmation of this.) The living room was still sweltering. We finally called back down again and they let us know they were UNABLE TO REPAIR THE AC! Who does that?! Why did we have to call down to find out?! And they were willing to just leave us in the room hoping we'd not notice? 

This was totally unacceptable of a hotel of this class. They ended up offering us another single room to sleep in for the night (this was at around 10 PM, and meant we wouldn't be together), which was fine, but I don't get how they just hoped we wouldn't notice. 

Finally we go down to check out in the morning, the lady tells me we're all set and we leave. I'm thinking that's the end of it, but again, now there's two charges on my credit card from this hotel that I never approved or even saw. 

Honestly - the room was fine (nothing special), the bathroom was very nice, it was very quiet given due to COVID there looked like there was perhaps no one else on the floor but overall the service was terrible. They did nothing to show us they wanted or appreciated our business. Really disappointed.

title: Quick stop in NYC
text: The James hotel is a wonderful property.  Great staff, perfect location and lots of character.  We stayed overnight while we were moving my son into his dorm room at AADA.  Highly recommend this hotel.  You won't be disappointed.

title: Clean with friendly service
text:
From the moment I arrived, Pratley and Hector were friendly, attentive and were helpful with all questions I had. The room was immaculate and had all amenities you might need while away from home.  
Glad I chose this hotel!  Thanks again Pratley and Hector!

title: Clean and Great Stay
text: Rooms were really nice and clean especially during this covid period. When I first arrived there were even seals on the doors to tell me that everything had been clean and sanitised. Besides this they took extra precaution when I was both checking in and checking out through making as little direct contact as possible. The room itself was nice and so was the bathroom that included really nice soap. Overall the stay was really nice and someday I hope to stay at The James Nomad hotel again.

title: Excellent stay
text: Stayed for two nights at the James early March 2020 and really enjoyed the stay. Service minded reception, great location and rooms of a size difficult to match in mid-town Manhattan. Also enjoyed the complimentary wine on a sunday afternoon - was a good way to cool down after a hectic day. Only one thing to mention on with a sour flavour - tried to enter the bar at the basement saturday night and was told it was reservations only. Other people seemed to enter withou reservation. Staying at the hotel one would expect to be invited to the party?

title: Our 1st NYC trip, but not our last!
text:
This was our families first trip to NYC and The James Nomad was the perfect fit for us. 
Upon arriving the architecture was beautiful. We were then greeted by the hotels doorman (Which happened to be Cuban like us) very gracious everyday and orientated us when needed. Checking in was effortless, as we arrived early and dropped our bags and went to explore. We were greeted by Arianna (spelling) inviting us back for wine and cheese. Perfect way to settle in. The lobby was so inviting with sofas, tables, intimate areas, water , fruits , coffee, everyday. Throughout this time was the fear of Covid 19 so we were extra cautious as well as the hotel. We stayed 4 nights and the complete staff was more than gracious. Everyone a bit concerned over the virus and what was happening but always suggesting places for us as a family and always engaging in conversation having a great time. The evening front desk person Phil was very helpful in getting us around and safe with his insight. The location of The James was perfect for us 1st timers with everything so close and walking distance. Ubers were there in minutes if needed or taxis. Our room was clean,  plenty of light from the windows, spacious, and some views. 
The complete staff treated us as family and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The James Nomad! Our 1st trip with The James Nomad but not our Last!

title: Nice rooms, horrendous service
text: Rooms are nice, but the service is among the worst. This is NOT 4-star service. The doormen were generally MIA and of the 5 people I dealt with at the front desk, two were helpful and 3 were downright rude. Housekeepers didn't clean my room one night. Next night they did, but didn't replace some towels and toiletries.

title: Great find
text:
Just back from a 4 day break and really enjoyed staying at The James, great location, friendly staff,  including Jose and Aolis, who went above and beyond helping us. I stayed with my daughter and a close friend and we had the Jimmy Suite.. absolutely loved it, the only thing I’d say is they need some hooks on the wall for coats etc as not a lot of wardrobe space.. however they did bring us a rail and extra coat hangers when we asked.
Would definitely recommend and go again.

title: Excellent Customer Service
text:
I'm writing this review specifically to acknowledge the exceptional customer service offered by a wonderful young woman named Arianna.  
I was catching up on some work in the lobby before departing and Arianna stopped to check on me and ask how my stay was.  I had had a good 3 day stay at the James NoMad, however my only complaint was that the shower was lacking a shower curtain liner; it only had the fabric curtain.  I let her know that I had let the front desk know it was missing a couple of times but it was never fixed.  I had already checked out, and forgot to mention it out check-out, but Arianna acknowledged my issue by refunding the resort fees I had already paid, which I did not expect.  I was very pleased by her going the extra mile to end my stay with a smile.  She was very professional, authentic, and a pleasure to speak with.  In fact, all of the staff was quite friendly and relaxed which can be hard to find in NYC.  I appreciated Arianna especially!

title: Great stay
text: Had a great time there. Room was nice and spacious. Very friendly staff, helped out with questions and always with a smile, thanks Nia. Location is also wonderful, lots within  walking distance. Definitely recommend it.

title: Fantastic Hotel and Even Better Service!
text: I travel for work a few times a month, so I could compare this property to thousands of others....frictionless check in, great king size room, quiet hallways, great amenities, Scapetta (yummm!), etc...the list goes on. But what has made this stay unforgettable is the staff. My vacation unfortunately flipped to a work trip on my first night here. Management staff Ariana and Doomy could hear the stress in my voice and quickly offered solution to resolve the collision of personal and work requests. They effortlessly extended my room reservation, took room service orders when the direct line was busy, and provided overall peace of mind. Doomy even helped me complete a birthday project in time for me to run out of the hotel to make it to the surprise party in time. Teams that provide customer service above and beyond expectation deserve to be celebrated. Thank you so much to Doomy, Ariana, Rossanna and Ashraf for stepping in to help me juggle everything thrown my way this weekend!

title: Bra hotel som kunde varit fantastiskt.
text:
Extra kostnader
Det här hotellet tar ut $46/dag inkl. skatt för Hotel Facility Fee utöver hotelskatten och Service kostnaden som ingår när du bokar hotellet. Så räkna med de extra kostnaderna.

Deluxe 2 Queen Bedroom
Det var stort och rent, men byggnaden är gammal och det fanns en gammal doft i rummet. Men man vänjer sig efter någon dag eller två. De säljer universell strömadapter för europeiska strömkontakter på rummet för $29, men som tur var fick jag låna en.

Frukost
Vi stannade 4 nätter och köpte rummet med frukost. Först fick vi Continentel paketet vilket innehöll kaffe/te och en skål med frukt eller kaffebrödkorg. Inte värt $30 som de tar om man köper det extra. Men vi klagade och de uppgradera oss till American Breakfast som var bättre men inte lika bra som de fantastiska frukost ställen du hittar i övriga New York.

Gymmet/Fittness Center
Det var ett litet rum med standard utrustning. Det fanns inget utrymme för fristyle träning, men det fanns ett multi gym, lätta fria vikter, löpband, cross trainers, cyklar och en roddmaskin. Uppskattar att det fanns både handdukar och vattenstation.

title: Business in the NOMAD land!
text:
I was extremely impressed with the hotel’s service excellence and it’s professional atmosphere. This was an absolute joy to co
E back to each night after work on my trip to know that I had that oasis! A huge shout out to Ms. Ana Mireya Meza Zambrano who welcomed my visit with the warmth and hospitable acumen that put more than a smile on my face! I truly recommend The James Nomad!

title: Associate
text: I stayed at the James Hotel for a business trip. Ariana, a concierge here, was super attentive, knowledgable, and provided top notch customer service. She made sure I was taken care of and went above and beyond. Kudos!

title: Best hotel in nyc
text: This is the best hotel in nyc perfect location 5 min walk to flat iron or the 28th subway station. The room is perfect and everything is there including a rainshower and good bed.There are bottles of water everyday available free of charge. The in house restaurant is also verry delicious. The best part of our stay where the lovely professional and outstanding service of Naby Rosanne and Jose because of them i would definitely come back to this amazing hotel and staff

title: Better than expected!
text: I recently stayed at this hotel with friends to celebrate a bachelorette weekend and The James NY-Nomad was better than we could've hoped for! The hotel is stunningly beautiful, is full of wonderful and friendly staff, and is set on such a perfect location. The hotel is within walking distance or a quick uber ride to many local "hot spots", however, you are "away  from" the typical NYC hustle and bustle. Ariana and the staff at The James NY-Nomad went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect, including decorating our suite prior to our arrival! I highly recommend this hotel for not only a girl's weekend, but any future trips to NYC!

title: Amazing Experience!
text: We wanted to stay downtown in Manhattan and I chose to stay at this hotel with my family and we had a great experience......From the moment  you walk in you feel welcome and the staff were very friendly and helpful especially Luc who was in front desk when we checked in . The rooms were immaculate and spacious for a city hotel room and the bed was really comfortable. Our stay here was  wonderful and I would highly recommend The James Nomad  to anyone!

title: So accommodating!
text: This was the perfect hotel for my business trip. Nia Owens at the front desk was so helpful and accommodating! Nancy V. was so wonderful. I will definitely stay here next time and I recommend this place for personal and business travel. Great central location and wonderful staff. Rooms are huge, clean and updated.

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: I recently stayed at this hotel with my husband and some friends to celebrate a friends birthday. The hotel is gorgeous! From the minute you walk in you feel welcome. The staff is so friendly and the rooms are so nice. Very roomy for a city hotel room and the bed was the MOST comfortable bed I've ever slept in. I can't say enough about how wonderful our stay was. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

title: Immaculate, Friendly, Chic!
text: I recommend the James NoMad to anyone looking for an amazing hotel experience from the moment you step into the cozy and chic lobby. I recently stayed overnight with my husband and a few other couples for a fun night away and the experience far exceeded my expectations. The staff was friendly and accommodating with a seamless check-in/check-out. Our room was immaculate, spacious, and well stocked with plenty of toiletries and towels. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed we’ve ever slept in. The hotel is also located in the perfect area- waking distance to a ton of restaurants and bars. Or you can enjoy dinner and drinks at the hotel restaurant or lounge. This hotel has everything and anything you’re looking for- I can’t recommend it enough!!!

title: Reservation Not Honored
text: We had booked in advance two suites for my daughter's 16th birthday and they only called me the day we were supposed to arrive, as I was on the train with four teenage girls on a rainy Friday night, to tell them they could not honor the reservation.  At the same time, I was getting emails confirming my two suites.  The hotel was really busy and it took a very long time to work something out, while the girls were standing by.   The terms of the accommodation they ended up making for me were very confusing and I was rushed because we had a celebration dinner planned.  Afterward I ended up having to haggle over the bill!  We had chosen this hotel solely for their suites, so it was really disappointing and service was very poor.  Be warned if you want to stay in the suites.  We ended up in several rooms, including a regular room with a king bed and it was kind of blah, just a standard NY city small hotel room with some cool furnishings.

title: Rustic Homily Atmosphere
text: I always wanted to stay downtown New York City. I wanted the authentic rustic feel of the city life style. I got that at this hotel. The rooms were a bit old vs new. It was had old New York decor with a few modern piece. Beds were very comfortable and I love they still have the old staircase from 1920s or so. The icing on the cake is the staff especially Ariana. I'm not sure if she was assistant sale manager. She had a warm smile, young African American petite fair skin young lady. She is the  epitome of what customer service is about. Going above and beyond. My room wasn't turn down, but it was my fault because I forgot to remove my Do Not Disturb sign. I was rushing to get to the Nike fashion show and forgot to move. I called down, and mind you it was night time, Ariana answered. I told her my room hasn't been touched all day. So pleasantly she said let me take care of it. When she call back to let me know house services is coming, she ask can I come down to show her some photos from the fashion show. She kept me company while the house services took care of my room. It was great company I must say. She made it feel like I was waiting for a few minutes. Every staff I encountered was great, but she was outstanding! Oh and the best thing was sitting on the window seal looking out to the New York streets.

title: Excellent service - Spacious rooms - EXCEEDED EXPECTATIONS!
text: My wife and I recently spent the night at the James and were instantly impressed.  All aspects from booking to check in to dining to comfort to check out were top notch.  We have stayed in NYC hotels prior to this trip but our room at the James was far superior.  Extremely spacious, beautiful, cozy and charming decor filled with 5 star amenities!!!!!  We ate at the hotel bar and and I am still dreaming about the tar tar and sliders, absolutely delicious!!! The James is in a wonderful location which made it easy for us to travel around the city.  We will definitely be staying again soon!

title: 40th Birthday Celebration
text: The James Hotel was immaculate and the staff was warm and attentive. The rooms were so nice and the bed was so comfortable! I would have taken it with me if I could. The bathroom was so clean and staying there really made the our getaway extra special!

title: Fantastic Weekend / Quiet Hotel
text:
We stayed at the James this past weekend while on a college visit and LOVED it. The lobby is warm and inviting as are the staff. The room was spotless and very comfortable. Loved that we could get 2 queen beds - hard to find and important with 2 parents and one almost-adult child! We stayed on the 3rd floor and heard absolutely not one horn or siren or even anyone talking. Very unusual for NYC!

My only complaint was that the morning coffee was served with coffee mate instead of milk so we ended up going out to get coffee. The only reason I would mention this is because they do charge a $40 per day fee which I assume covers the nightly wine and the coffee as well as use of the gym, etc. If they are going to charge they should have the best.

We didn't get a chance to take advantage of the gym or the restaurant.

title: Beautiful NYC hotel
text: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for a night out in New York.  The hotel staff was amazing, friendly and incredibly hospitable.  The hotel has so much NYC charm including hidden staircases and beautiful sleek decor.  On top of it all this had to be the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in.  I would 100% stay here again.

title: Elegant and clean
text: The hotel is great! Our experience here was beyond our expectations. The rooms are so clean, the lobby is so welcoming! I highly recommend for anyone traveling to stay here. The staff is incredibly generous.

title: Hotel Itself is Decent but the Internet is Horrific
text: I've stayed here twice and the rooms are clean and cute, bed is comfortable and the staff is friendly. However, if you have any work that you must get done online - would make sure you have a strong hotspot. The connection was unbearably slow both in my room and the lobby (less than 1mbps in download speed). I called the front desk and they connected me to their 3rd party internet manager. Spent an hour on the phone testing the speed of my connection. It never got solved because apparently i had used all my bandwidth (not possible since i was only using email and MSFT Teams). They couldn't get it fixed so i had to wake up at 5am to go to a starbucks to finish a presentation. Hopefully, they figure it out as i heard from other colleagues that have stayed that it was an issue for them as well.

title: Great service, beautiful hotel, convenient location
text:
We spent the night here with our family of four and thoroughly enjoyed our stay for several reasons, namely:
Friendly staff - everyone (doormen, front desk and cleaning staff) smiled and were welcoming and friendly, including the general manager, Eric, who checked in with us on how our stay was going.
Beautiful lobby - had a very tranquil vibe with nice art, lots of nooks/spots to sit in and a nice view of the Empire State Building and a pretty church across the street.
Happy hour - the night we arrived, there was a female vocalist/guitar player which gave it a very lounge like feel. They also served complimentary wine and cheese and offered complimentary coffee and fresh fruit in the morning.
Rooms - we were on the 9th floor and the room we got was spacious, quiet and clean. The bar was well stocked and impressive. It had everything you can think of - snacks, water, soda, liquor, wine, beer, travel adapters etc. Bathroom had high quality toiletries (pleasant herby smell), plenty of towels and was clean. We had 2 beds which were comfy and clean.
Location - it was in a great location - not too noisy but conveniently located near several subways with easy access to several attractions.

Overall, we'd recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay - sans the inconsiderate early wakeup
text:
Overall, The James NOMAD is a lovely hotel in a great location - especially if you're in town for work. The hotel is very modern, and I loved the nod to retro decor. My room was spacious and super clean. I would have gladly given this hotel a 5 star glowing endorsement if it wasn't for the super inconsiderate staff member waking up my floor at 7:30/8:00am on a Sunday.

I was sound asleep, and my checkout wasn't until noon. But, starting at 7:30am, I heard loud knocking somewhere on my floor that didn't stop. I assumed it was a rude guest, until I looked out my peep hole to see a hotel staff member BANGING on doors and sliding a piece of paper under them. When they got to my room (at 7:50am), they did 3 sets of loud knocks, and then slide a piece of paper under my door. It turned out to just be a printed summary of the charges for my room. I had no additional/unexpected charges - just the standard hotel receipt. They then moved onto a room further down the hall.

I would expect that kind of inconsiderate behavior from staff at a lower quality hotel, and was honestly shocked it would happen here - especially given it was a weekend day and they have later checkout times. I also may have expected it if there were a ton of added charges to my room, or some sort of payment issue, but that just wasn't the case. I have no idea why they felt they needed to wake anyone up to hand deliver standard receipts early on a Sunday - they easily could have just told me "no extra charges" at checkout, or slide it under my door without waking me up.

title: Very Average
text: Just a basic hotel in NYC. Rooms are very very small. It was clean and comfortable but not exactly an experience to write home about. I wouldn’t stay here again unless the price was right and it was close to where I needed to go

title: Average at best
text:
Check in was slow as they were having computer issues. Eventually lady checked us in, must have been having a bad day as particularly grumpy, more interested in speaking to other members of staff than focusing on us. Then ‘offered’ an upgrade, which we would have to pay for. Not sure exactly what the offer was, if I’d wanted to pay for a more expensive room, surely I’d have booked it in the first place.

Got to room, was the smallest room I’ve ever been in anywhere, and I’ve been in many New York hotels. It had one window which was totally frosted so zero light, which meant was extremely dark and claustrophobic. Needed a drink from mini bar, tried, but no glasses were provided. So had to get them brought up. Then took a shower, only one provided, had to call again. Later on, wanted to wash hands, but there was no soap for the sink.

In the morning was woken by a fire alarm test. Why wouldn’t a hotel do a test at midday or early afternoon, rather than when they must know guests are sleeping? Ordered breakfast, was $95 and extremely average. Wish we’d gone out and got it. An infinite number of better options close by in that price range.

All in all, average. Very disappointing.

title: Its a hotel catfish
text:
The walls are paper thin. I’m woken up from a dead sleep right now by the girl in the next room speaker phoning a customer service call.  I am hearing every word crystal clear, like she is sharing my bed. You can also hear everything in the hallway...each time a person passes by.  This is ridiculous. 

In the room the mattresses are old & uncomfortable.  The room is depressing & not well decorated.  It looks nothing like the photos on the website.  The cheap carpet in the room needs to be replaced &
There is zero lighting.  The electrical switch plates are so askew I hope the electrician was drunk when he installed them.  The room needs a major face lift.

The lobby is beautiful.....that’s probably where they spent the money on the renovation & they forgot about the rooms. Don’t stay here you will be extremely disappointed. 

There are also 2 sets of stairs into the hotel.  I waited outside when I arrived for sometime without valet or a porter. Annoyed I decided to lug my suitcase up the stairs myself...luckily a polite HOTEL GUEST carried my suitcase up both flights of stairs for me. Not a single person from the hotel staff helped or offered a hand.  What kind of service is this?!?

title: The space and location are great, but the experience was so frustrating!
text:
Know that this hotel is the cost you pay plus $40 for a resort fee plus $70 for parking plus lots of tips. All NYC seems to be like that, though.

Here the space was nice- both the room and the lobby. 

BUT: I've had the most frustrating time communicating with a person, because we were charged twice for one night on our bill. 

Additionally, we had to wait almost an hour and a half to get our car back! They told us it would take up to 40 minutes. The valet was very responsive and got our car quickly once we checked in, but the front desk (who neglected to get the message to the right people) seemed completely unaware and were not at all apologetic. An hour and a half is a long time to wait when you're ready to go home!!

Also, we'd been told that coffee would be in the room (part of the "resort fee", but it wasn't). And the coffee in the lobby? We were told it'd be ready at 6:30, but it wasn't ready until after 7. 

The front desk staff was not aware of the problems and lack of service they provided. Maybe they are not trained well? 

The space, like I said, was nice, but I won't stay here again. It was too frustrating.

title: Stunning Hotel & Exceptional Staff
text: I stayed at The James Hotel Nomad this past weekend with my husband and 4 month old daughter. I have to say I was so pleased with our experience! Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly valet/bellman team who immediately offered to helped my husband unload the car while I went to check us in. The front desk staff was very friendly and proactively asked us if we wanted a crib and mini fridge set up in our room (since I didn't even think to book these in advance). We were also complimentary upgraded to a Deluxe King room, which was of course much bigger and beautiful than the room I booked! We were then escorted up to our room by Joseph (very helpful and sweet bellman) with ALL the luggage and he even asked me if we were happy with our room accommodations before he started unloading our bags. I also work in the hospitality industry and know how important first impressions are. This hotel knocked it out of the park. The staff seems to really thrive here! I also really wanted to have dinner in Scarpetta but our baby limits our dining options these days. I ended up ordering room service and I have to say the meal was actually really tasty (recommend the Impossible Burger with steak fries). Lastly, we asked for a late check out and even though they were completely booked up they offered us a 1pm check out with no questions asked! I would highly recommend The James Hotel Nomad for anyone traveling to NYC and I definitely plan to visit again soon!

title: Great room and stay!
text: The room as really nice as we got upgraded to a bigger suite than planned. Dissapointed by the staff at the front desk,  I didn't find welcoming or friendly. I have to say that we had the option to check out around 2 pm what we didn't needed to but showed that they were flexible and that is pretty nice. At the end of the day we came back to pick up our bags. The person bringing in them to us was super aggressive in telling us that they don't have extra charges for the storage, they work with tips. What is super rude as he was not even smiling and mostely demanding. We consider this part of any hotel we have stayed in the past. Specially after staying 6 nights this was not a nice way to end the stay. I know that in the US tips are important and we always did specially when staff are helpful, smilling and caring.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: The James Nomad was an excellent hotel and me and my 10 girlfriends had a great stay. Amenities were great and the room we stayed in was spacious and very comfortable. Excellent staff who were warm and went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Check in was quick and easy, and wine and cheese hour was great! Will be sure to return to the James next time!

title: Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Staff
text: I recently stayed at the James NoMad for a girls weekend celebrating one of my friend's birthdays. The hotel was great, the rooms were lovely, and the wine & cheese hour was delightful ... but what really made our weekend was the staff. Ariana McConneaughey was INCREDIBLE! She went above and beyond to coordinate the delivery of cake, balloons, and champagne to our room, and even sent some extra wine for the birthday girl on another night! When my delivery of cake & balloons didn't arrive as planned, Ariana went out of her way to figure it out and make it work, so that the delivery appeared seamless to the birthday girl and me. I'm so appreciative of Ariana and the rest of the staff (Christine, Kent, Ana, and Angelo) who went out of their way to make this weekend so memorable for us. We really appreciate it, and will be sure to return to the James the next time we're in New York!

title: Quick, Comfy Business Stay
text: Midnight checkin was well staffed with doorman and pleasant reception. Room was adequate but expected nicer amenities. Comfortable bed with lots of pillows and well stocked minibar. Gym with 2 peloton bikes, but limited weights. Speedy checkout. Convenient location to Midtown and Flatiron.

title: Excellent Service
text: I have been staying at The James, formerly The Carlton Hotel, for business for the last nine years. The incredible service we have received from Al Bido, in particular, and so many of the women in housekeeping -- many of whom have been with the hotel since before it was The James -- is one of the key reasons we come back year after year. The entire James staff provides a warm, welcoming experience from the moment we arrive – from Manny, Miguel, and Danny at the door, to the folks at the front desk, and Al and his team throughout our stay. The James is a wonderful hotel, in and of itself, but its staff is what makes it our first choice every time.

title: Great Hotel and Location
text: This Hotel is in the Flatiron District and very easy to reach many major attractions and restaurants nearby.  It is quite easy to walk from here through out Manhattan.  We have stayed here a number of times and find the staff excellent for what ever your needs.  There are many choices in NYC, this is one of the better.

title: good locale, difficult rooms
text:
fun, comfortable lobby. 
good location on e 29th between 5th and madison.
but once upstairs... i found a spacious room with poorly designed closet and tight bathroom, all with signs of wear and tear.
travelled with friends who had a suite, also with worn furniture.
i felt this hotel had a good location with great curb appeal, but was not a good value.

title: Charming
text: Charming, but overpriced.  Nice old hotel, and like many old hotels, the rooms are small, but tastefully appointed.  Beware if the "resort fee".  If you are not ware of this little addition to your bill, you will be in for a big surprise.

title: Unexpected treasure
text:
My wife and I are frequent travelers to large metro cities. We love NYC but have not been back in a while. We chose The James NoMad because we recognized the name, but remember the service from the Chicago location. 

We were pleasantly surprised by all the hidden gems in this location. The first thing we both commented on was the very pleasant aroma that greets you every time you enter this building (I want my 'life' to smell like this). It is both welcoming and extraordinary. Plus the decor of the lobby sets the tone for things to come. It is both NYC modern chic and inviting with plenty of places to discover in little nooks. Guests are surprised nightly by free intimate events (like wine tastings). Our room was equally as inviting and spacious. The surprise in the room was just outside the window with a spectacular view of the Empire State building (amazing at night or in the snow). 

The staff was memorable and helpful. We were able to "chat up" the front desk team as they were extremely helpful in finding the perfect suggestions for everything we requested. Special thanks to Jadda for her suggestions and attention when my wife was not feeling well. We felt comfortable and welcomed. 

Favorite moment was in the Sevilla basement bar. Live jazz, amazing cocktails and cool underground vibe. This is a unique and vibrant must for our next stay. Equally as awesome was my afternoon cocktail with upstairs bartender Ellio. Entertaining, educational and fun... best old fashioned ever from all the cities I have traveled... Spent the time trading notes on drinks and travel... Awesome. 

Finally, I have to say that our close proximity to landmarks in both north and south Manhattan within easy walking and entertainment options everywhere made this location the true unexpected treasure. We minimized long cab rides, avoided major traffic congestion, always felt safe walking, and never tired of trying the local spots. The James NoMad won our hearts and will keep us coming back... Next time I have to bring my kids (maybe)...

title: Terrific Stay!
text: The hotel was beautiful and the staff were so courteous and kind! My husband and I had a wonderful stay! We complimented the trip with dinner at Scarpetta, which is at the hotel. Amazing food and service there as well!

title: Great stay to celebrate mom's birthday
text: I have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. We were in town for one night to celebrate our mom's birthday. My mom was greeted with chocolate covered strawberries in her room, a very nice touch. My mom's king room was really big, and my sister and I stayed in a Jimmy Suite, which has two full baths. Game changer. Plenty of room to hang everything up and spread out. Blackout curtains were great, the bedding was extremely comfortable and we didn't hear any noise from other rooms. Front desk and valet staff were all very helpful. Fabulous location, near Penn Station, Empire State Building and not far from Bryant Park and Broadway. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Natale nella grande mela!
text:
7 notti a New York, dal 25.12 al 01.01 presso il James New York in zona Nomad. 
Un po’ agitato della scelta fatta prima dell’arrivo (si, New York in fatto di hotel è una città a mio avviso difficile, ameno di non andare a colpo sicuro ma ciò richiede comunque spese importanti!) non appena arrivati mi sono di fatto tranquillizzato: la zona è a mio avviso una delle migliori per visitare Manhattan, fuori dal caos di Times Square (tranquillamente raggiungibile a piedi!) e quindi non troppo a sud. Insomma, al centro di tutto e se si è buoni camminatori quasi tutto risulterà raggiungibile a piedi. 
Apprezzatissima l’offerta del caffè/tea e frutta al mattino, così come dell’happy hour con vini californiani (bianco e rosso) e formaggi la sera. 
Seppur l’edificio sia basso noi eravamo comunque all’11esimo piano con vista sul retro dell’edificio. Inizialmente ciò non mi ha fatto impazzire ma col senno di poi la nostra camera rimaneva ben isolata e quindi non rumorosa. Bagno confortevole, con ampia doccia (unica pecca lo scarico del lavandino!!)
Pulizia in camera ok!
Servizio alla reception efficiente! 
Al piano 3 c’è una piccola palestra, al piano terra, di fianco alla reception c’è il ristorante italiano scarpetta (che non abbiamo provato) ed al piano sotto il locale Seville.
Insomma.. mi sento assolutamente di consigliare questo hotel e lo prenderò assolutamente in considerazione nel caso dovessi tornare a New York!

title: New Years Holiday in NYC
text:
My friends and I stayed at The James-Nomad in NYC to ring in the New Year with style and a sense of purpose. Ariana was such a big reason our stay was enjoyable as it was. She really goes out of her way for each guest. She makes them feel special and does whatever it takes to make their stay special and have a sense of individuality. 

She is a gem and an invaluable asset to the hotel.

title: Book it! It’s brilliant!
text:
What’s not to like! I have been travelling to New York twice a year for 15 years and this hotel has so much to offer, that it’s my favourite.
Unlike most USA hotels, it offers free tea and coffee, oranges and apples for breakfast. Free wine, cheese and biscuits for two hours every evening. 
It has an amazing restaurant and l mean amazing! Try the short ribs, the scallops were brilliant too!
The Seville bar provides excellent entertainment.
Central and near trains .

title: NO LO RECOMENDARÍA. NO VOLVERÉ
text: Hace unos días estando aún el hotel mi idea era la de escribir una gran crítica negativa sobre este hotel pero ya desde casa, la verdad es que voy a simplificar y decir que NO ES UN HOTEL QUE MEREZCA LA PENA EN NINGÚN SENTIDO: el manager del hotel es un señor impertinente, desagradable, poco implicado con los problemas del huesped... Las habitaciones tienen un precio muy elevado en comparación a la calidad, servicios, insonorización, instalaciones... Los baños están helados, había que poner toallas en el suelo para poder andar porque te quedabas helado. Ni volveré a este hotel, ni lo recomendaré. Un 0.

title: Hyvä sijainti, pienehkö huone
text: Sijainti hyvä, kävelemällä pääsee helposti 4-7 Av ja 20-40 St alueelle. Lisäksi metropysäkki on korttelin päässä. EST näkyy aulan ikkunasta. Huone oli pienehkö mutta toimiva. Ei juuri pöytätilaa esim take away ruokailuun. Kylppäri pieni mutta ok. Palvelu ok, siivous hyvä, aamulla sai kahvia ja hedelmiä, mikä hyvä lisä vaikkei aamiaista. Illalla oli sitten viini- ja juustotarjoilu, mikäpä oli istuskellessa rauhallisessa aulassa ja katsellessa viinilasin kanssa jouluvalaistua Empire State Buildingiä ikkunasta! Voin suositella.

title: Fabulous ... My husband and I loved the James all aspects of this hotel were outstanding!!
text: From the early arrival to our departure the staff was attentive and comforting as well as the hotel property... from the location to the top quality of the room!!! THAN YOU TO The James Hotel! We will be back next year as this is our new annual away from home HOTEL

title: Amazing Christmas Vacation
text: Our little family of 4 stayed at the James Nomad 12/22-12/26. I was very worried about pulling off Christmas for our kids while being out of town. Ariana - concierge manager - reassured me that we would be able to do all the things I had imagined having done in the room before we arrived. She went ABOVE and beyond for me & really pulled off a Christmas miracle. Ariana was available any time I reached out to her & she singlehandedly made our Christmas vacation a success. I would definitely stay at the James Nomad again for our next NYC trip, solely based on her, to be honest! We upgraded to a suite and had an amazing view of the Empire State Building!! This stay was everything I had hoped it would be and more. The hotel itself was clean, the location is great and I have no complaints!

title: We've come on a family vacation for the New Year's holiday And we went through hell
text:
I already wrote, we had hell from the hotel
And were forced to flee the hotel
The Wifi didn't work
There was no response at any time at the hotel counters
The safe in the room was broken
There was residue in the carpets for the dirt of previous guest food crumbs
In our other room the shower door was broken
And the rooms were small - barely fit together
And we were 2 in each room
And it was a catastrophe
There was no room service
There was no answer to the phones either in the service or at the hotel's main counter

title: Great hotel in great location
text: Just returned from a 4 night stay. Would definiteley go back again. Lovely staff and great atmosphere and one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in!! It is in a good location. We really enjoyed our stay.

title: Terrible Experience.
text:
I went with my family during Christmas holidays. We reserved a few rooms for many people, one of the rooms was for 3 persons. When we arrived we were told that the 3 persons would have to share a double bed, that was the company policy. So we asked for a supplementary bed (We were expecting a supplementary bed as we already booked a room for 3 people). The answer from the hotel was that they didn't have one available but that they will put us in a waiting list. The result was two nights, 3 people, sharing a double bed. When we finally got the extra bed we didn't have proper sheets and quilt. Two nights more without proper accommodation.
I would not recommend this hotel for a family vacation as they don't give you solutions if there's a problem, we feel cheated.

title: Terrible service & communications! Stay elsewhere.
text:
Really was looking forward this hotel and wanted to be positive but I have nothing great to say. We are still guests of this hotel for another 5 nights but if we had not already prepaid would have checked out by now and paid more elsewhere! 
Before leaving our home I emailed the hotel (4 days prior) to advise of our very late/early arrival (27th) into NY requesting our room to be ready with sofa bed (as booked for 4pax) made up. Also requested a separate single extra bed at this time. Nobody replied for days and when they finally did they acknowledged our needs assuring us all was understood. Ah but after advising the extra cost of the rollaway which we had no problem with advised on the day of arrival but prior to checkin, they had none. So we check in at 2am 27 Jan & get to our room to find the sofa not made up. After 43 hours of straight travel (and very little sleep) from the Southern Hemisphere I am at 2am making up a sofa bed which I was not happy about. The extra bed we made out of two lounge cushions on the floor - just like camping! 
Later that day we go to use the safe for the first time only to discover it has been locked in the open position by previous guest/staff? So a call to FD & security were prompt in responding. In the afternoon we return to the hotel and request to a lady on FD, two bottles of water (previously delivered in glass bottles & free of charge). Given the terrible service so far we then as a second measure ask the same of a man at FD. All bars covered one would think & I witness the man taking note of the impending delivery. We return after dinner and no surprise.. no water as requested to two staff members!! So we call down to In room dining, front desk & housekeeping to which the phone just rings out. I go down to FD personally aiming to collect rep bottles that I can fill with water, only to be told by Nia that they have run out of glass bottles hence no water but we can use the minibar water free of charge! Ensuring no charges are made I march back up very put out by the lack of care & attention to please the customer. This is our holiday and so far it’s been very hard work! Americans self proclaim to offer the best service by world standards. All good in theory but how about you act on it. I would not stay here again & would not recommend this hotel purely due to the lack of service or even care to serving. I used to live here and am a world traveller with very simple standards but when I pay for service, I don’t expect to be making my bed at 2am after giving you the courtesy of information well ahead of time!

title: Best in class service
text:
Attention to detail and going the extra mile- the james nomad sets the bar.   Perfect location with great vibe!  

Ariana and doomey- many thanks for making our family trip memorable!  We will be coming back!

title: Surprisingly disappointed
text: I would not recommend this hotel to other people. I was excited to finally staff at The James and was so surprised by the lack of friendliness of the staff, the size of the room and overall experience. The best part of the hotel is the location.

title: Sadly disappointed - mutton dresses as lamb
text:
I stayed here based on the good reviews. Got the ‘jimmy suite’ and was intending to stay for about ten days. I bailed out after 5. Here’s why. 

The staff are great on arrival. Front desk is friendly and helpful. But then you get to the room. 

My ‘suite’ wasn’t in the best state (damp patches on ceiling by window, peeling wall paper in bathroom) and the bathroom is literally the smallest I have ever had in a in NYC. As in - can’t get in shower with bathroom door open, one person only at a time. No way on earth two people could ever use it. Their version of a ‘suite’ also weirdly includes only low sofas and a solitary coffee table. No desk. No chairs. Nowhere to work or eat. Just a granny style sitting room you’d expect the furniture to have plastic wrapping in. 

Smallest TV I’ve ever seen in a hotel in the bedroom, stuck in the corner behind the door. Really bad interior planning. Nowhere to open your suitcase and this is meant to be a suite? 

But you can see what they’re trying to do. That kind of old school thing that’s worked at the Grand. But this hotel is small. So it doesn’t have that scale. So it just feels a bit knackered. Room had the sort of cobbled together boho soft furnishing vibe you get in any Soho house - but way way cheaper and without that sense of warmth. 

I stayed at the other James in Soho and it’s literally a class above this one. Was told this one used to be something else - a Carlton or something - got bought, had a ‘refit’ (a very skin deep refit methinks) and I just think they’ve now ended up with mutton dressed as lamb. Marble sinks and bad service. 

It is kind of trying to be like the Crosby (boutique, arty, high end) but simply doesn’t have the chops, the budget, enough staff or the authentic depth to manage it. I wouldn’t mind - but they’re charging proper money for a product that the Ace hotel would find a little too cheap, tacky, superficial and lack lustre. 

The restaurant is either super super busy in evenings (forget about getting a table without a reservation) or terribly disappointing in the mornings (apparently scrambled eggs and smoked salmon is just too much of a stretch and a simple request for some privacy which was agreed to before seating - was immediately revoked when 2 incoming diners were shown to the tables directly adjacent to mine when other tables were still empty - it was almost obtuse to the point of deliberate insensitivity. Ending up leaving and eating elsewhere). 

Apparently there’s a club but there too, hotel guests clearly aren’t that welcome. I was a regular at the Gramercy in its heyday with the Rose bar in full swing. Always had a good time. Didn’t feel even slightly interested here though given the cold vibe the door staff give out. Ended up at Indochine which was brilliant as usual. 

I heard stories about big tipping rappers and what not staying there so perhaps they were waiting for heavy tips before extending common courtesies. But seriously - this place is trying too hard to be something it’s not - 

It doesn’t have the class of the Crosby. 
It doesn’t have the vibe of the Soho Grand. 
It doesn’t have the authenticity of the Gramercy. 
It doesn’t have the restaurant of the Bryant. 
It doesn’t have the energy of a boutique hotel like Soho House (loads of exhausted looking blokes wearing suits and Hugo Boss commuter coats with back packs squeezing into the lift for free lobby coffee in the mornings). Yet doesn’t have the facilities of a business travellers hotel. 

So what does it have?

The cleaning staff were really lovely. Mable did her job with good humour and clearly works hard - but there’s only so much you can do when the carpets are stained, the windows haven’t been cleaned from the outside for months and room temperature is controlled by those old school units under the windows that rumble through the night like a steam engine having a coughing fit. 

The location is good. But the Royalton is literally at the end of the block which offers more for less money. 

The lifts are nice. Old school marble. The minibar has nice snacks. Room service - can’t even remember so couldn’t have been too bad - but then again it can’t have been that good can it. The gym is small but has all the basics. You can feel I’m reaching here right. 

I wanted this place to be cool.  I really did. 

But I think they’ve just positioned themselves all wrong. 

Too much money for too little and the service for some things is just so bad you can’t forgive it in a hotel of this size. Met another guest on arrival who was coming down to the lobby to try and get some towels as her room didn’t have any. 

I rarely have a go like this but like I said - I had to check out and find somewhere else it got that frustrating.  

Ended up at Nomo Soho - an old tried and trusted place. Wish I’d gone there in the first place now. But hey - hindsight is a beautiful thing isn’t it.  

I can’t recommend this place. Sorry. Not the fault of the staff. Just selling itself as something it’s not

title: Excellent 3-day stay in a new (to me)  neighborhood.
text: Price was what drew me to the hotel, and location. But then the hotel exceeded expectations overall. As did the neighborhood. Lobby is simple and attractive, basement bar is a little dark and hidden, but okay for a solitary drink, at least in the early evening. Restaurant is not great, but better than most mid-price hotel restaurants. Room was large enough and clean and bright. Good subway connections nearby. Madison Park is 2 blocks south. Most of midtown and downtown are within walking distance.

title: Great Location, Bad Service and Overcharged
text:
I wanted to like this hotel but the service was horrible. I was incorrectly charged for my room when I prepaid and when I called several times at different hours of the day nobody ever picked up. How does a NYC hotel that charges over $500 a night not have someone manning the phones ever? I ended up speaking to a woman from the reservation line for this hotel who I asked to call the front desk for me while I was on hold, when she also didn’t get someone to answer, she said she’d put me on a 24-48 hour call back list. All I want is for them to acknowledge there error and give me back credit to my bank but instead i’m left to dispute charges through my bank and honestly the hotel was just not worth this headache.

I stayed in a King Size Room but had to pay $45 when I checked in to upgrade to this room because the Queen rooms were “not ready”. The room, while larger then some in NYC, it was lacking design or artwork.... something just seemed off. My room phone wasn’t working which lost them money on room service because that was never resolved issue when I mentioned it to fron desk but I will say the bathroom was nicely upgraded however it was a very small sink area.

All in all - A lot of better hotels charging the same prices in similar areas that offer better service. I wouldn’t stay here again because of the bad service I experienced from my weekend stay. Is there really anything worst then being overcharged during the holidays? Yes. Being overcharged during the holidays and nobody answering the phone for 2 days to help you resolve it and still waiting...

title: Girls trip
text: Very small rooms. Clean and updated and beautiful hotel. Nice free cocktail hour every night! Beautiful Christmas tree and decorations. Great location also. Walking distance to Macys, broadway and time square!

title: Excellent stay!
text: The room was immaculately clean, appropriately sized, and had very nice shower amenities. The staff was kind and the lobby was very lively while the room was quiet. They had a nice wine and cheese happy hour and also provided coffee and apples/oranges for breakfast, which were nice perks.

title: Horrendous customer service
text: We checked in two hours after the designated time and our suite was not ready. We were told to sit in the lobby to wait and an hour later it was clear they forgot about us. No service when we called down either.

title: Do not stay at THE JAMES my room was with our bed linens no pillow cases or top sheets. No was cloths or hand towels.
text: My room was with out pillow cases top bed sheets hand towels wash cloths, no drink ware the front desk is extremely slow to answer the front desk phone plan on a half hour minimum. The had me call to correct a problem to hook up to the internet then charged for  the phone call. The front desk person thought this was apparently funny and told me it’s just one of those night.  On a positive note the bellmen were awesome top rated.  For the price we paid this was a terrible experience. Chris Welch

title: Unpretentious NYC Boutique Hotel
text: Upscale yet fun and retro furnishings, helpful staff, convenient NOMAD location. So many nearby bars and restaurants to explore, but the speakeasy on the bottom floor - with live music - is all the more reason to stay put.

title: Great Location but that is about it!
text:
Location is everything in real estate but in the case of the James New York - Nomad it is not enough. We stayed there in December 2019 and the location is perfect and is the highlight. The lobby is mediocre and without personality. The "breakfast" consists of undrinkable coffee and oranges and apples. :(
Our room was right across from the elevators and with paper thin walls, we could hear the party goers going back to their room at 3:00 AM. :(
We asked for another room but the front desk just told us they were booked and made ZERO effort to somehow make our experience a little better. As we were on the 3rd floor, the nice horn beeping made sure that if the party goers would not wake us up, the traffic would. :(
The room service was not great. They did not replace the towels we used and were soiled or the ones we put in front of the shower to avoid a spill. They did not replenish the toiletries after we used some. :(
On the positive, their gym has peleton bikes, so if you are Grace from Boston, you will find right at home. :)
In summary, for the money ($450 / night), you can do much much better.

title: Lovely find
text: We stayed here for 4 nights in November. Gorgeous hotel! Easy check in, great location, shame we were so busy & didn’t spend more time in the hotel but it wasn’t a relaxing holiday it was full on sight seeing one. We had a Queen room that was small but we weren’t bothered at all & were offered to upgrade for $40 per night but didnt need to. The room was clean & really cosy, glad it had air con as we are warm people so that was a bonus. Manny the concierge was a really lovely, helpful guy. We would definitely return. The coffee/water & fruit helped in the morning & take away cups too so saved a few dollars & kept hands warm in the bitter temperatures! We only took advantage of the nightly cheese & wine hour when we went back to get our bags & taxi to the airport, good selection & great atmosphere in the lobby area. We would return to this hotel.

title: Ok but did not meet expectations for a luxury hotel
text: The hotel room was a good size for NYC but no desk in the room to work. Internet slow. Room was run down a bit. Wood surfaces worn and moldy caulk in the bathroom. Hotel seemed under staffed. Good location.

title: Best place to stay with dogs!
text: Our dog loved his many visits to the Madison Square Dog Park. He didn't even miss his big yard at home because he loved playing with all the dogs. It was like a home away from home, the Jimmy Suite was a treat, spacious and comfortable!

title: Fantastic break away!
text: Absolutey beautiful hotel, a great central location for exploring the whole city,all of the staff are very helpful and friendly. We have really enjoyed our stay and will be returning when we are next in the big apple!

title: Excellent
text: We stayed at the James for 4 nights, very friendly and helpful. Rooms really nice and beds very comfy had a great night's sleep. Very clean and excellent service. On our last day our flights were in the evening so they kept our suitcases locked away safely so we could enjoy our last day. Thankyou to all the staff.

title: Quaint Boutique Hotel in Midtown
text: Nice and quite stay in a great neighborhood. Nice change of pace to the big change hotels. Close proximity to most everything to see and do in Midtown New York City. Friendly staff, well decorated and comfortable rooms.

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Hotel is very pretty, great beds, & the towels are the largest/thickest of any hotel we've ever stayed in.  Doormen were very helpful & eager to assist in getting a cab or making dinner suggestions; they even called Rocco's to get us a reservation!

title: From Fatima and Sherif El Wakil. Very alarming problem .
text: Room without light for 3 days, hotel management could not fix that situation in spite of our frequent complaint.We told the reception . They send the engineer who said there was a missing extension and promised to get it the next day. We talked to Nancy the manager -nothing happened. The next day to Philip- brought the engineer who said he could not find that piece.. We stayed without the lamp till we left.

title: thanksgiving NYC
text: Nice hotel but they don't clean or maintain the rooms properly.  This was our third visit to the James Nomad - we love the area, the lobby and food downstairs is great.  The rooms are not being maintained or cleaned properly.  The service has gotten worse, if you ask for towels act... it takes forever to get a response.

title: Thanksgiving trip to visit family
text: We had a wonderful stay at the James Nomad. Excellent location. Our family of four stayed in the James Suite with a view of the Empire State Building. Fabulous stay in every respect from the room, the service, the gym, the wine hour and even to the live entertainment one night during the wine hour. We will be back!

title: Buyer Beware!  Not Close to 4-5 Star.
text:
We booked to stay here for 7 nights, stayed 1!
I say buyer beware because the official pictures from the hotel look amazing, this isn’t what we experienced. 

When we checked in, Hector on the front desk was great and very helpful. We requested a room without a bath, got to the room, it had a bath. The bathroom itself was really run down, the bath had chips out of it, the wood finishings and trim were worn, the toilet blocked twice and the room also was very very basic. 

They couldn’t move us to another room so we asked if we could check out early. We were advised we’d only be charged 1 night. 

On checkout, we were charged US$422 + even though we showed reception we had booked through hotels.com for US$1989.33 inc taxes for the 7 nights (US$284.19). Incredibly cheap rate as the normal rates when we were considering this property were high.
Reception advised us this was only an average. Again this could be the case but this wasn’t communicated prior. We couldn’t prove or disprove this and wasn’t about to unpack my suitcase in the lobby to get the paperwork out so we just paid it to get out of the place.

Without mentioning who the staff member was (it wasn’t Hector) when we checked out, they said “I’m not surprised you’re leaving to be honest, I don’t blame you”.

title: Good hotel but tipping gets too much
text:
Hotel convenient and great location.  Room large and facilities nice.  Hotel very busy.  Doomie at front desk is fantastic.  

Only downside is that the tipping gets too much and they are too obvious.  It happened twice - we arrived back at hotel and doorman unloaded bags and offered to take to room.  We gave him a tip.  A different person - the bellman, brought the bags to room and then stood and waited for a tip. On the second occasion, we were leaving and our bags were stored.  The bellman brought the bags to the sidewalk and then the doorman takes it from there.  The bellman specifically asked for a tip and was quite aggressive, and said they are different to the doorman and expect a tip.  So a tip for one guy to bring it down the stairs and then another for the guy to put in car.  It just gets too much and there is an expectation.  The bellman even said - well we don’t charge to store bags, so you have to tip us.  I don’t mind tipping but it gets too much and I only want to do it once.

title: Great spot!
text: We had a room with two beds, so it was very spacious.  The front desk staff wasn't particularly welcoming or helpful; neither were the doormen.  The room was great though, and the bed was super-comfortable.

title: Not worth the money.
text: The best part about this hotel is that the beds are very comfortable.   The room was roomier than most NYC rooms I have stayed in.  That said, the  service was just average.   In the morning there is coffee and fruit.   I expected a nice fruit plate, but it's just a bowl with apples and oranges.   Nothing else.  Everything in the room fridge is priced 2-3 times the actual cost.   The front desk people were not very friendly and the doormen not helpful.

title: A Lot Gems in NYC Hotels - This is One
text: Short and sweet review: Hotel was exceptionally clean, staff professional and efficient (front desk, front door, housekeeping, restaurant hostess (outstanding), bartender and manager). Rooms are adequate (big by NY standards). Rates, again it is NYC and this is an upscale property.

title: Attentive, personal service
text: My mother and I stayed at the James in June 2019, and we had an absolutely lovely trip! Mum is older and has mobility issues, and everyone on staff were incredibly helpful, friendly, gracious, proactive, patient, and eager to help. They made her feel so special and valued! We had a beautiful, huge, and quiet room with comfortable beds on a high floor, which the front desk chose specifically so Mum wouldn't have to walk too far from the elevator. The lobby is beautiful and elegant, and the breakfast offered there every morning was perfect -- interesting and satisfying, but not too heavy. One night when I had plans without her, Mum went to dinner alone at Scarpetta, and she was so pampered that she thought they had mistaken her for a restaurant critic! Hector, Rosanna, Miguel and Roman couldn't do enough for us. We look forward to seeing them again on our next trip to New York; I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

title: High expectations
text:
The hotel is cozy, contemporary and comfortable. But I set high expectations. The room is too small! 
They offer a “breakfast” from 6-9am that is only coffee and apples and a wine and cheese from 5-6pm, that when we got there at 5:20, no more cheese were available. People continued arriving but they didn’t replaced the cheese board.
Anyway is well-located.

title: Poor WiFi and even worse fitness center
text:
Overall nice location but WiFi is unusable in room. It’s “free” but you get what you pay for. You have to goto lobby to get any descent signal. 
The fitness center is one of the worst I have ever seen. DB only to 25#. No room for any time of functional fitness. There are 2 Peleton bikes though for those who use them so that’s a plus. Plus maintenance people were constantly coming in through a door in an already small space. 
The food we had catered was also very average at best. 
The rooms are small but fine. Well stocked mini bar for those that indulge. 
There’s a nice Starbucks one block at 29th and Park.

title: Get the Size / Get the Value
text: Suites provide a very good value for NYC.....reserve well ahead and secure a deal.  Suites are sized over 600 SF and some provide views of the empire state building.  Nice bar/restaurant for eating and relaxing and a more lively club atmosphere on the lower level for youthful enjoyment.

title: Nice enough
text:
I stayed at The James Nomad hotel November 8-13, 2019.  This trip was 2 nights personal and 3 nights business.  The location of this hotel was perfect for my needs, at the corner of 29th and Madison.  It was in an area that felt safe and was a short walk to the office where I was working.  It’s also only a few blocks from 5th Avenue shopping and the Empire State building.

As for the hotel itself, it was clean, up to date, and the staff was friendly.  Unfortunately, it always felt dark and cramped, even in the lobby and restaurant areas.  I know that space is an issue in NY, but my “suite” was barely large enough to move around in and the bathroom had just enough room to turn around, but only if the door was closed.  The “closet” was also very tiny with only 4 hangers, so I had to keep most of my clothes folded instead of hanging them.  It was almost comical, definitely the smallest hotel room I’ve ever experienced. 
 
Washcloths were not provided in the room the first 2 days, so I asked housekeeping to send some.  I received them promptly, but once those were used, I received no replacements.  It’s odd that something as simple as a washcloth is not a standard amenity in the room.  Glasses or cups were also not available in the room.  It would have been nice to have these in the room to drink water, but I guess then I wouldn’t have been forced to buy the $12 bottle of water in the mini bar.  And beware of the room service menus.  The prices are listed, but at the bottom in small print you are informed that not only is a 20% gratuity added, but also an $8 delivery fee.  So room service isn’t really an amenity either.

There was free coffee in the lobby in the mornings and at times there was water available there too, which was nice to have.  I didn’t have an opportunity to try wine and cheese in the afternoon, but it’s a nice gesture for guests.

I would stay here again when traveling alone for business because the location and area are perfect for that, but due to the size of the room, I would probably look elsewhere for a personal stay.

title: Fantastic hotel/staff/rooms/location
text: Nothing to fault, our seventh trip to NYC and would definitely return to The James Hotel. I would recommend for the location as it’s easily accessible for all the areas of Manhattan. Staff/rooms and room service were all of an extremely high standard too.

title: Great location, spacious rooms and friendly staff
text:
Location is awesome. Halfway between midtown and the village, all walkable!

Rooms very nice, clean, pretty and spacious. 

Coffee station was superb (staff made sure everything was full and area was nice and neat). Coffee almost as good as Starbucks. Note that the coffee station closes at 9:30am on Sundays and 8:30am on Mondays, so get there early! Wine & cheese good in the evenings good quality as well.

Front desk is always busy. If you are trying to reach them via phone, you may have to keep calling as they don't always pick up.

title: Great weekend hotel!
text: The hotel was great. The staff, front and back were awesome! Great location. My sister and I come up every year to see the museums and we both agreed that we would recommend the James NoMad to our family and friends.

title: Awesome stay in NoMad!
text: Absolutely fantastic stay.  The staff was amazing - from the moment the valet out front was kind and really sweet.  Room was spacious - we got the Jimmy Suite so not sure about other rooms but this one was fantastic!  We travel all over the world, and have staying in NYC more times than I can count.  We stayed here because it was in walking distance to the Peloton studio, and it was absolutely perfect.

title: Not worth the money
text: I could not get anyone on the phone to order room service nor could I get anyone to extend my stay because I was out late and I wanted to sleep in. But I could not get anyone to pick up at the front desk

title: Bad customer service, great location
text:
We spent 1 night in the hotel this summer, the location is great, the room was OK.

BUT

They "forgot" to pay us the deposit deducted... still waiting  for their response after several month and email reminders....

title: Great Stay
text: Were in the city to celebrate my wife's birthday.  Received a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to help my wife celebrate.  Great hotel.  Friendly staff.  One of the most comfortable beds you will ever sleep on.

title: Anniversary Weekend
text:
Everything was great and I would suggest eating at Scarpettas restaurant excellent food.
The James is a great location to be able to walk to many different areas of New York City.
I would definitely recommend staying at this Hotel.

title: Weekend trip
text: Stayed here 3 nights for a weekend getaway in the James suite. Top notch service, great location and beautiful room. All around impressed. I would definitely recommend this hotel when staying in the area.

title: Best hotel ever
text: We can’t wait to come back to the James. Enjoyed every minute of our stay. The rooms are beautiful. The food delicious. Most of all, the staff. So nice! You’re located in a great spot for us. Our daughter lives on 30th and lex.

title: Weekend away
text: We stayed at the James for my 45th birthday trip. We were there to see Billy Joel at Madison Square Gardens which the hotel is perfectly located for. We had a great stay, lovely room, comfy bed and helpful staff. We’ll be back!

title: Issues with billing and costumer service
text: Due to horrible costumer service, left messages that weren’t responded too, lost paperwork , i feel as if none of this was corrected or addressed...the reception lost zero balance paperwork, and has yet to address Added costs and misadjusted billing..

title: Bad experience
text:
I had a short weeknend stay at the hotel. i booked a Jimmy suite but the one I was assigned had a tremendous noise coming from the window, because of an air exhaust pipe. This noise would make the room unsleeppable, so i asked to be moved. They did not provide an alternate suite or an upgrade, when they recognized the noise problem to be true. So they downgraded me and proposed a partial refund, which would still disrupt my weekend suite experience. I must say the reception staff was kind, but was not able to solve my problem, in the end.
Also, on the last day I got out of the bathroom and found a staff member in the room, even if a DND sign was out of the door. this is particularly disappointing for decency and security reasons.
I think i will not make this experience again.

title: Would stay again
text: Good location to explore New York.  Lovely friendly staff, eager to help without being intrusive. Didn't actually eat in the restaurant, did stop in for drinks and had some lovely cocktails.  I would definitely stay again.

title: My Review of The James New York Hotel
text:
Great Hotel, Best Service and Great Rooms.

Very Clean and Welcoming! 

One of the best hotels in new york, very attentive and highly recommended.

You wont regret staying at the james new york. Thank you!

title: Best place for your wedding guests!!
text: From the minute you are greeted at the front door you are treated as family! Staff is so accommodating and rooms are so nice and clean!! Daniel, Nancy and Ariana are the best at guest relations and we will be coming back soon!!

title: always a pleasant experience
text: I have stayed at the James NoMad several times when visiting NYC (for both business and pleasure). The hotel staff is extremely accommodating and have frequently let me check in very early. The rooms are also rather large as well for the Flatiron/Nomad area.

title: Canadian thanksgiving weekend in Family
text:
We stayed two nights at the James Nomad hotel with our two kids, 7 and 9, during Canadian thanksgiving. 
Our room was a good size and beds really comfortable. The room service was nice also.

On the negative side, the hotel didn't honor the $20 credit that we had with Expedia. We sent 3 emails to the hotel and we didn't receive any response (We realized on our way back home that the hotel didn't apply the credit). We were disappointed about the overall customer experience.

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed at the James Nomad last week in a corner king room for 4 nights. If you have ever been to New York before you know most hotel rooms are pretty small but the room I had was huge and for a big guy like me you couldn't ask for more. Walk in shower with the rain faucet was perfect and the marble sink was unique. Wish I had one of those in my own house. Had a great city view looking down 29th and Madison. The hotel is really in a great location and a great wine hour in the evening. Thge staff was great from beginning to end. I would recommend this hotel to anyone first class all the way

title: Great vacation
text:
Stayed with the family (2 adults & 3 kids). Arrived late Sunday and the Jimmy suite was too small, although assured by the travel agent it would be adequate. The pull out sofa bed was dreadful as the mattress was too thin and lacked support. The roll away beds were quite good.

The next morning the management bent over backwards and we moved to a great James suite. This was great for the 5 of us and we had 2 roll aways. The youngest child slept in the king size bed with us.

The management and front desk were great and really helped turn this into a great vacation. If you need the space go for a James suite. The Jimmy only fits 3.

title: Just love it
text: The building is very unique and the room is cozy.  I did not interact much with the staff, but everyone I talked to are nice especially Nancy the Director.  She is kind and fun.  It is hard to get in touch with anyone when I try to call the front desk.

title: Stains an Carpet, outside noice Isolation very bad
text: Carpet should be exchanged long time ago, big stains also on the (decorative) pillows. Some furniture needed a update. Crumbs from a prior guest on the sofa. Windows were dirty and very very bad noise isolated.

title: Gem in the city!
text:
Fantastic room!  Spacious and very clean... This hotel is the gem in the city...Staff was on point the whole time. Close to everything. Great restaurants and attractions  near by. 
Don't look anywhere else. My new hotel in the city...

title: Poor service, poor attitude, over-rated hotel
text: We stayed for 7 days. This is an over-rated boutique hotel. Housekeeping was bad - every day there was something wrong - no clean glasses, no hand towels, no top sheet on the bed etc. The drinks we had from the mini-bar were never replaced. Attitude of the staff was spotty - some good, some really bad.

title: Great stay
text:
Came for a weekend get away to meet up with family. Great hotel, centrally located. Good vibe. Stayed with my wife and 13 year old daughter. 
Got in on a busy Friday afternoon and was given solid 1st class service by Ariana M at check in. Our second time staying here and we will be back again.

title: Long weekend break
text: Well placed hotel for a long weekend break. Close to subway and places to eat. Nice area near Empire State. Room small but comfortable. Free tea/coffee and fruit in the morning much appreciated as was the wine and cheese from 5.30pm. Get there before 5.50pm however or there is nothing left! Friendly helpful staff.

title: Nice Place, Reasonable pricing.
text: For the location and amenities, this is a great spot.  Look for Ariana, she's great! Excellent Korean food nearby, and close to Union Square. Asante keeps the lobby looking sharp too! Entire staff is great to be honest.

title: Experiência duvidosa...não recomendo.
text: Localização ruim: não é perto de zonas centrais, nem em local "trendy". Nas proximidades há uma região com muitos usuários de drogas na rua. O atendimento da recepção e reservas é confuso. Fiz uma reserva com uma noite a mais, para garantir chegada cedo, já que meu voo pousava 6h30. Liguei no hotel no dia anterior para confirmar que estava tudo certo. Reservei corner room por causa da vista e janela maior. Tudo confirmado. Ao chegarmos no hotel, o quarto não estava disponível. Conseguimos entrar no quarto apenas às 11h30 e numa categoria diferente da reservada. Ainda ouvimos da rececionista que não cobraram o "early check-in" devido ao inconveniente. Lamentável... isso seria o mínimo. Perderam o computador do meu marido, entregue e rastreado pela Amazon, que se prontificou a mandar outro (isso sim é serviço). Cobram USD 35 de facilitar fees por maçãs, água e um queijo bem mal arrumado no lobby, com um vinho de baixa qualidade. A limpeza do apto deixa muito a desejar, o telefone estava imundo, tinha uma batata frita velha no chão. Na saida, esperamos 30 minutos por um mensageiro para ajudar com as malas, acabamos descendo nós mesmos com elas. Ponto positivo é o atendimento do pessoal da porta, mensageiros e capitão porteiros, muito atenciosos. Por USD 650 a diária, esperava muito mais.

title: Incredible stay
text: I stayed last year with my family. The service was great and they upgraded us to penthouse. It was incredible. Would recommend. Going back November 8 for wife’s bday. Definitely one of the better boutique hotels in NYC

title: not happy...
text:
failed to give me wake up calls on 2 separate occasions, days... could have missed flight out if i didn't set my own personal alarm as didn't trust hotel
AC unit created a loud bang each time it went on, off disturbing sleep (similar noise on unit above or next door)

title: Not great...
text:
I just stayed one night at the James Nomad. I remember when this first opened and always wanted to try it out. I got a great rate for one of the suites. A big disappointment! First off - customer service was terrible! I checked in around 9am (completely understanding that the room would probably not be ready and I would just leave my bag) - the 2 people at the front desk were not friendly or approachable. I’m pretty sure the man who checked me in didn’t even smile! He pre-registered me and said they would call as soon as the room was ready...I returned to the hotel at 5:45 and hadn’t received one call from the hotel all day!!!! When I mentioned to another gentleman at the front desk checking me in his response was “I just got here I don’t know why they didn’t call you” Nice. And he had the nerve to have an attitude when I asked for 2 keys! 
I left for dinner and called the front desk asking for turn down service. I had to call 3 times before someone picked up and then talk to someone for 5 minutes explaining what I meant by turn down service. So take a guess - I returned to my room and there was no turndown service- no made up bed, fresh towels etc...
Lastly, checking out this morning at 9am I was met with the same man who checked me in the previous morning.
