He had the same aloof attitude and because I had breakfast in the restaurant couldn’t provide me a receipt at that time but said he would email it to me shortly...it’s 3 hours later and I still do not have my receipt. I will not be returning to the James Nomad.

title: Love James Nomad
text: Such an awesome hotel.  We booked the corner suite.  Very spacious, clean, and friendly staff. As with any hotel in the city, street noise can be heard from room (corner suite 7th floor), but that wouldnt stop us from staying here again.  Awesome location.

title: Lipstick on a PIG
text: We are regular NYC visitors so have stayed at quite a few hotels in the city and none have ever compared to the horrible experience we had at The James NOMAD the past few days. The staff is in a perpetual state of indifference and certainly don’t bother trying to hide their displeasure of being inconvenienced when asked for an extra blanket or if there’s an emergency because the fire alarm is going off (it went off twice last night). They either put the front desk and housekeeping lines on silent or completely ignore them. We had to go down to reception and ask if something was wrong with our phone as no one from housekeeping, in room dining or the front desk picked up the phone when we called. The front desk woman didn’t bother looking up from her computer or speak to us. Another staff member came out from the side door and starting complaining to us about what a bad day they’ve had. He never asked what we needed. The only redeeming quality about this hotel is that Scarpetta is located inside but still not worth staying there. Our hands were full of luggage and The door man actually asked if we wanted him to open the door! Lastly, it appears they spent all their money on new carpet and paint and didn’t bother with sound control. You can hear the room doors next to you opening and closing and people taking in the hallway. If you can hear that, I’m sure you can imagine how loud all the street noise is. Zero insulation/sound control  measures were taken. If you expect horrendous service and blatant rudeness from all the staff then this hotel is for you. Otherwise, there are plenty of other hotels in the area that are far superior.

title: Slip-shoddily maintained, small rooms
text: Definitely an adequate hotel, but not a premium experience. Both rooms I was in had maintenance issues. The furnishing was fine, generic, and the decor also fine. Construction and sturdiness of furnishings was kind of lacking. I would look elsewhere if you are willing to pay in this price range.

title: lovely stay
text:
We stayed for 4 nights at the James and it was very enjoyable. Spacious rooms with modern bathrooms which were kept very clean. We took advantage of the morning coffee and evening cheese and wine - nice added touch!

Only down side was the staff were very chatty between themselves whilst we were checking in which did seem quite rude, but otherwise very helpful. 

Would recommend.

title: Nice hotel shame about the wedding fair noise
text: The hotel is stylish and the location is good - very handy for all areas of Manhattan. The service was perfunctory with no personal touches and we had no answer when calling room service to try to get some glasses for the room. Unfortunately, the hotel was hosting a wedding fair in the adjacent room to ours. The organisers started setting up and taking noisy deliveries v early in the morning (around 5.30am) and then had customers  traipsing past constantly from 9am onwards. It felt like we were staying in the middle of a shopping mall. I would recommend when booking to check that there won’t be a sale room set up next door to you. The hotel offers coffee in the lobby in the morning (breakfast isn’t included in room price). Overall, an ok stay, but we probably won’t return.

title: Fantastic Stay at The James Nomad
text: Just arrived back home from a fantastic stay at The James Nomad.We stayed in the Jimmy suite which is 2 rooms one with a double bed the other a sofa bed both had en suite shower room attached.Rooms were comfortable and clean .The hotel is in a great location near the Empire State Building and easy walking distance to attractions and subway.All the staff were friendly and would definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to go back to New York.Thank you The James New York Nomad we loved every minute of our holiday with you.

title: Great, clean rooms. Terrible customer service
text: We loved our rooms and the hotel lobby was very nice with complementary wine in the evenings and a great restaurant in it. Except the customer service was terrible and that's where they lost me as a customer. We called the front desk, concierge and housekeeping lines more than a dozen times with no answer and had to wait hours, sometimes days for items we requested. Housekeeping didn't replace amenities so we had to call and wait for toilet paper. We had to go find our own towels because we never got them. One person forgot a toothbrush. It took them over 24 hours to bring one (by then she had bought one and was using my toothpaste). Also, when we were leaving we mentioned to the front desk how we were upset that they never answered the phone when we called from the room (we even tried calling from our cells to see if they'd answer) and they said that it wasn't their fault they didn't answer. No apology, which at the bare minimum they could have said "Oh sorry for any inconveniences." Nope. Just wasn't their fault. I've had better service at worse rated hotels or Airbnbs. Oh, and they had all these deals and events listed in their elevator for the month we stayed and when we went to the coffee shop to get it, they said the deal never existed and they had no clue what we were talking about. Which after everything else was super annoying.

title: Look forward to returning!!
text: Overall  - the most gracious and welcoming staff!! Every member of staff I encountered went out of their way to see if there were any way they could help improve my experience.  Convenient location - close to all midtown needs for business and fun.  Will absolutely recommend and return!

title: Awesome!
text:
Highly reccomend!
Good location 
Nice atmosphere
Modern
Nice service
I will stay here again next time
And might recommend to friends! Thanks for give a good impression! Location is so good just walk and take a subway is enough to cover all manhattan!

title: Amazing hotel, amazing staff
text: It was our first time staying here and it was amazing! The staff is incredible, especially Roman who was super helpful with moving in and out and gave us great restaurant recommendations! Would definitely stay here again!

title: Worst service
text: Spent an hour on the phone with the front desk just to get the phone in my room fixed. Requested that they take away room service plates and when I got back 6 hours later they were still there. The front desk was short tempered when it was their service making for the problems.

title: Dont let the hotel order you cab
text: On our way back to the airport we asked if the hotel could help us order a cab. The short story is that we had to pay 160usd from the hotel to EWR, we paid 88usd the other way. I have sent the hotel several email regarding this matter, never heard anything back. This robbery of the guest

title: Fab Stay
text: Welcome with a smile by Jose. Hotel was lovely, room was clean (a little cold with no way of turning up the heat and the lighting wasn't great for working in) but I loved the doormen and how they have happy hour for tea and coffee in the morning and wine in the evening. That was a perfect way to get people out of their rooms and socializing especially if staying alone like I was on a business trip.

title: Great Location but beware of the service
text: My room was fine , some of them are very small and odd shapes. The employees could not be nicer but they are extremely understaffed and you an see the employees are overworked and there are very few of them. also they generously offer complimentary coffee in the morning but it is not hot fortunately there is a Starbuck's a block away. They just can't get the details correct. Phone was so old in my roo it was nothing but static  calling down. Have complimentary filtered water in bottles they will provide and then forget the glasses. Again I think the few employees there don't have time for albl of the requests too few people staffed.

title: Worst Experience in 20 years of Travel
text:
Except the doormen, all the staff including the front desk manager (Kent) talk with an attitude, sarcasm, and with mockery. I had several concerns/complaints that I thought was fair to share with them to give them a chance to fix it, they responded with mockery. For example, I was calling the front desk, operator, housekeeping...trying to find someone to answer yet no one answered. I finally called the restaurant and someone answered. But they couldn’t help me with my request. The restaurant worker walked to the front desk to relay my message yet no one from the front desk called me back. I came downstairs to find the staff chit chatting. I told them that no one was answering and their response was “is your phone working? Maybe it’s not working.” Then how did I reach the restaurant?? And isn’t it their responsibility to make sure the phone works well...why even ask me the question? She also acknowledged that the restaurant worker relayed my message. Then why didn’t anyone contact me back??

They charge a hotel fee that covers water. They didn’t fill up the water for 2 days. When I asked for water, they gave me tap water in a reusable glass bottle. When I asked for bottled water, the supervisor said “must you really have bottled water?”  It’s a 4 star hotel and I expect 4 star service and amenities. We had no amenities in the bathroom on day of arrival. I called to tell them that and they brought 1 soap. 

To summarize, the treatment we got was as if they were doing us a big favor by allowing us to stay in their “palace”, which has dirty windows, rooms without the amenities that was promised (or any amenities for that matter), and staff who really don’t care. 

I travel a lot for business and leisure. I’ve stayed at many, many hotels...this was the worst I’ve experienced. I’ll never come back nor will recommend to my colleagues and friends.

title: "Luxury ✅ Location ✅ Lifestyle ✅  ALL with GREAT service and a smile"
text:
We had an absolutely AMAZING stay in NYC with family and friends for a special occasion and WOW - James NoMad really delivered beyond expectations.  

Check in was a breeze, the staff was super friendly and we all found the rooms to be inviting and spacious.  BTW the lobby has a coffee service and happy hour daily.

This place delivers on all fronts - Luxury ✅ Location ✅ Service ✅  and with Scarpetta NYC (Italian Restaraunt) and Seville (Lounge) on property......You will not regret a stay at James NoMad.

title: Stylish Hotel at a Nice Location
text:
I arrived at the James New York - NoMad around 10:30 am, and they did not have a room available.  So, I stored my luggage with them, spent some time working in the lobby where the Wi-Fi was excellent and went to my business lunch and meetings.

Arrived back around 5:0 pm, and they quickly gave the keys to my room.  The room itself was fine, but its stench was intolerable - it appeared like a heavy smoker had done a lot of smoking there.  I called them and they promptly offered to send ventilation equipment to the room, but it would require that I be out of the room for over an hour.  This would have been fine as I had a business dinner to go to, but considering the amount I was paying for this hotel, I went downstairs and asked if I could get another room.  The first response was that they were fully booked, but with some gentle urging they found another room, which turned out to be an upgraded room as it was huge and more upscale than the first room.

What's interesting is that this room too has a distant whiff of the stench - perhaps it traveled through the ventilation system.  But this room overall was perfect.  The room sizes of both rooms were huge by New York City standards.

Scarpetta is a lovely restaurant, and it does amazing breakfast too with avocado toast and poached eggs.  The check-out was quick, but at first they were unable to print receipts because their management company was changing and they were getting a new system.  Had to call later to ensure I got the receipt.

The location is super convenient, within walking distance of a lot of sights and venues.  There are lots of great restaurants nearby.  

It has a great bar in the basement that is fully stocked and open till very early in the morning.  This bar just got rated among the top 50 best bars in the word by CNN Travel.

Overall, the service is variable and can stand to improve, though when it's good, it's really good.  In terms of room size and location it's a standout hotel, so I am glad to have stayed at The James New York - NoMad.

title: The James NoMad offers OUTSTANDING service & accommodations in the perfect location!
text: We were in New York on business for two nights.  The hotel staff was helpful with pre-arrival arrangements, went out of the way to assist us and welcome us to their fine hotel.  All staff that we encountered were friendly, professional and genuinely interested in offering warm hospitality.  STAY at the JAMES NOMAD.  You'll be very pleased you did.

title: A little disappointed!
text: The hotel is in a lovely location! However arriving on an overnight flight from London with many bags I was disconcerted to see there was no doorman and no ramp and so I had to lug my cases up the outside stairs and then once in the hotel there was another flight! No-one came to help!  We were 40 minutes to early to check in so went for a walk.  When we returned we were still waiting, and finally after almost 90 minutes and checking in 3 times with 3 different people, we got our room!  Very small and a not nice view of a brick wall! Bathroom was pleasant! Bed was comfy though! Not sure I would return here as the staff were not great at dealing with issues and I think there are better hotels for a better price!  I was disappointed as had heard good things about this hotel but on this occasion it just didn't deliver!

title: too small, too expensive, not worth it
text: don't waste your time.  This was a horrible weekend.  My husband and I were all over each other in the most minuscule room that wasn't well kept. The bathroom was not even big enough for one person. Staff was not attentive; no turn down.  Didn't refill towels.  Ugh.  Location is the only thing going for this.

title: This is definetly NOT a 4 star hotel!
text:
On Biz trip in NYC and stayed for 4 nights at this hotel.

This is not a 4-star hotel, and definitely not worth the price tag!Overall an OLD Hotel! The Hallways, the rooms everything is pretty old looking. Not sure when they renovated last. Very small elevators and same goes for lobby, they have installed many mirrors downstairs to make it look larger than it is!

Not sure why they charge $40 daily fee (they are not a resort to charge for amenities that don't exist!). I did not join the wine & cheese happy hour!

Room: I stayed on the 9th floor. My room was a good size room compared to other hotels but everything is old. The walls had dark marks and even dead bugs that were not cleaned by house keeping. It's was pretty noisy, I could hear everything that was happening outside of the building (seemed like the window was open but it wasn't) and conversation from the hallway! I couldn't sleep.

Room service: I called 2x the In-room dinning and no one picked up, so then I called front desk who then tried them and they were busy "he said" and wasn't able to reach them either. So he took my order instead to deliver to the chef. About 10min later the dinning called me to confirm my order: I ordered the James Burger and a glass of Melbec, he informed me that they do not have it and I order a Cab instead. Food was meh, for the Burger I asked for well done and added avocado. Sadly, the burger came medium and still pink inside I only ate the outside. The Wine was ok to wash down the not prepared well burger.

Cleanness Of Hotel & Housekeeping:
I mentioned the walls and dead bugs. I also wanted to wear the ropes they supply and when I opened it, it had red/brownish stains all over it inside and outside!

The bathroom was ok! Small surface space, old fixtures and rusty bath but usable! I used the standup shower which was ok!

The next morning the housekeeping who cleaned my room didn't take the tray of food that obviously was from before and looked like it was done! Later in the early eve someone knocked to pick it up!

To top it all, when checking out I was reminded that I had a package of staying 4nights and I get one night Free... and they still charged me 4nights. I had to call back and then ask them to refund. And even when asking for the total amount they didn't give me the right amount back and till I pointed it all. Hoping the refund goes through!

I wouldn't recommend to stay here!

title: 街の中心部にあるホテル
text: 地下鉄駅からも近く、高級感あるホテル。近隣にはスーパー、レストランやバーも揃っており、不自由はしないと思う。ただ、この手のホテルはリゾートフィーとしてフロントで別途料金の徴収がある。（旅行サイトにも記載されているが、見落としてしまう場合もあり）

title: James hotel
text: Had a small issue with my room but the director Nancy went above and beyond to remedy the issue.  Great staff and hotel! Thanks for a great stay.  In house laundry and dry cleaning was super convenient too.

title: Good but...
text:
I recently stayed at this hotel and overall my experience was good apart apart for 2 incidents. On the first night we realize that the room did not have an hairdryer, it was about 8 pm when we notified reception who told us someone was going to bring us one soon. We call back at 9 pm since we were about to go to sleep and again they told us they would send someone. No one came. We than went to sleep, woke up at 5 am and had to call reception once more, this team they were really apologetic and send some one within 10 minutes.
After that our stay with them was pleasant. Quiet room, helpful staff, they also kindly printed for me some tickets I needed :) 
The second disappointment happened when they charged me $200 credit hold at check-in (which is normal and expected for any hotel) although at check-out no one has mentioned when the credit hold was going to be released. A week after check out I contacted the accounting team who told me that he money should be released 15 business days after check out (this was the 4th of September), so I patiently waited. On the 16th day I tried to reach out again the accounting team, but this time it seemed the telephone number in Google Maps was no longer connecting to the Hotel but to the main group. No one knew how I could contact the hotel. On day 17 I called the number shown in Trip Adviser and manage to talk to the reservation team (because the accounting team was unresponsive (via email and phone calls)), but this time they told me that it takes 30 days for the credit hold to be released. 
I'm very disappointed by how difficult it seems for them to return the funds into my bank account and conveniently changing they refund policy. It's not the 27th of September (18 days since check-out) and still waiting for my money to be returned.

title: Love New York
text:
Great Hotel with lots of staff to help, easy check in and check out service with a great locations to attractions and easy to find transportation.  
The rooms were quiet and restful and I would stay here again.

title: WARNING
text:
We recently stayed at The James and had a wonderful time, however having just got my credit card statement I am astounded to see that I have been charged nearly £1700 (in error) for the room which was paid for in full prior to our departure via Virgin Atlantic. 

I have emailed the hotel and they have not had the courtesy to acknowledge or indeed respond.  This has now been passed on to both Virgin and credit card company.  

Very disappointed with their customer service hence the low score

title: Great hotel!
text: On a recent "girls weekend" in NYC, I had the pleasure of staying at The James NoMad.  This hotel is wonderfully situated and no more that a 30 minute walk in either direction to some of NYC's best offerings. The hotel's exterior is beautiful and the rooms, while not big, are well appointed with very comfortable beds.  The lobby offers plenty of seating with great atmosphere and complimentary coffee in the AM and a wine and cheese happy hour. All in all a great stay and I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting the city.

title: My Stay
text: I enjoyed my stay at your hotel and would stay there again. The hotel staff were pleasant and willing to meet any and all of my accommodations that I had requested. I enjoyed my room and the hotel staff made sure that I had plenty of towels.

title: Very nice stay
text: I booked this hotel via hotels tonight. After i booked i read several recent reviews that were less than great and i was worried about my stay. However, I have to say everything was great. The hotel itself was very nice and clean, and any and all staff I came in contact with was warm, friendly and promptly helpful. The room was clean and I had a great night sleep. I was in town for the night for work and this was a perfect stop. This is a nice, updated hotel that is clean with friendly staff. I'd stay here again for sure. The room was small but this is NY; all rooms are small unless you spend a fortune. I thought it was totally appropriate for the location.

title: Awesome trip
text: First time in New York for our family holiday. The James Hotel - NoMad was the perfect location to explore Manhattan. Room (Double Queen) was ideal for 3 adults, although the bathroom was very small. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly.

title: Anniversary trip
text: We stayed at the James nomad for our anniversary and in the penthouse; it did not disappoint. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and you have everything you need within the hotel/walking distance. We enjoyed champagne in the free standing tub over looking the city, dinner at Scarpetta, followed by drinks at Seville. If you’re looking for one place to stay that has it all in NYC, the James is a definite must stay!

title: A nice stay
text: Front desk was welcoming and friendly.  The room worked for two guests and was clean and looked great.. Rates were reasonable.  I'd stay here next trip into NYC.  NYC is under tremendous construction projects and road improvements.  I didn't hear any of it in my room.

title: A gem of a hotel!
text: We had a wonderful experience staying at the James Nomad in July this year (long overdue review!).  We were a party of 5 and had two adjoining suites on the 11th floor.  Granted this afforded us generous floor space; regardless, the layout, furnishings, toiletries, linens and service were all first class.  Clean and relaxed with a cool, mid century vibe - perfect for keeping trendy teenagers happy!!.  The reception and lounge areas are just stunning and provided a perfect place to relax and unwind after a long day in the heat.  We enjoyed their cheese and wine each evening!  Very helpful, friendly staff and plenty of them on duty at any one time.  The icing on the cake; this hotel is two blocks from Madison Sq Park - which we escaped to each evening.  If I am lucky enough to visit NYC again, this would be my default hotel. Simply perfect!

title: Perfect location, friendly and modern vibe.
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this fabulous hotel situated in midtown. Close to everywhere and lots of interesting places to explore nearby. Our room was spacious and comfortable and the staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful. Would thoroughly recommend to any of my friends.

title: Great stay!
text: Great experience! Ariana was super nice and welcoming! Jose and Ashraf were really helpful with check-out. Thanks! Room was very nice and clean. Lobby is great! Happy hour is really fun! Music is excellent @najahlewisofficial is a fantastic singer!

title: Amazing attention and service always. Impeccable hotel with superb service.
text: Great service and exceptional hotel. Only place I will stay in the city. I find it incredible and the staff is just amazing. Hotel looks beautiful and smells great. Stay here often and can not be happier!

title: Not great for business
text: Very slow internet makes business kind of impossible; staff is slow and not overly friendly; location is fine with decent proximity to subways; rooms are clean and nice however; perfectly fine for non-business stay

title: Great experience!
text: I brought my daughter to NYC for her first time to celebrate sweet 16. The hotel staff was very accommodating and helpful which made our experience that much better. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Enjoyable stay
text:
We stayed here while visiting family. Only stayed one night. Our room was comfortable and quiet, bed was great and when we asked for more pillows we were given the option of foam or down. 
Breakfast is really just coffee and fruit but we were meeting family for breakfast anyway. Room is small ( ish) but that’s New York!! 
We would stay here again due to location ( restaurants, things to do) and proximity to family and train station. Room was very clean, nice shower and friendly service.

title: Très contents
text: Super hôtel très bien tenu , la chambre était impeccable. Il est très bien situé pour visiter New York et permet de faire de temps en temps une pause dans la journée. Personnel sympathique et agréable.

title: Disappointing
text: Nice hotel, good location, horrible customer service. Except for Hector and Daniel at the Front Desk! The front desk or hotel operator keep hanging up on you, when they did decide to answer the phone. Had to wait until 4:45 pm to check-in to our room when check-in was at 3pm and we had a wedding at 5:30 pm to get ready for. Very stressful and disappointing.

title: Strategic meeting
text: I enjoyed my star at The James Nomad! It is Wells located--Amazing location! Rosana anda Phillipe were great making my check in Anderson out Smooth And easy. Ariana introduced me to the other people who helped me during my stay  thank you ashaf, asante. And Roman!

title: worse
text: horrible and super rude staff, rooms are tiny and barely any light. open the door and it hits the bed, has to upgrade to a bigger room but the lights are so dim. overall 3/10 rating. got a good deal to stay here through a 3rd party website but won’t ever stay here again.

title: Dont stay here
text:
The cost for this location is way to high, the rooms are DIRTY, the location terrible.
When we checked in they could not find our reservation and just told us they had no rooms available.
After showing them our reservation confirmation they gave us a room smaller then we reserved.

The first night they did not clean our room, which led to an argument with the night manager who obviously did not care.

The carpet was stained and dirty. There were water stains on the ceiling in the bedroom and bathroom.

This place should be avoided, there are to many nice hotels in NYC at this price range in better neighborhoods and a lot cleaner. STAY AWAY

title: AWEFUL! RUDE! USELESS
text:
•DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL WITH AIR MILES
• 0 customer service. Requests the guest figure out hotel booking errors themselves. 
•Managers either inept or downright rude and confrontational (Nancy is her name).
• Does not answer the phones. Takes 1hour to get ice. 
•Look at the other recent reviews not what hotels says as a reply. This hotel has serious problems. 

My wife and I came in for one night. Upon check in they said they had no reservations under our name. 
I showed them my confirmation email. I had booked with Air Miles. They asked us to take a seat as their manager investigates. 30 mins later he comes over! Basically telling me air miles is closed and there is nothing they can do. I asked if we can book the room on credit card and figure out the payment with air miles the next day. He was agreeable to this. By the time we got into our room the process had taken well over an hour and we had to cancel some of our other pre made plans. No compensation was offered. The next day I phoned air miles who were very helpful and pleasant. They stayed on the phone with me through the whole process. We got the mangers name that day (Nancy) and this was escalated with her. They fixed the payment after about one hour of being on the phone... as the hotel staff was inept. I asked the front desk staff (not the manager) while I was on hold if this happens a lot he said that they were changing systems and that it has in fact been happening a lot with air miles bookings and that it needs to be addressed by management (this is their own staff saying this). I was on the phone with air miles still and I asked them why this happened? They also communicated to me that the hotel had changed their emails and not updated the booking websites. While all this was happening I found several other people encountering the same problem and the hotel telling them they are fully booked so they don’t have any place to put them. Once air miles resolved the problem I spoke to the manager (Nancy). This was quite the experience. I told her that air miles said that it was the hotels fault she denied this. She said they never got the email so not their problem. I said even still I have now wasted most of my morning dealing with this and that not my problem. It shouldn’t be the guests responsibility to do all the work to figure out what is going on wrong. I told her this is terrible customer service and that I deserve to be compensated for my lost time and stress. This is when she got confrontational and told me that I was just fortunate to have gotten a room last night because they could have just told me there’s nothing they can do. I said that is the hotels responsibility to its guest to fix issues that come up not kick guests to the curb. She reiterated that we were just lucky enough to stay there in a very aggressive manner which took me back as I was very calm the whole time. The front desk agent that was next to her actually had to physically push her back and say she would take it from here. That agent apologized and said she would speak to her GM and try and figure out something to apologize. She took down my number. I never received a call. Horrible customer service!!!

title: I wouldn’t book again
text: The James in NoMad is a perfectly fine hotel in general. Room service, gym, good sheets and towels. If you get a good price and you want to be in this part of town, you could definitely do worse. But I wouldn’t recommend it for two reasons: 1) I tried calling five times and never once had someone answer at the front desk. Frustrating. 2) It’s a refurbished hotel and they did a nice enough job with materials but my room was miniature and dark.

title: No management, no customer service here!!!
text:
Nice enough hotel, clean rooms, good location. This is it. 

This place might as well be managed by the cleaning staff and maybe the doorman. Once you check in, you are on your own here!!

You can call concierge, front desk and any extension from your room phone and NO ONE will pick up!!! Beyond frustrating...
 
Wanted to order room service: NO answer. 
Called the “restaurant” button.. the corner restaurant picks up, and those ladies are too cool to deal with hotel guests (she literally told me “i don’t work at the hotel!!”; then why is here extension there???!)
Went and got food, came back and asked for 3 plates to eat the burgers I got on the street... the answer: it will take between 30 minutes and 1 hour!! FOR EMPTY PLATES??? Nobody cares in this hotel. Doorman wont hold your door or greet you. I saw the doorman talking to his friend and having a good time hanging out at the entrance. People in and out. And he was just there, chillin’ and laughing with his buddy....

You may or may not see people at the front desk. And when you see one, they might be too busy Instagramming to talk to you...

I finally got someone on the phone the last morning, and he was desperately trying to get rid of me. Zero customer service. 

If you are ok with being on your own, this is the place. Very dismissive attitude towards guest at this hotel. It seems like they are doing you a favor just by looking at you. 
Nobody cares in this hotel, AT ALL!!

title: No response
text: We stayed at the James in August 2019. The overall experience was decent. We found the location to be good with clean rooms and friendly staff. The wine and cheese in the evenings was a nice touch. We did however have a billing query after returning to South Africa and noticing that the payment processed did not match the invoice received at check out. We used the billing enquiry link on the website however received no reply. We thereafter used the reservation address with no reply. There is no contact information listed on the website other than the query links which no one responds to. Would sincerely appreciate a response on this forum with a contact person and information

title: Would never come back!
text:
It all started with the fact that we booked a suite. We got the two double bed and a connecting door to another “bedroom” that had a sofa bed. For a couple with kids it’s a big no no. When we asked to change the room all of a sudden the guy in the front desk decided that it’s the biggest room they have after telling me a few seconds earlier that ours is not the biggest one and that they have bigger rooms... We told him that we wouldn’t mind paying extra... so no. 

The door to the toilets in the main room didn’t close so we had to leave it open without any privacy!!!! 

The lights kept on turning off after two minutes without walking or moving around the room. So imagine yourself sitting with your kiddos and every 2min you have to wave for the lights to turn on. 

The cleaner decided that the trash should stay as is without taking it. Seriously?!?!

The windows were not doubled glassed and you felt like you were sleeping on the street. Yes I know it’s New York but seriously?! 

The doorman saw I have a baby in the stroller and 3 more with me and couldn’t even open the door when we wanted to leave !!! 

This is not even a 1 star hotel but a crappy old fashion hotel that someone has to shake it very well. 

That’s a bummer especially when we paid so much for... nothing!!!!!

title: Ok overall. Good location, nice lobby, suites are spacious, attention to detail lacking
text: First room we had was dirty and we asked to be moved which the reception staff arranged willingly. Second room was better and quite spacious. Location is good for getting around Manhattan. Reception staff and Joseph on the Concierge were excellent and very accommodating. Cleaning service to the room was less good - water not being replenished, no robes, no shower gel and pull-out bed not being made-up.

title: Family
text: We expected more, I understand it is NYC, that the hotel has more then 300 rooms (this is what I was told at the reception) but this is just a fine hotel, nothing more, like suggested by some customers reviews who rated like me the stay (I  just reported directly to the hotel, answering to their feedback request, the detail of the problems we faced).

title: A bit disappointed
text: Sorry, but I had great expectations for The James. Mid-century modern at its best, but rooms, although I stayed in a quite large one, they really didn't nailed layout: there was a large void in the middle that didn't serve any purpose, a very small 'dining' table and insufficient storage for clothing, in my humble opinion. It would have been good to see a rug and some other furniture to better dress-up the very generous space. The bathroom was quite nice and pretty much the feature in the room. The lobby, rooftop and restaurant were also great, which is always a plus. I would say 4.5 stars!

title: Excellent
text:
Nous sommes une famille avec deux enfants et tout était vraiment parfait.
Nous recommandons vivement cet hôtel. Emplacement, propreté, literie, décoration des chambres, insonorisation, qualité du service et du personnel tout était parfait.

title: Great weekend stay
text:
Great stay. Comfortable rooms. 
Good location for Midtown 
Would stay again. Only issue was water pressure in shower. 
Otherwise 4.5/5. 
Would recommend and stay again. The service was excellent. And even checking out was very easy.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: Well provisioned, well kept. Some issues with cleanliness in the bathrooms. Staff were very friendly. Room and funishings felt very comfortable.Room and bathroom size was nice for NY. Location is good - good choices for dining, easy to get to transportation, lots of taxis around.

title: I don’t know why I tried this place again...
text:
I stayed here before and had a bad experience but after reading some of the other reviews thought it was just a one off. It wasn’t. 

The entrance to the lobby is up a small flight of stairs. Difficult when you are bringing in heavy luggage. 

The room itself was very tiny. 

Internet was very slow making it difficult to work. 

Room service options were extremely limited. 

The gym/fitness center did have a couple peloton bikes, but the space itself is really cramped and warm, feeling claustrophobic. 

The bathroom was worst part. The shower head were the water comes was filthy and the vanity has a large stone sink which looks cool but allows no space for any of your toiletries. 

I found out later that a colleague of mine recently stayed here and found rat droppings in her room. They moved her but then did not block the room so another guest ended up walking in on her in the middle of the night.

This place does not feel safe or comfortable to me. I was I. NY for work and could not relax here

title: Perfetto
text:
Siamo stati 8 giorni in questo hotel a New York. Hotel elegante, posizione, servizi, camere e staff molto buoni; abbiamo dovuto gestire un piccolo problema di salute che X fortuna si è risolto velocemente e lo staff alla reception si è dimostrato molto attento a fornirci tutte le informazioni utili. Camera X 4 molto ampia e per nulla rumorosa. La posizione molto comoda permette di arrivare a tutte le attrazioni al max in 15 minuti di taxi. Un po’ alte le tasse... ma comunque meno di altri hotel della stessa categoria. 
Un ottimo indirizzo a Ny!

title: Excellent hotel in great location
text: Up and coming area near Empire State Building with nearby subways to everywhere.  Lots of good food choices within a block or two. Hotel is comfortable and the mattresses are terrific.  Quiet and friendly.

title: Great hotel
text: Large modern room with an excellent restaurant. Great price point. Well located.  We walked everywhere. Down side - resort fee if $35. High for what they give you. But I guess it’s nyc. Value of the room is good.

title: Sanctuary at the heart of NYC
text:
My partner - who was celebrating his fiftieth birthday - and I were lucky enough to stay at the James, NOMAD at the end of July / beginning of August 2019. We booked as part of a Virgin Holidays package, which included flights and transfers. 

We received a warm welcome on arrival at the James and were upgraded to a larger room by the receptionist when we mentioned it was my partner's first time in NYC. We'd had a long trip and it was really nice to have such a great welcome. The room was much bigger than I'd ever had in a NYC hotel and it was immaculately clean (like the rest of the hotel). The furnishings were quirky, without being ridiculous, and there was plenty of hanging and storage space. 

The bathroom, as well as containing the largest sink either of us had ever seen, was functional with a hot, powerful shower. The complimentary products were superb quality and, as someone who is trying to reduce my plastic footprint, I was pleased to see the large bottles, which could be refilled. 

The hotel offers coffee and fruit in the mornings alongside a free wine and cheese event every evening from 5pm to 6pm. On Wednesday, the wine and cheese comes with a side-order of live music; a brilliant way to relax before a night out. Although neither the wine nor cheese were particularly to my taste, others were certainly enjoying them. Perhaps the hotel could look at their use of single-use cups to help reduce their plastic footprint further? 

All of the staff were friendly and efficient. Reception were happy to help with our transfer when we were having some phone-related issues and the guys on the front desk were helpful and always had a quip. Great service from everyone - congratulations!

My partner and I didn't make use of either the hotel bar or restaurant - with so many options on the doorstep, we just didn't get the chance! However, they were certainly busy whenever we were coming back to the hotel in the evening - not that we would have known from our room, which despite overlooking the road was almost sound-proofed. We had great wi-fi connectivity in the room and in the lobby, and the wide-range of channels on the TV system was much appreciated. 

Thank you to everyone at the James for making our stay such a great one - can't wait to do it again!

title: Nice but So so
text: Room 507 has a broken seal on window which allows the traffic noise.  The windows were also really dirty. We enjoyed the wine happy hour and coffee in the morning. Design and aesthetics of the hotel are really nice - which is one reason we booked. Booking directly through hotel vs. 3rd party really didn't have any perks as indicated on website.  Having stayed at the James in Chicago years ago, this experience was just ok and not what we remembered from the James in Chicago. Perhaps this hotel is meant for business and not families.

title: Assessment of Hotel
text:
Registration of Displeasure with Staff
I was quite uncomfortable with the way I was recieved on my arrival day and the day afterward by some of the front desk staff. I thought that the could have been more welcoming and reassuring of the fact that I could have a place to stay on a cold night and sort my payment out later with my inactive debit card. Quite a harrowing experience.  Pertinent questions on how much the card was worth were embarrassing.  They can do better because they do not know the real calibre of gusts who come in. Some may be worth more than they can imagine.

title: Great place
text: Very nice hotel. Clean comfortable rooms. Friendly staff. Great location.  WiFi good.  Really, no complaints at all.  Highly recommend this hotel. Rates are reasonable for a hotel of this quality.  There are many excellent restaurants in the area.

title: Central location but quiet hotel. Perfect for our 5 night stay as a couple in NYC.
text:
This review is based on my 5 night stay here with my husband in the Guestroom with King Bed in June 2019. 

--GETTING THERE & LOCATION-- 
The hotel is a 45min Uber ride from JFK Airport for us but it's very easily accessible via Subway also (11min walk from Penn Station and 15min walk from Grand Central). 

On top of that, it's walking distance from some of the main attractions we wanted to see. It was our first time in NYC so this was quite important for us! The landmarks nearby are: The Flatiron Building & Union Square, Madison Square Park, Macy’s Herald Square, Empire State Building and Top of the Rock NYC. 

It's also surrounded by a lot of cafes, restaurants, pubs and convenience stores. A lot of them were open late night which really helped because we were extremely jetlagged and awake until about 3am most days! 

-- THE HOTEL ROOM-- 
We stayed in the Guest Room with a King Bed which was surprisingly quiet (we thought it would be much busier in Manhattan). The room was comfortable, clean and spacious room and we kind of felt like we had just moved into our very own NYC apartment haha.

There were also all the hotel amenities we needed: body and skincare products, strong WiFi, stocked mini bar and pantry, hotel robe and slippers, ironing facilities, hair dryer, in-room safe, in-room dining, bed head USB ports, air conditioner, TV. No complaints there! 

-- DINING & RESTAURANTS -- 
There are three dining options available at the hotel:

- Scarpetta: Italian Restaurant open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Although we didn’t dine here, this seemed to be quite busy at most hours of the day and had great reviews online.
- The Seville: This is a classic NYC style cocktail lounge and a hotspot on the weekend. It’s open from 4pm till late night and there is a bar menu available also. Cocktails are great!
- In-room Dining: There’s a breakfast, lunch, dinner and kids menu available for in-room dining. But to be honest there were so many food options around the hotel that we didn’t get to order any in-room food. I guess this does come in handy for any lazy nights when you just feel like curling up in the comfort of your bed though. 

In the lounge area (located at the lobby) there is also free coffee, tea, fruit infused water and fruit available every hour.

On our check-out day we had a very early flight so it was very convenient to be able to grab a coffee and a snack on the go.

There is also a wine tour available daily in the late afternoon that we wish we had time to experience (maybe next time!)

-- ACTIVITIES & WELLNESS --
There are also a few different wellness activities:

- Boxing Class: This was hosted at a local Throwdown Boxing Studio every Wednesday morning at 8am and is complimentary for guests if you make a reservation at the front desk.
Yoga Class: This was hosted with Yoga Spark and runs every Sunday from 10:30am-11:30am. Guests are required to make a reservation at the front desk.
24 Hour Fitness Centre: The gym is open 24/7 for guests.
- In-room Massage: We didn’t get to take advantage of this but the hotel also offers same-day in-room massages upon request also.

-- SUMMARY -- 
Overall, this hotel was very comfortable, spacious, easily accessible with reliable customer service and all the hotel amenities we needed. We settled in very well into our hotel room and would have happily extended our stay if we needed to.

If you’re looking for somewhere with a central location that isn’t buzzing with the sounds from the busy streets, this is a great option and highly recommended for couples, families and business travellers too (there are meeting & conference rooms available also).

title: Great stat with family.
text: Quiet, clean, water/coffee/fruit in the AM, nice wine and cheese daily, 2 blocks from subway, friendly staff, willing to hold our bags even after we checked out, had a late checkin which was no problem, safe neighborhood, room a nice size, wish fridge was a bit bigger. Came with 2 teen sons and they liked it. Cozy lobby, greeted by staff when we would come in each day

title: Be Very Cautious.
text: The location was great, exactly where I needed to be.  The room was comfortable and clean. The free wifi is so slow that it is not functional.  The quoted rate changed and was blamed on the new management. If you go to the Seville watch out for double billing.

title: Great hotel
text:
My girlfriend booked me a trip to New York for my 40th birthday via Virgin Holidays, and chose the St James Hotel Nomad for us to stay in due to the location (it's right around the corner from the Empire State Building). 

When we arrived, the Virgin Rep had told them it was my 40th birthday present and we were upgraded to a bigger room. The room was lovely, clean and as it was high up in the hotel, we could barely hear any noise from the street below.

There was free coffee and fruit every morning in the lounge and free cheese and wine in the evening where you could sit and enjoy the view below!

We'd definitely stay at this hotel again on our next trip to New York.

title: Great location and stay for business
text:
After trying to find a location close to work and walking distance to other likable haunts, think I've finally found a good one.
After a 1st try in Jan'19 the 2nd stay was just as excellent. 

Only downside which is proving pretty major - Still pending the invoice from the July stay. When checking out concierge made it apparent that the printer was not working and that I could get the invoice via the online contact form. After almost a month still pending that invoice.
Since it was a business trip should not need to explain the importance of such a document being made available in a timely manner. Unless this is rectified quickly guess I'll need to resume my search for a home away from home in NY.

title: Review
text: Cell phone bars were non-existent in my room, internet was spotty.  Free internet in the lobby worked well.  Overall, the room was gorgeous and the staff very helpful.  Great view.  Coffee is in the lobby only until 9am!

title: Business Trip!
text: Super great stay here, awesome location and the staff was excellent. Definitely would stay again. They have a wine hour thats from 5-6 each night where they offer wine and cheese, super cute and appreciated way to get everyone into the lobby! The maids were so sweet.

title: Disappointing stay
text:
The James has promise but failed to deliver.  Good location for subway and tourist attractions. Staff were friendly and helpful. There was a good selection of minibar items for sale. The resort fee covered continental breakfast, 1 soda or snack per day and wifi.

Breakfast offerings were very limited and the one day when I bothered to wake up in time for it (ended at 9 am) the only choices available were coffee, hot water for tea and whole oranges. I was not inspired to bother with this thereafter. Cold bottled water was available in the rooms but you had to phone housekeeping for this even though there was a mini bar.

The free wifi was poor and could only cope with basic tasks like email & WhatsApp. Even the paid wifi was not adequate to download videos.

The rooms were not inspiring either. We were upgraded from queen rooms to king rooms which was a bonus. Despite this, the rooms felt cramped. There was only a small wardrobe with 2 drawers and a small circular table with a single dining style chair.  Housekeeping did not bother to replace the body wash until I made a formal request to reception. The bathroom was relatively small, the toilet seat wobbled and the bathroom extractor fan was very noisy. 

I was glad we only stayed 3 nights and would not want to return.

title: All is well at the James Nomad Hotel
text:
Clean and spacious rooms. Comfortable beds. Surprisingly quit rooms for Manhattan. Courteous and highly professional staff, clearly committed to providing quality and results- orientated service.
Rapist and reliable same day laundry services.

title: Great Service, Room, and Location
text: We are former NYC dwellers but live in San Francisco now and visit often to see friends and family.  We wanted to try out a new hotel and are so glad we did.  From the moment we walked in we were greeted by friendly staff willing to assist us with both our bags and with check-in.  We just flew in from Europe so we’re feeling tired and hoping to check-in early so we could rest.  We were so happy when without even having to request it we were quickly given our keys and allowed to go up to our room.  I had booked one of their James suites and it did not disappoint.  The size of the room was like having our own apartment and we both commented that we felt like we were living in NYC again if only for a night. Although the building itself is older and the windows not as sound proofed as they are in other places the noise at night was not noticeable and we were able to sleep well in the very comfortable king size bed.  There is a wine hour in the late afternoon but we did not partake in it since we were napping. There is no coffee in the room but I was able to go to the lobby in the morning to grab some and it was good.  They also had tea and fruit infused water as well as fresh fruit to grab and go.  What made this hotel really stand out for me was the friendly and helpful staff.  Everyone we met had a smile on his or her face from the bell hop to the front desk to the managers and housekeeping! We were so appreciative of the early check-in and late check-out.  No doubt we have found our new go to hotel when we visit NYC 👍😊

title: Close to many attractions
text:
The James Hotel Nomad is located in a quiet street and within walking distance to many attractions: Empire State Building, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Top of the Rocks,etc. 
We would again chose this hotel if we come back to NYC.

title: Omg so small
text: This room is the smallest room for the price I’ve ever stayed in. It’s fine but why is it worse than my college dorm room? It also smelled as if someone had smoked in the room at some point. Like I think it’s like 10x10. I’ve stayed in way better places for the price 3-4x the size. Yuck.

title: Avoid rooms ending in 10 or 11
text:
We had a very good stay at the James Nomad. However, our first night was in a room right across the elevator (room 510 or 511).  There are similar rooms across the elevator at every floor.  There is no privacy in those rooms. You can hear people chit-chatting while waiting for the elevator as if they were in your room.  And…yes, they can hear you too if you are talking.  The soundproofing of the doors is really, really bad.
I am also not convinced about the benefits from the extra “facility fee” of $35.   It is nice to have coffee and fruits in the morning but the wine at night is not that good and, often, we are not back at the hotel when happy hour ends. 
And obviously there is no coffee provided in the room.
The AC works fine but the shower is terribly weak.

title: Beware upgrade blackmail!
text: I'd stayed there four times before this trip and always found it somewhere between ok and even very nice. This time I had a king room booked for $350. I chose not to accept the many absurdly-priced upgrades they offered me by email a few days before I checked in (upper floor, view, etc). So what did I get? A dark room on the 3rd floor on the inside of the building right on top of a noisy ventilation shaft that blew all night. I barely slept. I'll never stay there again. Oh, and the front desk staff are indifferent and arrogant.

title: Nice hotel but had some problems
text: Had high hopes for this hotel but unfortunately had some issues.  Cute hotel, decent location.  Minor outdates (e.g., small chipped tiles in the bathroom) but overall nice and chic.  Main issue - we were there during a heat wave - our A/C barely worked, my family was sweating in our room.  I assumed it was just so hot that the A/C couldn't keep up, but on our last night, a staff member stopping by noticed how hot it was and suggested Engineering check our A/C.  Long story short - they moved us to a new room which was bliss!  I was appreciative but couldn't believe we suffered in the hot room almost the entire stay (housekeeping didn't notice the hot room?). I didn't really expect credit for the sweaty days & nights, but at the same time I was surprised nothing was offered (complimentary cocktails or cold drinks?).  The next day when we were leaving, a pair of my shoes were missing.  Looked everywhere in the room, had Housekeeping check the old room - no luck. I spoke to the Manager and explained (calmly) that if the A/C had worked, we wouldn't have had to change rooms and my shoes wouldn't have gotten lost in the transfer.  He was polite but only offered to take my contact info in the event they should turn up.  Again, no offer to reimburse the cost of the shoes or any other accommodation.  It was overall a lovely hotel but between sweating profusely in our room and a pair of shoes lost, I don't think I would stay at this hotel again.  Otherwise would give 4 of 5 stars.

title: Fabulous Hotel - Great staff
text: I have been very fortunate to have visited New York several times and this hotel is one the best I’ve stayed at for several reasons, mainly the staff who have been so we trained and versed in customer service from the staff that attended to our room to the man who topped up the water in the main reception they all spoke and offered help and assistance. Great service , great location a very good fine I shall be back.

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
Stayed here with 3 friends for a
week in June 2019.  I have visited NYC a few times now, fortunate enough to say in 5 star hotels. This hotel is in a great location and amazingly quiet.  The suite we had with adjoining rooms were wonderful and so spacious, for rooms in this great city.  We ate at the restaurant and this too was great.  Staff very helpful throughout the hotel.  God willing, we will return.  Thank you so much to the staff The James Nomad, for such a great visit.

title: Quiet, great location, comfortable bed, strong wifi, and pleasant staff
text:
I stayed two nights here while in town on business. I rarely stay in hotels since my family prefers vacation rentals for more space when we travel, but I needed something close to several Midtown meeting sites and this fit the bill. I loved the James New York - NoMad's location. I walked everywhere I needed to be.

Plus, the hotel itself is very quiet, despite being in a very loud and urban area. I occasionally hear police sirens, but other than that, it's quieter than many small city hotels I've stayed in.

I did not partake in the morning coffee/fruits, as I stayed on California time and didn't get up until 9 am, and they only offer it 6:30-8:30 am. I had work events but I did stop by one afternoon and saw the large cheese platter and bottles of white wine. There was also a large dispenser of "spa water" but I did not try it.

In the room itself, the wardrobe is a bit tight (I brought 3 dresses and had to squeeze them into the narrow left side for long items). The cool retro mini-fridge had an array of expensive treats ($10 water bottle!). When I checked in, the front desk clerk told me I could have one item for free, a snack or non-alcoholic beverage, so I grabbed the giant $10 bottle of water. I haven't checked out yet, so let's hope I understood him correctly and I don't get charged $10!

I normally prefer King beds, but since I was alone, the queen was more than sufficient. The bed was dressed with nice linens and a down comforter duvet, too. The room also has its own thermostat and the unit was relatively quiet. The fancy lighting system took me a minute to figure out. I also couldn't figure out why the ceiling light fixture over the table turned itself on at 9 am every day. Good thing I brought an eye mask!

Note that the light switches for the tiny bathroom are BEHIND the giant barn door. I spent a good 2 minutes walking in and out of the bathroom trying to find the switches and almost called the front desk. You have to completely close the barn door, turn on the lights, and then completely open them again. That's not very intuitive at all! 

Yes, it's small but it's NYC. A spacious hotel room here would cost twice as much (or maybe 3 times?). I was in room 403, at the end of the hallway, For one person, there's plenty of space to walk, put down a suitcase, and even do a little yoga or martial arts routines. See photos! I will say it's too bad my room overlooked AC ventilation ducts on the roof.

I did work from my home one afternoon and the WiFi is strong. I also was able to print a boarding pass downstairs in the lobby computer workstation/printer.

Finally, the staff were uniformly helpful and pleasant. I had Caviar deliver some food from Russ & Daughters and they refrigerated it for me while I was at a work event. I otherwise wouldn't have had time to go there so I was thrilled to have some great smoked salmon, sturgeon, and sable while here.

I'd definitely return to this hotel the next time I had business in Midtown.

title: 4 comfortable, enjoyable nights!
text:
Just returned from a 4 night stay here. I would recommend this hotel. The staff were always friendly and helpful , the whole vibe of the hotel is kind of 5 star! The cold fruit water and fresh fruit was a bonus. Location is good, 3 minute walk to 5th Avenue. Room was a good size for NY hotel room and beds were probably the most comfortable I've ever slept on at a hotel. Bathroom was kinda poky but useable. 
We had a bedside lamp missing from the wall but that didn't really bother us. 
Foyer was cool and funky. 
The ordered us a car for the airport and recommend a fab pizza take out and had it delivered to the room.
I liked it there!

title: Cool, hip hotel. Excellent location.  Friendly staff.
text: Enjoyed our stay here very much!  Small but sufficient sized room for NYC.  Modern and artsy decor.  Free water and fruit all day.  Wine and cheese happy hour (get there fast, people from all parts of the world love cheese).  Morning coffee was free but watery and sometimes only lukewarm.  Much better off trying out local coffee down any block in any direction.  Nice little gym.  Comfy and chic seating in the lobby with free wifi.  Bell hops and doormen were all courteous and helpful.  Only set back was that my daughter found huge cracker crumbs and toenail clippings right under the nightstand.  We asked the front desk staff 2 times to send a maid to vacuum again but they either never did or the maid did not bother to check under the night stand as we'd requested.  The desk staff was very courteous and even offered to switch us to a neighboring room, which we declined.  Despite this one disappoint I would still recommend this hotel to others.  My husband was in love with the vintage bar table that confined our mini fridge.  Where do we buy one just like it?!

title: Nice 5 nights honeymoon stay.
text:
The hotel is in a great location and easy walk to most tourist places.

Check in and out was great even the bell boy not leaving until you tip him made us laugh. Be aware the USA tip everything. 

Room was big but not much space to hang cloths or draw space. Shower was powerful and hot. Tv was massive. Mini bar was in room but expensive so be warned. Would of liked coffee and tea in room. Room was a little dirty Hoovering and dusting around. The view was to the back of the building air vents which was so disappointing and noisy. As a suite we would of thought it was much better. Nothing for our honeymoon though, even though it was on the booking with virgin. 

Was a little disappointed with the wine and cheese, bit of a free for all and wine in plastic cups doesn’t do it for me sorry. It was free though and I’m sure everyone who isn’t residents come in too.

The hotel got us a taxi back to JFK which was a great touch and a loverly driver. 

Freshwater in lobby was nice to fill up your bottles instead of paying a $4 for a small bottle.

We would stay again if price was right. if I could give 3/4 stars I would of.

title: Great hotel, great location
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights with my wife whilst visiting NYC. Great location, very clean hotel, amazing comfortable beds. 
Rooms are a little small, but I guess this is par for the course in NYC. 
Enjoyed the complimentary cheese and wine each evening before dinner. 
We had thought there was free coffee and pastries each morning, but this was just apples and oranges. The free coffee was good though. 
Found the on-site eating options quite limited, as the Scarpetta restaurant was a little too high class for what we needed and the bar food menu too limited for our taste. 
Other than that, enjoyed our stay. I’d recommend this hotel despite these small issues.

title: Amazing hotel, amazing service
text:
Our family stayed at The James Nomad while attending our daughter’s wedding. We had booked 6 rooms and were checking in and out of different rooms over our stay to accommodate the bridal party and the bride in wedding preparations.
I must commend the front desk staff, especially Glen. Nothing seemed to be a bother, even with all our requests. The staff, from the valet, the bellhop, the front desk and housekeeping were all friendly and very helpful.
The rooms were very clean and fresh with nice fluffy towels. More closet space would have helped though.
We never had to wait for an elevator which was a bonus. The comfortable lobby was ideal for gathering with family and the wine and cheese hour in the evening was a lovely touch.
The location in Midtown is perfect for restaurants, shopping and subways.
We rented the hotel’s lounge “The Seville” for a private party. Again the staff and service was excellent.
Thank you for the room upgrade, which was awesome, and for accommodating our extra night.
This is my new ‘go to’ hotel when visiting New York.
I would definitely recommend this hotel, especially for couples.

title: Perfect for a family of four
text:
The James Hotel was our saving grace after an Airbnb host cancelled on us a week before our travel dates. I selected this hotel as one suite option offered two bathrooms which is critical for my family and I. Upon arrival, I was nervous because we arrived later than anticipated and our room was not ready. We were tired and hungry, but thankfully only waited about 10-15 minutes. We were assigned The Jimmy Suite (room 1412) which is a lovely corner suite and for 475 square feet, it felt surprisingly spacious. What we loved most was the decor and the 2 bathrooms. That alone makes this an ideal hotel for a traveling family of 4. The Midtown location is great - we walked everywhere for our basic necessities and with the subway station being a short walk away, it was a great location for our home base. The front door concierge was EXCEPTIONAL. They offered food suggestions and arranged our ride to the airport. We were always greeted with a smile by members of the staff and received a welcome bottle of wine,  chocolates for us, and gummy bears for our children. Lastly, the beds are incredible. All four of us slept in every single day. 

I only have two critiques for this establishment. Our suite had small flying insects everyday. I believe it is because there is a plant in the room. Though lovely, tiny insects like that tend to call plants home and with the minimal decor, a plant really isn't needed. 

Also, a tiny thing about housekeeping. On our first day we noticed a card about housekeeping only replacing towels on the floors which we support as we wish to conserve resources. No matter what we did, our towels were replaced daily unnecessarily. We didn't want to be wasteful. One day, we had new towels with false eyelashes stuck to them. Lastly, we tried to tip housekeeping daily and they never took the tip until we left a note insisting that they take it. I don't know if not receiving tips is a New York thing, but that was odd. Finally, full sized bath products are advertised, and photos are body wash are in the advertisements, but there is no body wash. 

All in all, this was a great stay and we will stay here again when we travel as a family.

title: Visit 4 nights june 2019
text:
Our stay at this hotel was excellent and in particular mr Glen Roy Brown at  frontdesk has been very useful .
Housekeeping was also very efficient with mrs Ratchkov Rima who helped us
The hotel is well placed and we could easily enjoy the parade on 30th june.
We will certainly come back

title: Very good, Great Service
text: Both staff and hotel room and amenities were excellent. Would like ti visit again. The bad about price wise it should offer at least breakfast and not charge it $40. City hotel on Madison and close to 5th Ave and within walking from the Empire State Building.

title: Just Perfection
text:
This is now the 3rd time I have stayed at this hotel and each time it just gets better.
Stayed for World Pride with 2 friends and now continuing my stay for another 5 nights alone.
Staff could not be more helpful and relaxed. 
Hotel is perfectly situated just off the tourist path but so easy to get to uptown/downtown and east/west sides.
Will certainly be back again next year!!

title: Great location
text: Stayed 2 nights. Mattress could have been firmer. Staff was OK. Fitness room was small, but otherwise complete for a hotel. Location is perfect. Nice tea and coffee in the mornings and cheese and wine in the evening at no additional cost.

title: Excellent location, outstanding service
text:
We have stayed at this property before. During our five day stay we wanted to thank Joseph for his helpful service as a bellman. He provided extraordinary help w/ luggage, directions, locations of restaurants, shops & all around NY questions.  We noticed he was especially kind to children of all ages, even speaking to one this morning about how he opens door & what he says to a guest. It was very cute.

We also wanted to thank & praise Guadalupe at the front desk. She made the check in process for our family, needing three rooms, so simple. Everyone arrived on different flights & at different times.  Guadalupe was able to put everyone on the same floor. She was always ready to answer questions with a smile & promoted dignified laughter w/ all guests. 

It has been a pleasure to stay w/ you and we plan to return again soon.

title: Hotel en New York
text: El hotel muy lindo , habitación espléndida y ubicación super buena, cerca de todo. Nos hospedamos por 9 días, se puede ir caminando a asi todos lados. Hay cerca estaciones de metro. Tiene un servicio de te y café a a mañana y una copa de vino a la tarde. Hermosa la infraestructura y fantástica la amabilidad en la recepcion.

title: Anbefales på det varmeste.
text:
Nydelig hotell midt i NY.
God standard, hyggelig og hjelpsom personale. Ble oppgradert uten ekstra kostnad når vi ankom. Tilbragte tre netter her, veldig fornøyd med rommene. God plass, behagelige senger, fin utsikt. Gratis snacks i minibaren hver dag. Rent og pent. 
Selv om det kostet en del pr natt, ser vi at vi fikk mye for pengene, sammenlignet med andre hoteller i området.
Kunne absolutt bodd her igjen.

title: Mixed review from me.
text:
I booked this hotel for two nights, two rooms for two couples May 2019.

We arrived early and before check-in time after finishing our cruise, we each had carry on luggage and a suitcase.  We arrived by taxi and there are about half dozen steps to the hotel door, the concierge kindly opened the door for us at the top but didn’t bother to help any of us with a bag or suitcase.  

Check-in (early) reception staff, very helpful staff allocated us our rooms, gave us a run down of what was included, cheese and wine in the evening, coffee in the morning, one free non-alcoholic item each day from the mini bar, wifi details etc., (might be helpful for a little list, as we had to ask again later for timings).

Room – Double Queen – When I booked the hotel having read the reviews I knew that the rooms were compact/small but thought that we were mainly in New York to see New York and not spend too much time in the hotel.  The room was small and very dimly lit, had to open the blinds to get some light into the room which opens up the fact that your rooms are overlooked (back of hotel) so be mindful of others being able to see you!!  

There is literally no-where to put anything (a small wardrobe in the corner of the room and a coffee table) we used the coffee table as a dumping ground and lived out of our suitcase for the days we were there. Inside the wardrobe – dressing gown, slippers, iron and ironing board, maybe room to hand a few items. 

The bathroom, lighting very poor, complementary shampoo/body lotion etc., however we didn’t need to use them as we had our own. Again not much room to place your toothbrush and toiletries.  Shower power – excellent.  Good selection of towels including face cloth.

Hairdryer – which I found in a drawer in the bathroom.  Using the hairdryer was an uncomfortable experience. No plug socket near a mirror, lead on the hairdryer very short, I ended up sat on the floor in-between the bed and room door, I had the wardrobe door propped open with my suitcase at the other end of the room which had a mirror inside, and felt like I was playing peek-a-boo just to get my hair dried. FARCE. Appreciate the building is old and maybe wasn’t originally built as a hotel, a bit of planning/designing would have given some customer comfort.

Bed – The comfiest bed I have ever slept in, in a hotel. Bedding and Pillows great. What a great night’s sleep!! 

Room information pack – couldn’t find it. Would have helped with remembering the rules and times of the services.

Our room was cleaned and were given fresh towels, which was unexpected.

Free Coffee in the Morning – At the reception seating area - A good opportunity for a quick drink in a paper cup, whilst waiting for your fellow travellers/taxi. Coffee/Tea/Apples available.

We didn’t use the cheese and wine service as per out exploring.

Location – The hotel is in a fabulous location for getting about and sight-seeing, we walked, used Lyft and Uber to explore Manhattan. Didn’t hear any noise from outside.

Check-Out – I had emailed the hotel before we travelled to get the check-out time (to help with sight-seeing and airport taxi planning) and were emailed 2pm. However, at the hotel we were told 12 noon and were not flexible even though I had the email. On check-out we were told nothing to pay (we had pre-paid).  Again, no help from the concierge with our bags to our taxi.

Customer Services on our return home – website – One Good, One Bad.  When both couples returned home we checked our credit cards, we had both had charges on our accounts. I would assume it was for the one non-alcoholic item from the mini bar, (one water, one cola). 

Couple one – full refund within 24 hours. 
Couple two (me)  - Automatic responses, promise from the web team our query would be dealt with by accounts. We got completely ignored – in the end we disputed the transaction through our credit card company, had to have new credit cards issued and the issue was resolved by our credit card company. Still no response from the hotel, thanks for the inconvenience). 

Overall the hotel was as expected, a few disappointing aspects, but a great location and slept in a comfy bed after a really busy day of sightseeing!!  

Would I book again? - NO
Would I recommend? – If you’re not fussy – perhaps just for the bed and location….

title: good stay
text: room was comfortable.  shower had poor design where you have to get wet immediately when you turn on the water because there is no way to stand on the side.  but otherwise was hot with good water pressure.  Roman the valet parker went above and beyond.  he was great.  would stay again

title: Amazing Stay & Good Location
text:
Everyone at reception was friendly and welcoming. The room was clean and roomy for a New York hotel. It looked just like the photos as advertised on the website. I ended checking out a little earlier than expected and was able to receive a refund for the night that I didn't stay (which was really great!) I was prepared to not to have that money back. 
Great stay, as this was my second time in New York City but first time in this hotel. Will definitely come back.

title: Comfortable, clean and stylish hotel
text: I stayed at The James for 5 nights while in NYC on business. I really liked the décor of the room, particularly the marble sink. The bed was so comfortable and I slept so well. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. It was great I could use the printer complimentary. I particularly have to thank the valet Joseph, who really helped me when I was struggling to get a taxi to JFK during rush hour and he managed to sort me a driver within a short amount of time. I didn't have enough money for a decent tip, which I regret, but he really deserved more. The location was brilliant - so close to Empire State and Flatiron. Was nice to be able to walk to nearby Murray Hill for more a locals experience of NYC.

title: Outstanding service
text: We recently stayed at the James Hotel in NoMad for the third time.  We’ve also stayed at the James in SoHo a couple times. We love both locations and the boutique nature of the hotels. And the complimentary wine each evening. And the consistently outstanding service.  On this particular visit, my wife had the misfortune of twisting her foot on uneven pavement in the Theater District and had trouble walking. Both Roman, the Bell Captain, and Daniel, the Hotel Manager, went out of their way to make her comfortable, arrange for a wheelchair and help her in and out of the hotel. Highly recommend and will return.

title: Great Hotel!
text: This is our second time staying at The James Hotel. It is a great hotel...rooms incredible with all amenities and outlets needed! Staff helpful and respond quickly to requests. We love the location and we will stay here again!

title: Amazing!!
text:
My partner booked a long weekend in NYC for a birthday present staying at The James, upon arrival the staff were warm and welcoming informing us that coffee was served in the mornings and at 5pm they had cheese and wine in the very elegant reception/lobby area.
Given our room keys (2) we were asked if we needed help with our bags which we didn't so we made our way to our room 732 it had a huge king size bed and walk in shower, beware the mini bar lol it's expensive but that's nothing unusual, we opted to get a few bit from a nearby market.
The metro cards are well worth their money we paid 33 dollars and at 2.75 a ride we more that got our monies worth, the subway was essential in getting around so download the sub app.
Comfy shoes are a must we averaged 23 to 30 thousands steps a day with subway rides. 
The hotel is spotless and situated conveniently around the corner from 28th station for getting around. The cleaners came daily and replenished towels and cleaned room there is a safe in the wardrobe and many USB charging points throughout the room.
The lifts from the lobby can only be activated after swiping your room key cards to go up. Its fantastically located in midtown Manhattan and the staff were all brilliant, checkout was 12 but upon asking at reception we got to keep our room til 2 which was fab, we made our own way back to JFK by subway and air rail so our hour wait to set off in the hotel waiting area was more than comfortable with cooled lemon water on tap and fresh fruit to snack on watching the world go by through the large windows was a lovely chilled way to end our time on the big apple. You won't regret choosing this hotel.

title: Centrally located, but very noisy.
text:
We spent 4 nights at the James NoMad Hotel.
The good thing is: the hotel is very centrally located. So you can explore the neighbourhood by foot easily. As well the room (double queen) was spacious. The lobby area is nicely designed and the restaurant - we didn't eat there - seems to be very popular.

On the down side we must say, that the hotel is not really 4-star in every way. There was only a very small cupboard to hang some clothes, the bathroom was tiny and the windows were in a bad condition (therefore the room was quite noisy and cold at night - airconditioning/heating was doing a lot of noise).

However, over all we would recommend the hotel for a city trip.

title: Amazing New York Hotel
text:
I booked The James Nomad for my parents trip to New York back in March, and they loved it. They said that the staff were super friendly and helpful, beautiful rooms, perfect location and they loved the cheese and wine hour each afternoon. And they absolutely LOVED that restaurant Scarpetta is located in the hotel.
