They have been recommending the hotel to all their friends and even to my friends, they will definitely be staying with you again.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
We visited the James Nomad and stayed for 4 nights in a Deluxe Queen room which was spacious and very comfortable.
The service was faultless with a special mention to Ashraf the Bellman who was very attentive and the Manager who kindly organised our return transport to the airport.
Would highly recommend and love to return one day!

title: Great Service as always
text: Another fine stay at the James Nomad. Clean room, wonderful staff. Special shout out to doorman/bellman Joe! What a great guy! Super friendly, and always goes the distance for you, whether jumping out to hail a cab, or surprising our new college graduate with a nice token of congratulations.

title: Love The James NoMad, worth giving up Marriott points to stay there!
text: I used to stay at The James when it was The Carlton and part of Marriott Autograph Collection.  Last night I decided to check it out even though I was forgoing Marriott points.  I'm a very frequent traveler and it was one of the best hotel experiences I have had in years.  When I arrived I was thrilled to see the same front desk staff that previously took great care of me (Philip, Hector, Doony), my upgraded room was fabulous, the hotel lobby is beautiful and comfortable and serves coffee in the morning, the speakeasy bar in the lower level beautiful and fun, the fitness center equipment was upgraded and I plan to stay there again on my next trip to NYC.  Great experience, can't wait to return.

title: Wonderful hotel in great location
text: This is a lovely, Mid Town hotel.  Front desk staff was reasonably friendly.  There's wine and cheese tasting every evening which was nice.  The first room we were given was literally so small that we couldn't fully open our suitcase.  It would have been fine if we had packed light but we had a large suitcase so it really didn't work.  We asked for a larger room and were given one which was very spacious, even by NYC standards.  The room decor was sort of funky mid-century eclectic.  Architecture is great.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: Amazing service - thank you!
text: New York Life suggested that we stay here and GUS PARK, KENT and their team did not disappoint. I had items sent ahead of time and they arrived without fail. My husband and I extended our stay for pleasure and everyone went out of their way to make this a special trip. We can’t wait to visit your AWESOME hotel again! 💯🤩💯

title: Comfortable and clean
text:
Spent a weekend at The James while travelling to New York for a wedding at the beginning of May with my boyfriend. When we arrived, there was an issue with room availability, and multiple patrons were having issues checking into their suites. As we had events planned for the wedding, receiving our room past 4 pm was extremely problematic. As a solution, guest services decided to put us in a room that resembled a prison. It was a guest suite that we did not pay for, and was actually quite horrible. When we complained, Alexander was wonderful and set us up in a much better room.  We were extremely grateful for Alexander's services. 

Overall, the room was very clean, with a modernized bathroom design. Aside from the cleanliness, the bed was very comfortable and I heard minimal noise from other guests (which was very much appreciated). One thing to mention is the stairs: I am not a fan of elevators, and the stairs are a lot if you are above the 5th floor. For a busy weekend filled with family events - this hotel served our purposes.

title: NoMad does not mean it’s related to THE NoMad Hotel
text: Slightly caught out here. I missed the fact that the area is called NoMad. Having previously stayed at THE NoMad hotel I foolishly thought this hotel was its sister hotel. Actually it’s nothing to do with THE NoMad. Overall it was ‘OK’. Positives: nice staff, great location, very comfortable bed and good linens. But not a top hotel. We arrived to find we had no towels. They soon arrived. The bathroom was clean (apart from a couple of long hairs on the floor) but not spotless. The body lotion etc was not replenished everyday and to be honest the maid service was a bit erratic (she threw away a small bag of food presumably thinking it was rubbish). On check out I was asked if everything was ok and I hesitated for a second and the charming Gouadalupe asked what was wrong. She instantly offered us a $100 credit to spend in the restaurant. Good recovery - well done, and appreciated.

title: Nurse practitioner
text: My recent visit to The James Hotel York Nomad was great.  The hotel is very clean and well-kept.  The room I stayed in was clean, spacious, and had nice decor.  Bed was quite comfy and did not want to leave.  The staff was  Processional,kind, knowledgeable,and very patient,  especially a staff member  by the name Asante Walker,  whom I had the pleasure of talking to during their wine down hour.  He was very pleasant and provided excellent service. He kept a smile on his face despite the many questions I asked. He knew this hotel like the back of his hands.   Staying at The James Hotel was a refreshing experience.  If you are looking to stay in a hotel with impeccable customer service in a convenient NYC location, choose the Nomad.

title: Excellent location, wonderful service
text: The staff at this hotel is phenomenal...from the managers to room service staff it’s been a great experience. The beds are so comfortable and my husband and I were able to have a date night for the first time in a year by going downstairs to Scarpetta. I highly recommend this hotel and if you need anything...just ask them!

title: Bel hôtel bien situé
text:
Un établissement élégant , literie top!!! L isolation phonique très décevante... on attend bcp de bruits de la rue et des chambres voisines ...
Café et thé offert de 7 à 9h et dégustation de vin et fromage de 17 à 19h
Station de métro à 5 min, empire state à 5 min et flatiron à moins de 10 !!!

title: A jewel of a hotel
text: So on our 8th trip to New York we finally found a hotel we like and that suits us, a real jewel of a place!. Everything is top quality, from the comfortable lobby to the very spacious bedroom with a really good bed. The hotel standards are obviously very high, in terms of cleanliness, service and attention to those little details that make the difference in your stay. Shout out to the super friendly and helpful staff, everything is so obviously well run. We really recommend this hotel and we plan to return next spring.

title: Nice cosy and chic hôtel with super helpfull staff
text: Nice hôtel, brand New commodities, relatively noisy though (simple Window and noisy street.... and a night-club on groundfloor), very Nice staff and a spécial thanks to the concierge José Martinez who’s been very helpful and Kind.

title: Disappointing
text: After my first day at The James, I was willing to let them try to recover their apparently stellar reputation because they acknowledged some problems and went out of their way to ask me how they could make my second day perfect. Unfortunately after promising wine that never materialized and calling FOUR times for a bucket of ice— my experience just got worse.  Room had no view, maids making a ton of noise in the hallway while we were trying to sleep, and at check in, a welcome gift with someone else’s name on it.  So, I can’t say I’d rebook here, even though the location is perfect.  It’s not a mistake that’s the problem, it’s NOT recovering from it that is the problem. Perhaps they just had a busy, overbooked weekend.

title: Another great experience
text: Our tenth visit to this hotel, eight when it was known as The Carlton, two in its current reincarnation as The James - Nomad.  It has been remodeled and upgraded.  Great location (at least for us), very pleasant accommodation, quiet, clean, outstanding staff, would recommend.

title: Second Time the Charm
text: This is my second stay at the James Hotel Nomad and I can truly say that I was blown away by Glenroy and staff. Spacious suite and a bottle of champagne awaiting. Definitely a great hotel for both business and leisure travelers. The 5pm wine/cheese hour is a nice touch. Convenient location. Thank you again and I'm looking forward to my next visit.

title: Great stay at the James NoMad
text: Perfect stay at the James NoMad. Beautifully appointed suite with room to work, and relax, it even had a yoga mat! The staff was great - friendly and helpful. Loved the lobby area, it has a nice vibe. I wish I could have stayed longer and I will definitely be back.

title: Loved it!
text: So much personal service and we loved being next door to a great place to eat and have brunch--we had a Jimmy Suite and it was like an apartment--lovely and such a beautiful historic building. Neighborhood is great and we walked to and from Broadway shows happily.

title: Consigliato
text:
Come tutti sanno, Manhattan è stracolma di hotel e mai come in questo caso vale il detto "c'è solo l'imbarazzo della scelta". Ho prenotato l'albergo quindi scegliendo in base al prezzo, alla posizione e ai servizi e devo dire che sono rimasto davvero soddisfatto!
Per quanto riguarda il costo, abbiamo avuto la fortuna (prenotando con un anticipo di circa 3 mesi) di usufruire di un'offerta piuttosto vantaggiosa, e viaggiando in 4 questo fa abbastanza la differenza (tuttavia per essere totalmente onesti, i prezzi degli hotel a NY oscillano parecchio). La posizione è super: letteralmente a 3 minuti dall'Empire, a 100 metri dalla metropolitana, a 2 minuti dal Flatiron e dai negozi di Soho... insomma è tutto a portata di mano.
Le stanze sono curate, la nostra era abbastanza spaziosa, con 2 queen size, bagno non enorme ma assolutamente adeguato (con una finestra!)  e soprattutto pulito, minibar ben servito. Abbiamo soprattutto apprezzato il buffet di frutta con the e caffè al mattino che ci permetteva di iniziare la giornata con un ritmo più tranquillo, senza la necessità di scappare fuori per fare colazione (con 2 ragazzi affamati....).
Personale gentilissimo e sempre disponibile.
Se proprio devo trovare un difetto, il palazzo è piuttosto basso: non si avrà mai la vista sui grattacieli, anche se, almeno per noi, questo non rappresenta in ogni caso un problema

title: Gran servicio
text: Rosssana y Jose gran atención y Servicio. Segunda ver que vengo a este hotel... volveré de seguro En el futuro próximo. Happy hour con cheese and wine un extra positivo. Ubicación fantástica- muy central para todo - Gracias por la gran estadia.

title: This hotel is a gem.
text: This hotel is in a perfect location if you want to be central; bus up Madison, head down Fifth; hail a cab, take the Lex Local or walk a few blocks to Herald Square; connect to just about anywhere, walk to Penn Station or the Garden, etc.  The hotel is extremely well staffed and the service is excellent. It has individual temperature control in the rooms (which actually works!!) is quiet, has super modern plumbing and clean; pristine. It has an exercise facility which I did not use, and a restaurant, but I only had room service breakfast, which was fine and delivered quickly.  They serve something in the lobby around tea time, and fruit with coffee in the AM. It really is a 4.5 hotel, but only because it isn't palatial, or rather the lobby isn't palatial, because we all know about the grand old hotels that are beautiful in the lobby, but not necessarily in the rooms.  I highly recommend the hotel, and I've stayed in several in NYC over the years.  I am from NY originally, own a condo there, but do not live in it. Hence the stay in hotels when I visit.  Sometimes very central in NY, such as over looking Central Park, you are paying for location and nothing more; absolutely nothing more.

title: Jose Martinez
text:
I want to thank Mr. Jose Martinez for taking such great care of me and my daughters during a recent trip to NYC.  It was a rainy spring day and had a lot of late check outs.  My room was not ready and it was delayed getting into our room.  He took care of us through the entire stay.  Any thing I needed he was more than accommodating.  I have found my go to hotel for ALL my visits to NYC.  And my daughter will be attending FIT so I will be there a lot.  
Thank you so very much Jose Martinez..... you made a mother very happy and safe.

title: Amazing stay
text: Our room was fabulous- two queens and two showers and a giant vanity area. Perfect for our girl's weekend!  The front desk was wonderful- gave us a bottle of wine while we waited for our room since it was quite ready on time.  Location was great for walking, subway and easy uber rides to all locations.

title: A quick Birthday weekend for my daughter!
text: I recently took my 10 year old into NY for a quick stay at The James Nomad. We wee celebrating her 10th birthday as well as the end of her Spring Break. We live in NJ but going to NY for short weekends have become our tradition. Anyway, for beginning to end the staff at The James Nomad was FANTASTIC. The Assistant Director of the front desk, Glenroy really personified EXCEPTIONAL customer service. The hotel was very clean, modern and quiet. Convenient garage parking and conveniently located near everything. I will definitely visit again this Summer. My daughter had a BLAST.

title: A night of luxury and comfort
text: I stayed one night at the James NoMad.  How lucky I was to find this place.  It was very reasonable, a great location.   I arrived  just in time for the wine and cheese hour in the lobby.  A delicious Cardiff Chardonnay was served, there was a red as well, but I went for the clean crisp white. The manager gave me a lovely greeting.   My room was clean and well appointed. The bed a dream for dreams.  Great service.  I was disappointed I could not linger longer in the morning, but it was off to work, with good memories of my stay at the James.  It's a great neighborhood too.  Delicious restaurants abound in the neighborhood.

title: My home away from home!
text:
Outstanding boutique property! Customer service and professionalism simply outstanding !From the simplest request where to eat or grab coffee ...always on point with suggestions! Thanks again Rossana Marquez! Room changes very courteous.. Glen wanted to ensure I was happy and he made our weekend! My fiancée and I loved our meals at Scarpetta and dancing the night away at Seville. Thanks again to all
The staff at The James NOMAD. Will be back in June 2019!

title: Condo cleaning
text: The James Nomad was excellent. Spacious room with a great view of the city! The live jazz in the Seville Lounge was very good, and a must when you stay at The James Nomad! TOUCHE 👍  We’ve already made reservations to stay here again for our return visit to NYC in June! Kudos to the staff and management for making our stay to a most memorable occasion 👌

title: 2 night stay - the best ever!
text:
Stayed here with the CLIF BAR team after running the Boston Marathon. 
The cosiest rooms I’ver ever been to. 
Super clean. Super comfortable beds and sheets and blankets! 
Bath tub amazing for just a soak after the marathon. Very nice smelling creams and lotions. Very posh location and overall posh hotel.
Would come here again and again.

Managers & staff super friendly. 
Glen & Ken were very nice to me - extended my checkout time after they saw my Boston Marathon Medal :-)

Very sweet.

Thanks so much!

title: Lovely Hotel, Great Location!
text:
So close to the Empire State Building! Right near everything! Great location! About 20 min walk to Times Square, which may sound a lot but it really is worth the walk and seems to take no time at all! We were in NYC for my birthday! The hotel was really nice. They sent me a bottle of Prosecco up on the morning of my birthday too which was lovely!
Rooms very clean and modern too. Bathroom nice and toiletries provided and replaced daily. Beds made and fresh towels daily too! Tv in room and also bar (not free!) didn’t have any of the bar but as well as your usual alcohol, soft drinks, crisps and chocolate I noticed there was also the option to buy useful things like adaptors which I thought was great! Also a little something there for the adults at bed time if you catch my drift!! 
Staff were so friendly and helpful! Couldn’t do enough for you! Really really great! Advised us on places to eat, places to go and they also arranged transport back to the airport after our stay which was not much more than a cab, but much more luxurious and was there ready for us. Let us check out a couple of hours later too! All the staff we spoke to went out of their way, especially Dan, thank you!
The free cheese, wine and crackers were such a nice touch! And were welcomed after hours on the go! In the mornings there was tea, coffee and fruit in the lobby too! It’s early so make sure you’re an early riser! The only criticism I have and it’s not really a criticism, just a ‘would be nice’ is some tea/coffee making facilities in the room. We weren’t always up so early to catch the tea downstairs and sometimes you fancy a cuppa at night. Has a bar and a restaurant but we didn’t use it as we were so busy, never had a chance. Looked busy though so must be good! 
NYC is amazing! If you’re not eating breakfast in the hotel, go to a ‘Bread & Butter’ for brekkie! Just round the corner from the hotel! You can’t beat it! Really cheap too! We did get some hot dinner to take away there once too as it’s all fresh buffet style! Does everything you can think of and is 24hrs I believe! If it isn’t it’s definitely open late!
The James Nomad - brilliant, doubt we will stay anywhere else to be honest! We will definitely be back to stay!

title: Relaxing, comfortable stay in the heart of Midtown
text:
When visiting NYC its nice to have a comfortable base that you can come back to relax and rewind.  The staff at The James-Nomad were attentive and helpful and certainly made us feel welcome.  The room was spacious and very comfortable and the lobby was a good place to hang out as well with free coffee and fruit in the morning and free wine in the afternoon.
We also enjoyed snacks, drinks and jazz in the Seville Lounge in the lower level. The staff also secured reservations for us at the fabulous and hard to get into  Scarpetta restaurant attached to the hotel.   With the central location, we were able to walk easily to the train station and everywhere else we need to be in the 3 days we were there.  It was nice not to have to deal with the hassle of the subway or cabs getting around the city.

title: Girls weekend
text: We loved our stay. Lobby is beautiful and enjoyed the complimentary wine and coffee. Jose Martinez at the front desk was extremely helpful and made our stay extremely memorable. We loved the location and would definitely stay here again!

title: Perfect spot to explore Manhattan
text: We booked the hotel as it was recommended by my travel agent and having stayed there I can see why they use it. The location is pretty much perfect, located centrally in Manhattan it puts you in easy walking distance of most major Manhattan landmarks. If walking isn’t your thing it’s 5 mins from two major subway stations and on a number of major bus routes including the hop on hop off tourist bus, so from a practical point of view it is great. The hotel is stylish with nice rooms, extremely comfortable beds and excellent bathrooms. I’ve seen some complaints re room size on here but we were in a King and it was a decent size and we had no complaints. The thing that elevates a hotel from good to great are the staff and in this area The James was exceptional. On arrival I’d stupidly left my mobile phone in the cab and was a bit stressed, the member of staff booking us in dealt with it calmly and professionally and 15 mins later the cab driver was back with my phone. throughout the stay the staff were always extremely polite, helpful and professional and made our trip to New York a real pleasure, I would whole heartedly recommend this hotel.

title: So convenient
text: We stayed one night at the James and we couldn’t have been more satisfied. From check in to check out, breakfast, the comfortable bed and plenty of hot water for the shower. Conveniently located to the Morgan Library, Mo Math Museum and the subway. Highly recommend.

title: Helpful staff Mr Alexander Flores
text:
Very helpful in helping me change the room because of loud outside noises. Very helpful also in helping and solving further issues I had during my stay. Thanks a lot for that Alexsnder

Dr Christian Urabl

title: Higher Educator
text: This is the second time I stayed at The James. When I arrived this time Jose Martinez at the front desk remembered me from one year ago. I was very impressed that he remembered me and the great service he provided was awesome. When you come ask for Jose Martinez and say DeWayne sent you!!

title: Fijn hotel met relaxte sfeer en prima service.
text: Een absolute aanrader. We hadden eerst het PUBLIC hotel geboekt maar toch besloten om voor een wat relaxtere sfeer te gaan. The James straalt rust uit en ligt op een uitstekende locatie. Ontzettend grote kamer met twee (2-pers) bedden die geweldig liggen. Service uitstekend incl. airport taxi. De hotel bar prijzen liggen niet in verhouding met de prijzen van de kamers. Voor een cocktail betaal je min $19,00. Let e rook op dat je de bar moet reserveren. Op zaterdag avond kwamen wij niet binnen omdat we geen boeking hadden. Bar niet helemaal ons ding dus, beetje zien en gezien worden en drinken voor hele hoge prijzen. Verder top verblijf gehad.

title: The service made the stay-
text:
Normal room- but on my stay I lost my phone and my flight was canceled due to a snowstorm. 
That's when the hotel staff really stepped it up, allowing me a late check out and to store my things while I figured out how to escape NYC before another storm. 
Thanks to Joe, Rossanna, Nia came to the rescue. The porter was an awesome funny guy too. And thank you so much :)

title: Elegant hotel, great staff
text:
Stayed here for 3 nights in April for a business trip and enjoyed the great attention by the staff. The doormen were exceptional as were the front desk personnel. One staff person who stood out was a housekeeper Olivia Small who went out of her way to help me with an issue I was having with my room lights. Her customer service was stellar and I was impressed by her care and willingness to help!

The hotel is very elegant and the rooms are graceful appointed albeit small . I suppose that’s a Manhattan attribute since space is at a premium everywhere in NYC! The bathroom was nicely elegant and the properly functioning air conditioning greatly appreciated.

All in all, I’ll stay here again and recommend this luxury hotel which is close to all conveniences in town and easy walking distance to everywhere!

title: Good business hotel
text: The lobby is warm, welcome drinks etc. The rooms are a little small, we could barely fit our luggage so we had to upgrade. The location was good for business. The walks are a little thin, could hear neighbors and people in hallways.

title: Wonderful stay and amazing staff!
text:
I am staying at the James Nomad for 5 nights on a business trip and the location is amazing not to mention the great Staff from the check-in personnel to the kind and helpful cleaning ladies who are doing a great job - thank you Maria! :-) 
Melita

title: Excellent location, Excellent Staff
text:
My family and I had a great experience here, and that was mainly due to the wonderful staff. A couple of noteworthy things I saw here:

1. I had a situation where I had to move rooms due to a situation out of my control. The on-duty manager saw my situation and was able to give me an upgraded room a few doors down from the previous one - a huge time saver.
2. The staff was professional, despite some very difficult customers. I was checking in next to a couple who had apparently just made an online reservation. Immediately, the man next to me became irate and started to berate the hotel staff member who kept his cool and quietly informed the gentleman that since they booked the room online, they would need to wait a few minutes for it to hit their system. Surprisingly, that was not good enough and the man continued his tirade, completely unprovoked. Finally, several minutes later, it was all settled - I like to think of this as a good reminder - people have a job to do, so let them do it. Kudos to the training staff and to the professional staff of this hotel - customer facing jobs are difficult and sometimes that means dealing with people like this. When you handle situations like this with class, it does not go unnoticed.

All in all, a great location, staff was great, and I'd stay here again.

title: Great Hotel, Even Better Staff!
text: I stayed at the James Nomad for 5 nights on a business trip. Minutes after my arrival, I realized I forgot my wallet in the taxi to the hotel. The staff at the front desk (Nebi, Phil and Glen) were extremely friendly, helpful and supportive and helped me track the taxi driver and kept me updated on the entire process, as well as keeping me calm and entertained! It made me have such a positive impression on New York people and as well as the hotel. Extremely impressed at how professional, polite and friendly the staff were. The facilities are also very good and the location is unrivaled. Would highly recommend staying here. Also Nebi, Phil and Glen thank you very much for helping me find my wallet!

title: Always treated like royalty at The James NoMad!
text: My family and I came to stay over the weekend at The James NoMad and, as usual when we stay, we are treated like royalty.  Everyone we interacted with at the hotel was beyond friendly and accommodating.  However they are very aware to give us privacy.  It's such a wonderful place to unwind when walking in the city all day.  The rooms were very clean and tidy, tons of natural light coming into the room.  Every detail is thought about and prepared beforehand.  The rooms are quiet and the atmosphere at the hotel is super cool, but relaxed at the same time.  I am so excited to book our next stay in the city at The James.

title: New York Hotel with Reasonable Prices
text: This was a well priced hotel in New York City for March, 2019. Our room featured an extremely comfortable bed and consistent hot water for our showers. The room was kept neat, clean and tidy by their housekeeping staff. However, there were some negatives. The bathroom was tiny with a huge rock sink. It was difficult to know where to put your stuff. The furniture was mid-century in design, and lacked enough drawers and closet space for one week's worth of clothing. My husband used the tiny closet for his clothes as he was on business, and I left my clothes in the suitcase. I did not feel there was enough staff working at the front desk, causing a long wait. Be aware there are many steps to the front lobby from the street, so if you are carrying heavy suitcases you will need a bellman. It was a good value overall, but pack light.

title: What a great hotel!!!
text: The James Hotel is superb located on 29th street! The staff and the room are outstanding! All wishes and requests have been solved without any problem and very quick! The free wine and cheese reception from 5 - 6 pm every day is a nice offer and was used every day!

title: The best stay
text: We stayed with our 18 month old we had two queen size beds which was the perfect set up. The room was very clean and spacious, had everything you need. We had a very comfortable stay, location was perfect. Staff friendly and helpful, we will be back. Thank you for your hospitality :-)

title: Fantastic place & staff
text: The James Nomad was fantastic in every way!  It was very clean, the staff was very attentive to our needs and went over and above to any questions or needs we had. First staff member we met was Ashraf at the door. He immediately greeted us with enthusiasm making us feel welcomed and proceeded getting all our luggage out of the cab. Stayed with us as we checked in. Which was quick and easy and highly customer friendly. Anytime we needed assistance, immediate action was taken whether it was front desk staff such as Rosanra, Kent, Alexander or the bellmen: Basem, Ashraf and Daniel. I know I’m missing some staffs’ names but everyone were great. We especially loved Basem with all his knowledge and recommendations of restaurants. We had our best meal ever at Rocco’s which Basem recommended as well as making our reservations.   The James Nomad was totally awesome and definitely would stay again when visiting NYC.

title: Fabulous stay and can’t wait to come back!
text: I have never been to New York and my 16 yr old picked this hotel! We wanted something central to everything we wanted to see and this hotel was perfect for that!  Empire State Building was walking distance and we even walked from Canal st back to the hotel so we could take all the sites and stores in!!

title: Jose - Great Customer Service Professional
text: We've just arrived at The James for a "girls trip" with my mom, sister, sister in law, daughter and niece.  I had been planning the trip for weeks and settled on The James for the location, decor, type of rooms, and of course, the price.  It seems to be everything we are looking for so far, but I thought an "upon arrival" comment might be helpful.  Jose was on duty the my family checked in and to be honest, the rooms weren't exactly as we had hoped.  Every "older" remodeled NY hotel has some rooms that are great and some that aren't so great.  We happened to get a few that are not that great.  All we had to do was bring the issue to Jose's attention and he was on it!  He listened carefully, immediately came up with some suggestions, gave us keys to "preview" the rooms, and then helped us change to much better rooms. The entire time, he was professional, friendly and a great problem solver.  I so appreciate being able to work through issues when they happen - and Jose is a great asset to this hotel!

title: DISAPPOINTED!
text: My husband & I have stayed here several times, and this is the first time we were disappointed!  Our shower leaked; we told the staff several times and it was not fixed in the 4 days we were there.  The morning coffee in the lobby is nice, but the coffee was terrible and not even close to hot.  I switched to tea.  The doormen stood around talking and were not helpful in any way.  On a good note, the room was lovely & the bed very comfy.  We understood it was a sold out hotel.

title: small rooms
text: nice check in but really small rooms and bathrooms for the price. Comfy bed. no coffee maker or tea in the room. Not much as far as amenities. coffee in the lobby. Good location for what we were doing but trying to hard to be hip  and not giving the thoughtful extras.

title: Great hotel, great location and The Staff makes ALL the difference!
text:
We recently stayed at the James NoMad for 4 nights.  My wife, 2 teenage children and I visited the city with our Bernese Mountain Dog.  We stayed at the James NoMad due to our past experiences with the James brand and chose it due to its proximity to the dog friendly Madison Square Park.

From the moment we arrived the Staff went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable. A special Shout Out to José and the entire front desk and door staff who made us feel like we were at home.

Great job.

title: Great Location and Super Staff
text: We stayed here over New Year's and had a great time. We are a family of 3 and after seeing the first room we thought we needed something different. The manager on duty showed us 2 other rooms and we ended up settling for the 1st one, but it was great to have the option and see what else might work. The rooms are nice and clean and modern. We ordered room service on New Year's eve and brought it to the lobby and played cards till midnight. It was a very rainy night so staying in was perfect for us. We had a view from our lobby window seat (when the clouds let up) of the Empire State Building and that was cool. I love this location because it's easy to get uptown or downtown from here. And it's close to Madison Square Park which I love. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great location, beautiful hotel
text:
We came here for a one night anniversary celebration, and couldn’t be happier with our selection of staying at the James New York - NoMad. 

The hotel was very well maintained and upscale, with a very helpful staff. The rooms are a big small (it’s an old building after all) but plenty of space. The bed was very comfortable and the amenities in the room were very nice. The hotel offers cheese and crackers in the afternoons and fruit and coffee in the mornings.  

The mini bar was very impressive, although a few of the adult unmentionables were a bit surprising!  Fortunately, we didn’t have any kids with us on this trip!  

We were able to get a late checkout, which was a big plus!  It’s also in walking Distance to the Empire State building, Penn station, and many great restaurants. 

When we come back to NYC, the James will definitely be one of our targets!

title: Great Hotel
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights last week, great welcome on arrival after long haul flight. No queuing and straight into complimentary cheese and wine in the lounge for “Happy Hour”

Good sized rooms and very comfy beds.  Powerful shower and great mini bar.

Everything you could want.

If your into fitness they had a large gym and next of all two good condition Peloton Bikes.  The hotel is also really handy for the Peloton Studio just a couple of blocks away.

Looking forward to coming back sometime soon.

title: Gorgeous Hotel
text: We stayed here almost by accident - after a plane cancellation from Toronto to the Caribbean we took the opportunity to reorganize to have a stopover in New York and picked the James as a 12 hour stay, mid winter, with no winter clothes packed. It was the perfect choice - the room was beautiful and comfortable, the hotel public spaces fantastic (I LOVED the carved marble sink and general design), and the staff were fun and friendly. In order to avoid going out into the polar vortex we stayed in the hotel for dinner and drinks, and asked local friends to come join us. The restaurant Scarpetta was also excellent, full and boisterous, but also happy to squeeze we and our friends into a shared table - thank you to the maitre'd for fitting us into a packed house! We loved this quick stay and would highly recommend the hotel.

title: Tiny sized modern rooms within walking distance to subway
text:
Stayed for over a week at The James Nomad. 

Location:
The location itself is great. Walking distance to the subway and stone throw from Korea town. Several cafes/restaurants in the area.

Room:
The hotel is modern, beautiful lobby however the room was TINY. Just enough to fit the bed, no window with a view or space for a desk; which wasn't great for business purposes. Felt like they could have included a desk at the very least. Because of the space (or lack there of) could not relax in the room. The walls were very thin - there were people shouting in the corridors at all hours (esp on weekends) which would wake us up. It could've also done with a more thorough clean. I had lost the back of an earring so was searching the floors - it definitely could've done with a vacuum! Service could have been improved - requested for filtered water but this never arrived. The biggest downfall was the strong stench of weed in the corridor spilling into the room for days on end. Raised this to reception but never heard back from them.

title: Great business hotel
text: Great location, quick check in and out, super friendly staff, very cool amenities with Widow Jane Whiskey in the minibar - very impressed with the hotel on all levels. Wish I could have stayed longer.

title: Love the James and Kenny!!!
text: We love staying at The James. We stay here every time we’re in nyc because the top service and great location. The staff is always nice and make us feel so comfortable. We especially love Kenny! He’s always so happy, helpful, and conversational. Always looking forward to our next stay at our home away from home.

title: The most amazing time and wonderful Staff!
text: I’m from NY. I wanted to have my 40th bday bash in one of their suites. I chatted a couple days before with Hector, a front desk clerk, and he was amazing! He was very accommodating! He upgraded me to the Penthouse the morning of my birthday party!!! During the party they were great with giving us ice and even came up to take a group picture! I can’t say enough about Hector and the whole staff of The James NoMad! I would recommend it to anyone for a fun nights stay. Thanks guys for a wonderful evening! You made it very special!!!!

title: Typical NYC
text: The rooms are tiny & I assume the designer was fired because the bathroom door doesn’t open all the way as the toilet is in the way. There is no desk in the rooms so terrible for the business traveler. The walls are thin so you hear every conversation in the next room...not great at 11 pm.

title: Excellence at The James Nomad
text: We have stayed at the James Nomad on four occasions in the last two years. I love the location, the service, the amenities in the rooms, the beds are really comfortable and most of all the people are GREAT! I have seen Ashraf and Phillip each time we visit.  They are always so welcoming and friendly. This visit Doomie, Hector, and Jose introduced themselves to make sure I was being taken care of and asked if there was anything I needed. The night  manage on Feb 21(ThursdayPM/Fri.AM) when I checked in was amazing!  I'm sorry I didn't get his name to include in this review. The hotel definitely meets my needs and the staff makes me feel welcome. The James Hotel has become another reason I look forward to visiting New York and has earned my loyalty.  I will definitely stay at the James Nomad again!

title: Business manager
text:
Great service, nice to deal with pleasant people.Had the feeling they were glad I was there. Good location, away from the tourists area of Times Square 
but walkable to great areas of the city. Nice touch having a wine and cheese setup in the lobby in the afternoons

title: A Great Night in Nomad
text: The staff at TheJames are excellent and make you feel at home. The hotel has a great location to get to the Theater District and many great restaurants. The rooms are spacious and quiet even on a busy street.

title: Well-priced lodging
text: The location of the James is a convenient walk to Penn Station, the Flatiron District and Union Square, among other destinations. The rate is very reasonable in relation to other NYC properties and the service is excellent. The king sized room is “roomy” enough for a couple and the bathroom has a spa-like feel. The bed allowed for a good night’s sleep until the sanitation crews or dumpster emptiers arrived! The din was deafening even on the 7th floor. More substantial window treatments might help mitigate the noise. We were only there for a one night stay but would consider a longer stay the next visit to NYC.

title: Top Notch Service!
text: Great experience!  Had a little staycation at the James Nomad and it was really nice.  The room was comfortable and well designed. The staff was very accommodating and made us feel right at home.  Even had a crib that I requested in the room for my 10 month old. Will definitely recommend the James to our friends.  Thanks again.

title: Frequent and Happy Business Traveler
text: Excellent hotel with a great location and superlative service.  Clean and well appointed rooms.  The staff is comprised of wonderful people ranging from Ramon and the valet team who will greet you at the front door to the teams at the front-desk and housekeeping team.  They go out of their way to make you feel welcome.

title: Excelente!!!
text:
El hotel lo tiene todo, excelente ubicación, las habitaciones son amplias nuevas limpieza excepcional, silencioso camas cómodas y un servicio de primera.
He tenido la oportunidad de venir a Ny muchas veces durante los últimos 20 años y este es el primer hotel donde me he quedado más de 5 veces ya que servicio del personal ha sido maravilloso Jose Martínez de recepción es muy atento y hace sentir a los huéspedes en casa.

title: Best birthday Weekend Ever
text:
The staff at the Hotel James went above and beyond to ensure my birthday week celebration was bar non.  From Jose and Phillipe at the front check at check-in to Nia on the night shift, every effort was made to make me feel special and no request was ever treated with an eye roll, but rather a smile and an acceptance of a challenge.  I'm not a difficult guest, but I did have a few requests that went outside the scope of my basic reservation (which was unbelievably affordable).  From a request about my room to having my restaurant left over reheated in a microwave, they made sure it was all taken care of in a timely fashion and until I was satisfied.  What a rare experience to have these days.
The room itself is just beautiful.  I happen to be in a corner room with a bay window overlooking two major New York City streets.  Its magical at night.
The room has a king bed and is just huge by NYC standards.  The bathroom is modern with the marble sink and the glass enclosed shower.
I would highly recommend this mid-priced, but luxury style hotel.
Thank you everyone on staff!!

title: Valet
text: Roman and Manny provided outstanding service both valet parking and handling our baggage.  Such a pleasure to have service of this caliber.  Great location.  lovely modern decor in a classic elder statesman building.  Thoughtful amenities.  Excellent bedding.

title: EXCELLENT STAY
text: had the pleasure of staying at the James Nomad as a last minute decision. Although i arrived quite late, the Manager (NANA) i think that's the right spelling was very nice , set up a wake up call for us, asked if wanted complimentary water( which we did ). Room was very spacious and bed so comfortable . will be back

title: Awesome hotel in perfect location
text: The James NoMad was a wonderful place to stay. The location is awesome, happy hour in the lobby, rooms were spacious, and a very cool bar in The Cellar. This was our second visit and we will certainly be back.

title: Bellmen
text: Service was great.  Particularly Ashraf, Roman and Danny at the front door / helping move our many pieces of luggage.  The room was above average and the relatively recent renovation was done very well.

title: Wonderful stay in New York
text: The James is a great place to stay for your visit to New York. Convenient to so many things with many close choices for dinner or drinks. Great staff, happy hour drinks and great coffee in the morning in the lobby.

title: Beautiful hotel and great location!
text: The staff was very accommodating and we were pleasantly surprised at how spacious the rooms were. We had a suite with two bathrooms which was perfect for  5 women. If I get the chance to go back to New York I will definitely stay at the St James.

title: Great Service, Amazing Atmoshphere and Chic Rooms
text: Great experience. People offering to help from the moment we got out of the uber. Really cool atmosphere with Scarpetta and downstairs Seville bar. Interior design is unique, luxurious, and not too stuffy or gimmicky.

title: Cute, but that is about as far as it goes
text:
Room:
very tiny room, no desk, alcohol in the maxi bar for 20 people, lavatory about the size of that in business class on a 747, one chair that reminded me of the cafeteria chairs in elementary school, $20 bagel (when you add room service fee and gratuity), view and serenade of the HVAC return pipes, soft lumpy bed that required a Lunesta for sleep.

Service:  Asked concierge for the location of a restaurant for my dinner meeting (OK, could have used Google, but I was running late).  Set me 1.5 blocks from the place.

OK, full disclosure, I am a top elite member of a global chain and am used to better.  But even though I could have afforded the penthouse at this place, I wanted to see how they treated a normal guest.  Now I know.  Probably will try the global chain one a block and a half away next time.

But.  It is cute...

title: Great stay
text: Great stay.  Really good central location with lots of restaurants near by.  Service (except for bar in basement) is exceptional, top notch and friendly!!!  Rooms are comfortable and decent size especially for NYC.

title: Awesome service and beautiful , clean rooms!
text: The James New York- Nomad is top notch! The wine and cheese in the evenings and complimentary coffee in the a.m. just adds to the impeccable service we received. Joseph one of the Bellman and Roman the doorman were there at every turn helping with bags , information and so helpful in every way. I will stay again!!

title: Thank you to Julio the Doorman
text: The staff at the hotel was very accommodating when addressed. Nonetheless I had substantial issues with the heating in my room that went unaddressed, but I found my own solution (which should not be necessary). Good location, good restaurant and bar. Julio the doorman took good care of us coming and going, thank you Julio!

title: Wonderful stay at The James!
text: Stayed at The James for 3 nights and enjoyed the hotel atmosphere, wonderful room, breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese and the exercise room had great equipment. Hotel is at a central location too! Great rates! Highly recommend The James. I will stay there again!

title: The Best Hotel In NYC
text: I’m extremely picky when it comes to hotels and you can’t get better than this one! Extremely spacious rooms (which are difficult to find in NYC), super clean, and an AMAZING staff! Glen and Doomy welcomed us and made sure we felt like we were at home during our entire stay! The rest of the staff was incredible too, super friendly, and always helpful. Anytime we plan weekend getaways to NYC, The James Nomad will be our choice of stay. It should be yours too, you won’t be disappointed! ❤️

title: Nice Quiet Hotel in NYC but still good location
text: Nice hotel tucked away in a quiet section of NoMad.  Walking distance to good restaurants like Marta, The Smith and Ulivo.  We also walked  to Flatiron and Chelsea Market from the hotel.  Very nice view of Empire State walking back to The James.  Beds were comfy and we slept well.  We were not happy though with the way our Lyft driver was treated by hotel staff manning the doors.  This hotel staff rudely gestured to our driver to move when he was trying to park to unload us.  What was he thinking?  That the driver was there for no reason?  Another con was the slow-moving drain in the shower/tub combo.  Just so happens to be one of my pet peeves with hotel stays.  Overall experience though is still good, and will recommend.

title: Amazing location. Great rooms. Outstanding service.
text: The rooms are really cozy and clean. The hotel is relatively close to all the important places, like walking distance. The staff at the front desk is always friendly and willing to help, the Beltman Ashraf was helpful and really nice. I highly recommend this hotel. And just to mention that I always stay here and recommend it to my people.

title: Great hotel
text: We chose this hotel after our original hotel was getting renovation work. A family of 4 adults travelling for my daughters 21st birthday. Nice lobby with friendly staff. We upgraded from a james suite to a 2 bedroom suite which was ideal and a good size. The linen and towels were pristine and white. The view from our room 1116/1118 had a great view of the Empire State Building.Complimentary tea,coffee and fruit available each morning 6.30-8.30. Complimentary cheese and wine each evening 5pm-6pm was perfect. Good location would definitely return to stay at this hotel on our next visit to New York.

title: JOSEPH MAKES THE JAMES
text: We stayed here for a night with some family and family friends. The hotel itself is incredibly modern and clean and the staff was very accommodating. They serve wine and cheese at 5pm so we went and one staff member in particular made our experience phenomenal. Joseph was very kind and went out of his way to make sure we had a good time. He deserves props!

title: The only place I stay in NYC!
text:
I travel to New York a couple times a month for work, and the James NOMAD is the ONLY place I’ll stay. The Beds are very comfortable with big Pillows, the TV’s are well sized, and the surrounding neighborhood has great restaurants and bars, yet the hotel feels peaceful. 

The Staff here is top notch all around, but I’d like to specifically recognize a few individuals who make my stay especially nice. The front desk staff, Hector and Guadeloupe, are especially good at making my hotel stay feel more comfortable.  Checking in, they make you feel right at home with friendly banter. They are very helpful and fun. 

As a regular it feels like checking in with friends rather than a transaction. They’re always there to help, and go the extra mile to make sure my stay each week is great. All too often kind gestures and great service go unrecognized, so I thought it was important for Hector and Guadeloupe to get the credit they deserve. 

If your checking into the James NOMAD, you are already in for a great stay, if you’re fortunate enough to be helped by their all-star front desk staff, they’re helpful nature and fun personalities will make it even better.

title: Work trip with great hip perks
text:
My stay here was a DREAM and quite different than most other hotels in the area. It's classy and hip without being outrageous and overwhelming. Scarpetta is attached and has incredible Italian food. There's a sweet bar/lounge in the underground that's hip and hot and has great live music - top-knoch jazz during my visit. Drink prices are pretty high though, the only complaint. 

Ask for the front desk guy Jose M... he is a hero and incredibly accommodating. He is THE BEST!

title: Just Average
text:
3.5 stars. This was our first time staying in NYC, we've taken day trips from Philadelphia, but this time we wanted to stay a little longer. We booked The James Nomad as it was part of the LHRC through our Chase card. Maybe we had high expectations. We pulled up to valet and there was no one to be found, we waited a good ten minutes then just decided to find garage parking nearby. we arrived around 1 and our room was ready. However, as part of our Chase parks, we were able to get a free upgrade to a Jimmy Suite, which was not ready. Was told we'd get a call when it was. We never got a call. 

The room itself was spacious - for NYC. It was like 2 rooms put together...there was one main entrance then split into 2 rooms - one had a King size bed and a bathroom and the other had a sofa bed and a bathroom. Although we had 2 bathrooms, they were tiny! No counters space and the hair dryer did not work. There was a decent view from our window, but the windows were dirty. There were dirty spots here and there, think housekeeping could've done a better job.  

Dining - There's a mini bar that was conveniently stocked with drinks and snacks, but its pricey. We, fortunately, has a credit so we did utilize some items and the room service as well. We did order a lobster roll from room service, and it was HORRIBLE. It tasted like can tuna. We couldn't even finish it. And with the fees, tax, and tip, it was over $50.The worst experience however was our 2 free breakfast that was included with our credit car offer. We took our vouchers down to Scarpitta and was offered pastries and coffee for the vouchers. NO meat, fruits, anything. We were appalled, so we just left.

During checkout the room service and mini bar items were taken off the bill (from our credit); however, it showed up on my credit card a few days later. It took forever to reach someone about it, but it was eventually credited back to me. The good things about the hotel is the location - we walked to Korea town and Empire State building. And the lobby is pretty nice. Customer Service was neither here nor there. Being a Chase sapphire reserve card holder, there was no special treatment as stated when booking, but that's ok. We'd been ok with standard service, but just wasn't there.

title: Good location for those who prefer to walk
text: We stay at The James just right before X'mas for 6 nights.  The location of the hotel is very good since everything is in walking distance and we did walk from hotel to Central Park and really enjoy the walk with good breeze.  This is a good way to explore Manhattan.  Room is not too big but it's a good size for the hotel in NY.  There are couple of things i would like to recommend.  There should be a kettle in the room instead of telling the guest to get the coffee/tea at the lobby since it's inconvenient for guests to go down for a cup of hot water/tea.  I believe with such rate that you charge for the hotel ($350 per night) you could afford to provide kettle in the room.  Also i ask the hotel for extra blanket since i've paid for 3 people to share the same room but the hotel said there's no extra blanket which is a surprised to me since 4 stars hotel should be able to accommodate guests with such request.

title: Amazing customer service
text: We had reserved a room through a third party months in advance and paid for it; since we had never had an issue before we didn't care to verify the reservation with the hotel. It's check-in date and we arrive at The James NY NoMad after flying several hours to find out the party that had completed our reservation had cancelled it 10 days before our arrival and never notified us. Imagine being stranded out of state, with cancelled hotel reservation, hotels all around sold-out and rates over $400 per night (right before the holidays/December) and traveling with a toddler. The manager on site went the extra mile to help us find a room and even though it was $100 more than we had already paid, the service provided by all the staff in the hotel made up for it. The room was cozy and spacious, bigger than we expected given the pictures we had seen when we first made our reservation. I would definitely consider the hotel if traveling to New York in the future. Thank you to all the staff at The James NY NoMad.

title: Best stay in NYC
text: The friendly, efficient, and customer focused staff at the James Nomad is your first encounter with the hotel, they alone are worth multiple return trips.  Hector, Roman, Glenn and the rest graciously work to ensure your stay starts on the perfect note.  The lobby is a warm, welcoming and an excellent piece to meet people for a quick meeting during your stay.    The rooms are bright, airy, contemporary with a bathroom and a great shower, but the bed is what will make it memorable - just right to ensure relaxation and  a good night's sleep.     The whole package makes me a repeat customer and a champion of staying their to my friends.

title: Fabulous!
text: Beautiful hotel in a great location! We had a suite for 5 of us & there was plenty of room. The hotel staff is very welcoming. The bell boy Joseph was super friendly & helpful! Will definitely be back!

title: The James nomad
text: Nos hospedamos por una semana. Muy cerca de todo . Podíamos ir cami ando hasta el centro de Manhattan como al Soho. Impecable las instalaciones.  Nos recibió Guadalupe muy amablemente y todo el personal fue muy amable si bien no incluía el desayuno siempre teníamos a la mañana nuestra taza de café para salir a recorrer y comprar u as donas en el camino.   Excelente opción, muy cerca de cualquier medio de transporte lo que nos permitió conocer todo lo que teníamos previsto

title: My Favorite Hotel and Staff in New York City
text: I stay at the James Nomad almost weekly and have many choices in New York City.  The staff at the James Nomad is unrivaled for friendliness and caring.  I consider many of the staff to be friends, but am still treated with respect and courtesy.   I recommend this hotel for any traveler.  When you visit, make sure to introduce yourself to Joseph, Manny or Miguel at the door.  When you check in, you are most likely to be greeted by Hector as he is at the desk more than anyone.  Hector will set you up with whatever you need. Hector and the reception team of Guadalupe and Jose will have you relaxed and at ease the second you start speaking with them. Ashraf (apologies if spelled incorrectly) will help you with luggage or storing bags.   Please take the time to get to know your hosts, they are all incredible people.  The management team is also unparalleled, but you won’t really need to speak with them because all the staff is so empowered and capable.  The management staff are fun and interesting, so make sure to strike up a conversation if you see them at the evening wine mixer in the lobby.

title: Modern hotel in excellent location
text:
Stayed over Christmas in a James suite, room was large and modern albeit was noisy with a constant buzz from machinery which the hotel couldn’t do anything about.

The restaurant and bar amazing and the staff incredibly helpful.
The location is great!

title: Couldn't have asked for more
text: I spent a 3 nights at the Nomad and i have to say i left extremely impressed. The Manager Nana set the tone from the very beginning. He was incredibly professional and ensured that all of my needs were met. Room cleanliness was superb and i will definitely be returning to this hotel.

title: Bien situé
text:
Hotel bien situé, chambre petite, mais parfait pour un séjour à New-York. Première nuit super tranquille, mais la 2e nuit fut l'horreur, une gang de jeunes venue faire le party pour le temps des fêtes. Nous qui voulions se reposer sans enfants.... Personnel très gentil. Roman le portier nous a beaucoup aidé pour le stationnement et nous n'avons même pas eu à payer rien, car il nous a trouvé une place dans la rue. Nous lui avons remit un bon pourboire. Hotel super propre. Il y a des frais de resort que je ne comprend pas pourquoi, car il n'y a rien de spécial dans cet hôtel.
Bref, j'y retournerais

title: TOP Hotel near Empire State Building
text:
We have spend 3 nights at the James NoMad Hotel with our kids. After a long flight we  were enjoyed about the friendly and quick check in. Our rooms were generously and modern but especially quite for the city which never sleeps. Location is perfect, walking distance to central park, Highline etc. In the morning there is a free coffee and tee, small snacks and fruits, in the evening we were happy about a free glass of wine before going out for dinner.
We will be beack soon hopefully.

title: Awesome stay at the James Hotel!
text: Our stay at the James Hotel-NoMad was great! The room was nice and spacious. The location was fabulous. We were able to easily get around to all the places we wanted to see. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again. Special thanks to Julio, a super friendly and helpful doorman!

title: Wahou! Génial!
text:
Je conseil vivement cet hôtel. Nous y avons séjourné 1s du 25.12 au 1.01. Petit hôtel (14 etages) acceuil et service impeccable. Les chambres sont spacieuses, propres, bonne literie et grande salle de bain. 
Le seul point négatif mais comme beaucoup d hôtel a NY c est le manque de rangement. 
Quartier très bien au calme et proche des stations de métro. 
Si je dois retourner à NY ce sera la bas .

title: Outstanding Hotel in best location of NYC
text:
We - family of 5 - spent several days in the James Nomad. We experienced excellent service from friendly staff at entrance and reception. Rooms are big and furnished stylishly with most comfortable beds. Bathroom is completely modernized. Free coffee and tea in the morning and wine and cheese in the afternoon. The location is perfect, right by the Empire State Building. We also enjoyed the amazing Italian restaurant in the Hotel. 
Perfect hotel for a city visit or business trip.

title: Good Service & Location
text:
All in all a very well-appointed hotel with friendly and courteous service. We visited for the holidays and the proximity to all the Christmas sightseeing staples is very good. 

We booked through a discount website and got a very good rate for the time of year. That said, you get what you pay for and while nice and comfortable, the room was extremely small. In fact, there really wasn’t even enough space to move around the room with luggage, but again, given the price it was not unexpected.

Lastly, one minor issue when we arrived was the hotel valet’s offer to personally park our car on the street for half the price versus the garage advertised that the hotel partners with. Having driven into the city quite often it wasn’t a big deal but I would caution others who don’t not to fall for that.

title: Reserved room not ready at 6:30pm....Don’t waste your time & money!
text: My friends and I decided to do a girls trip to nyc. We were so excited and decided to stay here because of its location. Long story short we made a huge mistake! We arrived a little early... around noon . We were told our king deluxe room was not ready and we were ok with this since we were early. We left our bags there and went exploring. We came back to the hotel at 6:30pm and were told the room we reserved 3 weeks ago was not available but a smaller room was. We questioned how a room we reserved 3 weeks ago was not available at 6:30pm?! We were told “there are a lot of late check outs.” We looked at each other as to how that was our fault? The receptionist and the manager , kent, kept telling us to look around and see that we weren’t the only ones waiting for a room and that there were families with kids waiting, etc. We were so appalled ! The service was terrible and I would never stay here again! The check in and check out process is time consuming.  There are many hotels in the area so I would recommmed spending your money elsewhere to avoid the inconvenience.

title: Nice place
text:
The james is a beautiful hotel. Good location. Friendly staff. Room is rather small but comfortable. The lobby area tastefuly decorated. We enjoyed the 5 pm wine reception very much.
Unfortunately there are no coffee making facilities in the room and the complimentary coffee in the lobby starts rather late (they say 6 am but on both days of our stay it was well after 6.30)

title: Amazing staff
text: I stay at the James this past December for work, Arrived really late due to a late flight. I had a pleasure of meeting Nana (night manager). He was very professional and checked me in right away, i was really hungry so he suggest some places nearby. Hotel's lobby is beautiful, the rooms are nice and clean. Every staff i had interacted with was always smiling and professional. Thanks to Nana i will always choose The James for my stay in NYC.

title: Way to small rooms
text: The hotel is actually ok but the rooms are way too small, especially if you are together with your partner. As you open the door you can literally jump on the bed. Few storage room for your luggage and the bathroom is cold. Windows are not cleaned and therefore nothing to see outside. To avoid if you travel with a partner.

title: Great hotel and fantastic location
text: Arrived and greeted by Joseph the porter - what a great guy; really welcoming and helpful. Hotel nicely cool and contemporary and staff v friendly. Drawbacks: had to report tv not working several times without resolution but then made a fuss and was resolved quickly with a credit on our account by way of apology. Room laundry a bit hit and miss.  Started with towels, floor mats and flannels but after that it was anyone’s guess whether you’d have floor mats and flannels (we didn’t mostly!). But…the most comfortable beds, great location, friendly helpful staff and Joseph saw us off again with good humour and the wish we’d return. We will. Definitely would recommend this place in spite of the tv issue.

title: Great Hotel, Friendly staff
text: We arrived at The James hotel on Christmas Day evening and was greeted at the door and reception by the friendly staff. We stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay.  The bed was very comfortable and we slept better than in our own bed at home.  We had booked a car a private car through our travel agent to take to the airport (nothing to do with hotel) we waited an hour and no car turned up but Julio (doorman) looked after us and ordered us a car which turned up in 10 minutes, very helpful, Thank you Julio we did not miss our flight thanks to you. Also a big thank you to the cleaning staff our room was very clean while we were there.  The bellman, Ashraf was very helpful also and very friendly and polite. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and would personally stay here again as it is also close to some of the big sightseeing attractions.  Thank you all for our great Christmas break 👍🏼

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
Having stayed in this area on a trip to NYC 18 months previously, we decided to do the same again but choose a different hotel for variety. We chose The James as although it seemed more modern as opposed to cool and contemporary, we would be moving on to another in Brooklyn two days later and so wanted to spend a little less on our Manhattan hotel. My expectation therefore wasn't particularly high, especially as reviews hadn't been great (although it looks like the reviews on here have been reset?). Anyway, I was wrong. This was a really great hotel, very accommodating and for that reason, the better of the two hotels during our trip. 

We were welcomed by two doormen and helped with our bags. Check in was fast and our room was ready. Expedia had sent me a $20 food and beverage credit plus we were advised that we were each allowed a complimentary mini bar item each night.

Room was one of the smallest they do but still a good size - bathroom was really quite big! Mini bar was cool - looks a bit art deco and good variety of items. Comfy bed, thick soft towels and useful bathroom items such as shower hat. No view really but this is Manhattan and the 6th floor so didnt expect one. Small wardrobe but as we were only staying for 2 nights, we didnt really unpack. Plus American Airlines had lost our bag so we had nothing to unpack on night one anyway!!

We went to the hotel's speakeasy Seville Bar a for a few (gorgeous) cocktails whilst discussing where to go to buy some items of clothing to get us through the evening and the girl behind the bar was very friendly and offered up some places to go. But not before we enjoyed the complimentary cheese and wine in the lobby.

The weather was horrendous and so both days the door guys offered us umbrellas and went to find more when they had run out. When our bag finally arrived, it was brought up straight away after calling reception as it arrived in the middle of the night. We found the baggage guy and doormen to be really great - Julio in particular made sure doors were opened, umbrellas were available and taxis if we needed them. 

We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but a cup of coffee in the lobby area was useful and it was a nice bright place to stay in. Wifi was good and everywhere was clean and tidy. I really liked the minimal Christmas tree in reception too!

This hotel is in a fantastic location and I'd recommend. I really like the Nomad area as its easy to get to on the Green Subway line so makes travelling from the Airport on subway relatively easy, but also its right by the Empire State - such an amazing building and a great marker for knowing where you are!

title: Great Stay and Perfect Location
text: The James was a great pick to be in the heart of midtown but far enough to get some breathing room from the large holiday crowds and sites. We booked through Priceline and got an amazing deal for midtown. The room was perfect to crush and have a home base. Wine down was delightful in the lobby. The only negative was they were understaffed due to the crowds ( i.e. 1 bell hop ) which we waited 30 minutes to check a bag and to retrieve it. Also the $40 a night “ resort fee” is a little absurd considering their is no spa or pool.

title: Busy weekend in NYC
text: This hotel has a lot to offer with its convenient location, great friendly service, convenient valet parking, and nice rooms make this a great place to stay. Delicious room service menu and reasonably priced for such a great location   We enjoyed the Christmas decorations and complimentary friendly wine and cheese. Highly recommend, great place to stay.

title: Roman
text: We had a great stay at the James and Roman was very accommodating throughout the week. He was also very helpful with unloading and loading our luggage. Overall the service here was great and we would certainly stay here again for future visits.

title: Miss
text: Would highly recommend staying at the James New York nomad, staff are exstremly kind and helpful, Rooms are clean stylish and comfortable. Perfect location in walking distance to centrel and surrounding restaurants. View of Empire State Building outside hotel.

title: The James is Still The James!
text: Still Wonderful! The changes were merely subtle, and the disco, still my favorite, exists! I am still trying to figure out why Tripadvisor rebranded this hotel? My review stands as it was, really terrific!

title: The jewel of NoMad
text: Second time time staying there and have to say the hotel and well the staff were great. Closed to subways and shopping areas. Room super clean and nice decor. The staff Jayda & Hector were fantastic. Manny and Miguel you guys rock at what you do. Joseph thanks for the help. If staying in NoMad the James is the right hotel

title: Hip, unpretentious hotel in midtown
text: I had a great stay at The James NoMad. It’s super centrally located, right next to Madison Square, which was a great base for exploring New York. We stayed in a quite which was super spacious and had a glorious view over the Empire State Building. The room was well equipped (it even had a yoga mat!) however I was disappointed there was no tea or coffee facilities. The hotel itself provided free coffee and fruit in the morning and wine and cheese in the evening which I felt was a really nice touch to making the hotel feel more communal and homely. Overall a great spot to stay!

title: Perfect location, service and amenities
text: As a holiday gift, I sent friend and her family to the James Nomad. It was a spot on experience for the adults and the children. Staff warm and friendly. Check in easy and accommodations exceeded expectations. And an easy walk to many great restaurants near the hotel. Would highly recommend this property to anyone looking for a first rate hotel experience in the Big Apple.

title: Tasteful
text: Our first stay at The James was excellent. We had a room upgrade with a nice courtyard view. Room and bathroom was was very clean with nice amenities (bath sheets).  Room was quiet.  Wine and cheese hour was appreciated.  Location was ideal for walking to several restaurants, Morgan Library and the NY Public Library exhibits.  We will return to The James NoMad.

title: Fantastic stay
text:
We visited The James for a spot of Christmas shopping, and it didn’t disappoint. Front desk were quick and efficient, the room had enough luxury to feel special, the staff were great. Now the special bits, the guys on the door always smiling and knew those special places to go, the room was spotlessly cleaned every day, there was free coffee and fruit in the lobby every day. We sat and had a coffee every morning, sitting in a window nook, looking at the Empire State Building, what a start to the day. 
We would certainly consider a return visit if funds ever allow, until then, my thanks to The James and it’s staff for a great visit.

title: Great Experience
text: The rooms as well the the staff were excellent. The staff pays attention to every little detail to make sure your stay is wonderful. Great location. Highly recommended. Looking forward to staying again in the near future.

title: Wonderful Experience
text: Everything was excellent. Facilities as well as staff. Highly recommend. The GM Patrick made sure everything we needed was handled and made the entire experience great. Can't wait to stay here again in the future.

title: A series of bad experiences.
text: The Front Desk person said that there are two set of rules for a customers.  If you book through a third party versus directly with the hotel, your room will be ready at 2pm versus 3pm. I was told read the fine print and I received an empty, robotic unsympathetic response from the front desk person. The hotel was fully booked; I understand. But the statement that I should read the fine print made me feel like a second class guest. The next day we left at 7am and returned at 3:30pm and the room was not cleaned. They apologized. The hotel had some surprise “hotel charges” that totaled $20.00 a day. We bridged two reservations and it was suggested that we re-key the plastic cards. The cards didn’t work (we made another trip to the desk to correct) and we had the maid enter the room twice while we were in the room with little to no notice. It was not a good hotel experience at all. The rooms were not very nice. If you spend much time like we did waiting for the room in the lobby, please be ready because you may experience the same lack of professionalism and inexperienced hotel staff that we did. We heard their foul language and loud communications between the porters and bellman. It was like we were not there. I can not recommend this hotel.

title: Really Lovely
text:
Stayed in deluxe room and it didn’t disappoint. Good size room and the bed was very comfy. 

Good service from the team 

The room service breakfast wasn’t great, but filled a hole 

Fully stocked bar. Maybe add a coffee maker 

Great location 

Would visit again

title: Wonderful Stay at The James Nomad
text: So an initial disclaimer - I booked through a third party site and did not pay the full room rate for my stay. That said, I stayed three nights in a standard king room and loved the hotel, and would absolutely book again. We were bouncing all over the city and thought the location was perfect since we could easily walk to any subway line. We also took LIRR to/from the airport, then walked to the hotel from Penn - very convenient. Staff was friendly. We enjoyed the wine and cheese hour the night we were here for it. Breakfast was meh, though coffee was appreciated since there are not machines in the rooms (usually a complaint but irrelevant here with so many great coffee shops within a couple blocks). I didn’t think my room was particularly small for NYC, as we had room to move around a bit and the furnishings were nice. The bed was very comfortable and can I just say - the bed had two firmer pillows and two softer pillows which I thought was brilliant for a hotel. My partner and I could then mix and match as needed, and I had a great sleep. Minimal street noise and we barely heard other guests. Again, I think if I had paid full price for my stay I wouldn’t be quite so enthused, but I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Family Thanksgiving gathering
text: Each year we travel to a different city for Thanksgiving.  Because one of the family members was having a baby in New York that was our destination this year.  I had met with Brittany in the summer to make all of the arrangements for ten rooms for the holiday weekend.  Our family was traveling from seven cities and Canada.   It was a perfect choice because of the lobby, happy hour and pleasant staff.  We had ten rooms and the doubles were great for our families with children.  Large rooms and quiet.  We plan on staying here again. The front desk was attentive, so nice and helpful.  Our ages were from 3-81.

title: Facility fee????
text:
Just stayed at The St. James for the second and last time. This time I was charged an outrageous $35 facility fee every day for having booked with American Express which they say is really Expedia.. The hotel has no facilities worth this much. Maybe it has an exercise room but I never used it. Amex bookings always gives me an upgrade but the St. James this time penalized me for it instead.
They do have very nice Italian bed sheets. Lots of pets staying in those rooms though.

title: Older hotel in a convenient location but not a great experience!
text:
Was there on a 2-day business trip. The hotel itself is very conveniently located close to Madison Ave with great restaurants and buzz around it. 

The hotel lobby seemed congested and was always crowded with lots of people gathering around ! It seemed chaotic in the lobby. The stairs and elevator were cramped but I can imagine these in a busy city like NY! The room seemed to be in a good condition but another problem with this hotel was constant construction going on right on the street below which disturbs our sleep ! Any light sleeper will have a problem sleeping here.

The few times, I had an interaction with the staff at reception, my experience wasnt that great ! Couldnt even see them smile and greet. They seemed to be very slow and indulged in their own thoughts. 

Btw, please be careful to check your invoice after you check out. I was charged for an item in the room that I did not take.

Overall, not the experience I expected from a hotel that costed over $300 per night. Would rather stay at another hotel next time !

title: Cozy older hotel
text: Nice hotel at a convenient location for the price we received through Magellan. There was a bit of outside noise in the morning (garbage trucks?), so a noise cancelling machine would help. The beds were very comfortable and the complimentary wine and cheese happy hour from 5-6 were a nice perk as well.

title: Great Hotel for our time in New York
text: Booked into The James for 4 nights at the end of November. We were very happy with our room. Two queen beds in a large room for New York with a nicely appointed bathroom. Tea or coffee together with fruit were available in the morning and in the afternoon/evening wine, cheese, fruit and crackers were supplied in the lounge area of the hotel.  The location was also a great base to start all our journeys around New York.  We were very happy with our stay.

title: Great hotel in a fab location!
text:
We stayed here over thanksgiving and were delighted with our stay. A king-sized room was generous for New York proportions and it was nicely presented, too- as was the rest Of the hotel. We found it a little strange that being a newer hotel it didn't have tv room control over the heating and lights but we figured it out in the end.
The wine and cheese in the evening is a nice touch; we were there close to the finish on one day and most things were gone but sure if we'd been earlier there'd be plenty.
Staff were very pleasant throughout our stay- even during the 4am fire alarm!
Given the excellent location and the standard of the hotel, we'd definitely stay here again. Thanks!

title: First Time at The James - Definitely Won't be the last!
text: We chose The James for our annual Christmas trek to NYC because our regular hotel became too expensive. We took a chance on The James because we like the location.
