We were pleasantly surprised, the lobby is welcoming and the rooms were quite nice. The staff - especially Julio the doorman - were great and made our stay more pleasurable. We will be back.

title: Unschlagbare Lage
text: Wir waren sehr zufrieden. Midtown Manhattan, viele Sehenswürdigkeiten in der Nähe, auch zu Fuß kann man einiges erreichen. Tolle Restaurants und Bars in Gehdistanz. Die Bar im Hotel ist ebenfalls sehr gut und wer toll italienisch essen möchte, hat "Scarpetta" im Haus. Reception kompetent, freundlich und hilfreich. Für uns war es ideal.

title: Great Hotel Great Location
text: Just stayed at The James Hotel. The hotel and staff were great especially Julio the Doorman who was always there to greet us with a smile and make sure we felt welcome! The location is great as you can walk pretty much anywhere you want.

title: I’ve seen dollhouses that had bigger rooms!
text:
My room was ridiculously small. I’m 5’5” and
I could barely turn around. No room even for a small chair!!! I laughed out loud at the offer of an in-room massage when there’s literally zero room for another person, much less a massage table. The heater is louder than the MidTown Tunnel and never shuts off. The bottles on the minibar block the TV because there’s no room anywhere else in the room. Shame on everyone involved for charging this much money for a shoebox.

title: Excellent Hotel!!
text: Great hotel. Cozy and comfortable. Comfortable bed and rooms. Beautiful, classy lobby with fruit water :) Excellent professional friendly staff especially Julio the doorman who really helped me out so much!!

title: Great NYC Location/Exceptional Service
text: Just returned from a long weekend with my wife in NYC and stayed at The James Nomad.  The James Nomad was very well located for us to explore the city.  Right in the middle of all the action but yet not crazy like Time Square.  We walked to 5th Ave, Time Sq, Rock Center and Central Park.  A longer walk to SOHO but we enjoyed all of the sites along the way.  My wife really enjoyed the (free) Yoga class that combined yoga and martial arts that was offered to hotel guests.  Live music nightly in the bar downstairs seems to attract a fashionable crowd from the hotel and locals alike.  Friendly and attentive staff that offers wine and cheese in the lobby nightly.  We will definitely stay at The James again on our next visit to NYC.

title: Great location, Not so great room
text: Let me preface to say I design hotels for a living. This hotel was clean, staff friendly and sufficiently attentive but, 4-star it is not.  Even for NYC.  The location is great – perfect for someone wanting to visit the touristy spots.  The rooms are small with no space for your luggage.  My husband and I had two carry-on size bags – there was a ledge we used for one bag and we had to use the table-top and radiator for the other.  The door barely cleared the bed when it was open/closed.  If he wanted to hold the door open for me, he had to straddle the bed corner to do so.  The bathroom was cramped without sufficient usable space for toiletries.  Our items fell into the sink so many times that we kept a towel over the sink whenever it was not in use.  You cannot have the bathroom door open while getting ready because then you cannot stand in front of the mirror.  I have lived in NYC, I have visited numerous times, stayed in many a hotel… this isn’t the case of not understanding NYC sizes.  This is the case of a perfectly nice hotel that shouldn’t be marketed as 4-star.  We didn’t take advantage of its restaurant, fitness center, etc therefore cannot comment on those.

title: Great Experience.
text:
Roman met is first thing when we pulled up to the hotel.  He made everything a snap, especially the parking!

It’s a nice laid back place.  It’s ideal for weekends in the city.  Good location.  Nice amenities.

title: Well located could be improvef
text: The hotel was in a good location in Manhattan. When I arrived my room was very cold so I put on heating, then discovered that the window was stuck open. Maintenance came and sorted this out.  The bathroom was lovely and clean, the design good but it was freezing, a draughty window and no heating.  I couldn’t persuade myself to get in the shower on the first night as the room was cold.  There was no kettle in room so I asked front desk they said a kettle would be sent to my room, I asked again, same answer.  I was really wanting to go to bed so waited.  On a third ask I was told that kettles would not be supplied - frustrating! Breakfast in Restaurant was good.  Think I’d choose elsewhere next time!

title: The best staff
text: The lobby of the James Hotel NoMad is a great place to meet with friends or business associates. The staff is friendly, helpful and committed to making sure guests have a great experience.  A special shout out to Joseph who went out of his way to be sure we had enough wine!

title: Great Base!
text:
My partner and I visited NY in November and were very careful in where we chose to stay. The NoMad really is in a great location.it feels like you’re in the centre of everything. If you’re getting around town. We found it much easier to walk. Just make sure you bring some appropriate walking shoes as you’ll be doing lots of it! You’ll also see that the roads are ridiculous busy and you’ll forever be waiting at traffics lights, if you were to get a taxi.

The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was a good size too. Fortunately the room was quiet and we hardly ever heard the outside traffic. We upgraded our room to a deluxe King which I would recommend you do too. We left a $5 tip each morning for the maid. You could probably “get away” with $3 though. 

Make sure that you get back at 5pm as they put on complimentary cheese and wine, which I am enjoying as I write this review!

title: 1st time in the Big Apple
text:
First time stay in NYC, this hotel was terrific! Wonderful location- midtown so close to everything. Rooms were big and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on. Price was right. The Seville bar downstairs was fantastic with great live entertainment. The hotel provides coffee/fruit every morning and wine/cheese every late afternoon, included in your stay.
Staff were very accommodating especially Julio at the door. He went out of his way to help us every chance he got. Definitely an asset.
Would return in a heartbeat. You won't be disappointed.

title: Excellent Service
text: Went to NYC for a girls night out. The whole staff was great but our amazing new friend Joseph Walls went above and beyond and made sure we had everything we needed. He really made our stay pleasant. We loved the wine and cheese/happy hour and the fruit infused water at the lobby, very nice touch. The location was just perfect! walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again.

title: Family Friendly / Great Location - highly recommended
text:
I came into town with my four year old daughter for Thanksgiving.  They were incredibly accommodating and very friendly to my daughter.

The door staff were all truly amazing, accommodating and helpful.  They helped us with taxis, local recommendations, etc.  The doorman Julio was above and beyond for us - he was incredibly helpful!

Location couldn't be better.  Minutes walk to subway, restaurants and numerous tourist sites.

title: Truly Hospitable
text: We went to NYC for a girls weekend and we had the pleasure of staying at The James NoMad. Needless to say, Glen (at the reception/check-in) went above and beyond and offered us a very generous upgrade. He was professional, friendly and extremely resourceful throughout our stay. We were also fortunate to have the services of Adis, who also went out of his way to take care of us and to ensure that we had everything we needed. These two exemplified what it meant to be classy gentlemen! The hotel is a bit old but that was part of its style and sentimentality. We loved the wine and cheese/happy hour every night....again, nice touch. The location was perfect for shopping, sipping and walking. Without hesitation, I would recommend this hotel.

title: The Seville at The James
text:
My siblings and I headed to The Seville in The James Hotel for evening cocktails and had a lovely time chatting with each other and Lindsey (sorry if I misspelled it) the Bartender. The cocktail that one of my brothers ordered was delightful; crisp and refreshing with a hint of citrus and light Campari bitterness on the back end. My husband ordered a Mezcal Negroni that was a perfect balance of smoke, bitter and sweet. My other brother ordered a Balvenie on the rocks, don’t mess with a good thing, and my sister ordered a slightly dirty martini and by “slightly” I mean just a few drops of dirt, to which Lindsey nailed! I ordered an amaro and while that sounds uncomplicated and blasé it was wonderful because this amaro is hard to find in the US. 
The ambiance was warm, cozy and inviting. The bar is smaller which is nice because it allows for a more intimate feeling. There is quite a bit of seating as well in the lounge/bar area in case you don’t want to sit in their restaurant. 
The Seville is a perfect place to go to have a lovely dinner, or cocktail, if you don’t feel like leaving the hotel.

title: Mooi hotel, goede faciliteiten, geweldig personeel
text: We zijn hier in november 2018 geweest en we kunnen niet anders zeggen dan dat het een fijn verblijf is geweest. Het personeel is geweldig en doet er alles aan het naar je zin te maken. Vooral Ashraf die in de receptie loopt doet erg z’n best. Alles is zeer schoon. De gym is goed. Geweldig leuke bar in de kelder waar ze ouderwets goede cocktails maken. Het restaurant hebben we niet geprobeerd, misschien een volgende keer. De locatie is goed, mooi centraal bij het empire state building om de hoek en warenhuizen als Macy’s op loopafstand. Als je een bezoek plant naar New York en het verblijf en de service gewoon goed moeten zijn is dit een geweldig hotel. Je hoeft ook aan de locatie niet te twijfelen. Wij komen graag een keer terug.

title: Family friendly and great location
text: We came for thanksgiving and it is right in the middle of everything! The elevator was out and we had our large stroller with two kids and all the doormen were very helpful each time carrying it down all the stairs for us- especially Julio was always there with a smile and a helping hand! Definitely reccomend and very clean and comfortable!

title: Love the James Nomad
text: Absolutely charming and homey feeling.  Very convenient location. Loved the window seats in the morning for coffee right along the street.  The restaurants were a 10 great service great food.  We will definitely stay again

title: New York state of mind
text: Get location, nice size room and closet, bathroom was clean and great showerBooked a Deluxe king room and was upgraded to a corner Deluxe RoomThe reservation office was great and helpful when I called to book in Sept and the front desk staff was very helpful

title: Excellent customer service
text: I had a very lovely experience with the James hotel. Everyone from the door man to the cleaning crew was so nice and friendly and made sure that our stay was as comfortable as possible. The rooms are absolutely beautiful and comfortable. I would highly recommend if you plan on staying in New York City I would recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Best serves young American business people
text:
Perhaps this is a case of "hotels like fish should only be left for 3 days before they go off". 
An extended stay magnified its faults for international travellers, the lack of tea making facilities meant that dehydration and the lack of the familiar was magnified. Fresh fruit in the morning was appreciated. Lack of other breakfast facilities disappointing. Bed was comfortable, food very expensive if you needed to stay in and not suitable for an international vegan traveller. Ageism is alive and well from the door people to the food staff i was way too old for the demographic here. The noise of the night club did not impact sleep though, but the constant parade of young underclothed things blocking the entry was a constant irritant. The household staff were generally above par, and mistakes attended to. We had a room overlooking the adjoining park, which was an interesting aspect. The so called wellness package must suit some but i would prefer to bend to the spiritual across the road to the 3 times a day prayer ritual at the Episcopalian church. All in all it probably best suits young business Americans.

title: Good
text: Nice stay, nice doorman ashraf, well located and overall a good place to stay in New York, false fire alarm in the early morning - the only negative aspect of our stay.. did not use breakfast or dinner. Rooms are nice and clean, well cleaned

title: Lovely Stay During Snowstorm
text: I was a guest at the hotel last week, and beyond the very comfortable and well appointed suite, I happened to be there the night of a terrible snowstorm that cancelled many flights. I was able to observe true customer service in how the staff handled an abundance of travelers who were unexpectedly spending the night.

title: Great Location!
text:
My husband and I stayed here for a weekend with a few friends. It’s located close to great restaurants, pubs, shopping and in walking distance of Penn Station. 

The best part of our stay was Julio, the doorman! He was so friendly and went out of his way to speak with us and let us know about a great pizza place 😁.

title: Slightly disappointing in terms of service.
text: Only thing that let this hotel down was service. Calls to reception seemed to meet with slow or no response eg a request from someone to come and take a look at the hearing - no one ever arrived. Otherwise despite the small size of the room everything and minuscule bathroom was fine. The usual noisy midtown location but great beds.

title: Amazing service
text:
We stayed at The James for four nights for work and were looked after incredibly well throughout. The rooms were immaculate but the heating was quite temperamental.

A massive shout out goes to Ashraf, the ballman. When leaving, he was fantastic. Looking after us at every turn from our bags to sorting transportation. He couldn’t have done enough for us.

When leaving, Roman was also brilliant. He helped us with a lot of luggage, sorting all logistics and making the end of our day flawless.

Huge thanks to them both and the whole team.

We’d definitely return soon.

title: Weekend Stay
text:
Stayed here for two nights as I celebrated my baby shower in NYC and it was great! I booked the suite and it was EXTREMELY spacious- especially for NYC. The bathroom was pretty good size- but what is it with hotels and these giant sinks??? People need space to put their belongings- make up bags- even my husband couldn't fit his small toiletry kit on the counter- total waste of space in my opinion. Other than that- room service came SUPER quick- so as a pregnant woman- i truly appreciated that!! Few of the things on the menus were sold out when we called for breakfast and the late night menu- had none of the kind of food one would want "late night"- would love to see an improvement in this department :)

Other than that- staff was helpful- but few times we called down to the front desk or concierge and no one ever picked up- probably a busy weekend- but still..$600+ a night- you kind of have expectations. I'd probably stay here again - as location was pretty central - and staff was generally nice!

title: Céntrico buena opción...
text:
El hotel esta super bien ubicado, las habitaciones están bonitas, chicas como en la mayoría de los hoteles de NYC pero tienen detalles padres por ejemplo en lugar de biblia te ponen libros del significado de los sueños o menú de actividades wellness. Hubo un par de detalles, una vez que consumes ciertos productos del mini bar no los reponen, lo mismo paso con los kleenex. 
Tienen un buen restaurante, el área del lobby es muy agradable. El gimnasio si está limitado y te venden la idea de las bicis pelotón pero solo hay dos y en mal estado. Pero en general el hotel es una muy buena opción para hospedarse en Midtown!

title: Great Service
text:
Julio at the door was life saver.  

Front desk was courteous and efficient.  Rooms were clean with an above average amenity selection. Location was easy to get into midtown and downtown without much of a problem. Seville bar downstairs was comfortable and the crafted drinks were excellent.   I would recommend this hotel to other business travelers. 

Cheers

title: Julio!
text:
My husband travels to NYC often for business and on occasion I am able to join him as New York as one of our favorite cities! We have stayed at The James exclusively over the last years and always enjoy our stay! We love the vibe of the hotel. It’s modern and cool but still comfortable and approachable. We also enjoy that we can walk to all of the fabulous boutiques and restaurants in SoHo and West Village too. 
On our most recent visit Julio helped us with room service a few times and he was so kind and helpful. But the James staff always is! 
We look forward to returning...

title: Loving the James Nomad Vibe
text:
My husband and two teenage daughters stayed at The James NoMad this past weekend and as native New Yorkers felt the need to share what a wonderful experience we had.  We are frequent travellers and can be quite picky at times, but The James surpassed all our our expectations from checking in earlly (this never happens in NY), to the amazingly comfortable mattress (didn't hear my husband complain about his back once), even to the wellness experience it perpetuates through its in-room services like massages. 

My children and I had adjacent rooms, but we sitll felt like we had the privacy we needed and my daughters enjoyed the movies in their room as well.  In the morning we had a great family workout in their fitness center and brunch in the restaurant.  I also loved the location of the hotel as it was simple enough to walk where we needed.

I would highly recommend visiting the James Nomad if you are travelling from out of town or even for a "staycation" like mt family did.  It's great to get away and have fun in the city.  I am looking forward to returning.

title: Much less than expected
text:
As to the room (queen bed), there were no drawers to put clothes or other items.  The closet had a shelf above the hanging rack, but that wasn't adequate.  I had to put my suitcase on the little café table in the room and live out of it.
The noise!!  There were a lot of young men staying on my floor and late (midnight) both nights I kept hearing their doors slam (no quiet close on any room doors) and they were yelling to each other in the hallways.  One night I finally opened my door and asked would they try to keep it down and in return they mocked me.  
Finally, I do not understand why they charge a $40 per night 'facility fee' ($35 + tax). What is it for?  They say free WiFi but something isn't free if you are charged for it.  And I don't think a cup of (bad) coffee in the morning and a glass of wine and piece of cheese (only for 1 hour from 5 to 6 pm) is worth $40.  You have to laugh--they don't even put out plates for the cheese and crackers so you have to put it on a 3" x 3" paper napkin.
I certainly won't stay here again.

title: Average enough stay
text: Having enjoyed a recent stay at the James Chicago, I decided to book the James Nomad for a two night stay; but I wouldn’t rush back. First experience at check-in was disappointing; Having arrived at 2:45, we were told it was likely be more than 1 hour before our room would be ready and we were advised to leave our bags. After travelling 8 hours we wanted to freshen up. At 3pm, a different member of staff happily checked us in; inconsistent service/attitude. The room was very small and sound travelled from the corridor. There was no refillable bottle of water left in the room. Nice toiletries. We’d very little interaction with the staff after check in but that initial experience tainted my experience.

title: The doorman Julio was particularly helpful; although the staff were great.
text: Centrally located in a great area. Excellent amenities like a well equipped fitness center  The restaurant in the premises is fantastic. The name is Scarpitta. Wonderful Italian cuisine. The spaghetti is to die for and the breakfast menu is exceptional.

title: Really liked hotel
text:
This was our first time at the hotel.  I really liked the location which wasn't too hectic and the hotel itself was quiet.  We liked the low key vibe and the staff was consistently pleasant and professional.
We had a lovely suite with exceedingly comfortable bed and linens.  Good night light and lighting all around.  Washroom was small but with excellent shower, toiletries, towels, mirror and a window. Free wifi and coffee in mornings. Excellent restaurant- Scarpetta.
Overall an excellent experience.  We will definitely return.

title: Voor een redelijke prijs een fantastisch hotel!
text: De kamer was netjes, schoon en modern ingericht. Dit geldt evenzo voor de badkamer en het toilet. Zeer goede, royale bedden met geweldig liggende matrassen. Zeer goed restaurant aanwezig voor een fantastisch diner. Het ontbijt doe je natuurlijk 'New York Style' en lekker buiten de deur in een van de vele take aways. Receptie professioneel en vriendelijk. Gelegen in 29th street, een rustige bijzonder sympathieke straat van New York en vanaf het hotel een '5 minute walk' naar Fifth Avenue. En daar kun je je lol op.
